sequence: A well written screenplay . A moving story showing the middle class English at it 's best . Some great comic relief in this 2 part mini series. There are a couple of things that you must remember. This series is set in the 1950's. So the clothes,the haircuts,the music ,the accent are very important. A great mini series that will have you laughing and crying all at once. Love it so much I have seen it 3 times and still don't get bored of it. Can't wait for a second series to come out.

Who could have thought a non-disabled actor could act so realistically and immensely powerfully as a disabled person in a movie? The movie "The Fault in our stars" is one of my favorites that I will never forget for the rest of my life. The main reason why this movie was so powerful to me was because the main characters in it, Hazel Grace and Gus, were both disabled in the movie. They both had to overcome many challenges, but they did it with a smile and determination. Hazel Grace, in my opinion, had the harder challenges.

I usually give horror films around 6/10 , but this one caught my eye . House of Wax was by far one of the most original horror movies I ever watched . I've seen the original House of Wax, but not in years . So I didn't know what to expect . What I was not expecting was to get scared , in a bad way , for 2 hours . I think that if it was just a little less scary, it could have been an 8/10 movie . The plot was interesting and it had an original touch to it .

This is one of my favourite Disney films . It has everything you could hope for in a Disney animation. The story is good, the songs are great, the characters are well designed, the setting is beautiful and the animation is first rate. As with all good Disney films, the heroes have to go on a long and dangerous adventure in order to save the day. They start off in their normal life in the kingdom and have to leave to a faraway magical island. There, they must complete three tasks to win the beautiful princess back from an evil spell.

My husband and I watched this last night...It was wonderful....For once he was wrong in guessing ahead of time the suspenseful ending. It moved along very quickly and the acting was superb.. I adore Tom Wilkinson anyway. He has never made a bad movie as far as I'm concerned. The above description of his acting hits the nail on the head... The facial expressions are incredible. Even the picturesque scenery is awesome. We have just finished watched all of the Prime Suspect series and I am convinced that the British have a way of capturing the audience.

This movie got better with time . I ca n't believe that it has been forty years since I saw the original Planet of The Apes as a teenager. I liked the movie a lot. The acting is excellent and the set and costumes are great. I am surprised that many of the actors have not received more recognition for their parts in the movie. This movie was the beginning of a successful franchise. I loved this movie and it has a place of honor in my movie collection . This movie ranks in my top five of the best sci fi movies of all time.

A very weird , psychedelic , esoteric , ( and did I say weird ? : ) experience.But on at least two counts I've gotta say it's one of the finest albums I've heard this year , the vocals and the instrumentation.It's actually quite catchy and fun , yet there are all these weird time and tempo changes , that at first I thought I was gonna be all messed up all the while listening to it , as I often am .But by the 5th song I was really into it and just enjoying it for the hell of it , and now I'm very into it .

It reaches the minds and feelings of everyone driving them deep in the black desert. A brutal but beautiful world that is explored through memories and edgy layers of sound and score. The landscape develops its own persona, paralleling the inner geography of all three characters as their stories unfold. The stark void of lost love, the fear of the unknown, and then transcendence of emptiness through the very openness of this desolation. Three misguided souls fighting to find something absolute and positive in all that negative space. The drama is compelling. James Franco and his co-stars deliver deft performances.

I think I was recommended this film by the lady in the shop I was hiring it from ! For the price, I'd say that's fair. Anyway, the title of the film is "Wildlife" and is based upon Richard Ford's novel of the same title, which is actually a very interesting and enjoyable read, as you can see here, as I reviewed the book a little while ago, so if you want to know more about the book and the adaptation to screen, you should probably read that, as I'm about to give you the plot in the next sentence !

1969 was the year. New York City was the place. Putney Swoope was the second Robert Downey film to achieve some recognition. The first was Chaffed Elbows (1966). Putney Swoope achieved a much wider release. Pound (1970) and Greasers Palace (1972) were even more profane and obnoxious. Those 2 films were mean spirited to the point that they actually stalled the Prince's feature film career for several years.The subject at hand is Putney Swoope. And it is a mad farce/satire that has to be seen to be believed. I'm not going to go through the plot here.

No real plot , no character development , no Scorcese-level direction , but seriously , were you really expecting any ? If the answer is 'yes', then you should probably skip this movie and go play GTA V instead , it's much more satisfying . The acting is a tad sub par but it's not bad , you'll get through it as the action is quite good throughout , though towards the end, it gets a tad tiring but the film ends on a high point so that made up for it a little. It was ok, not a terrible movie, but it wasn't a good one either.

SHOWTIME is a mess, but it's an entertaining mess. The plot is forgettable, the satire is lightweight and the action sequences, though well-staged, aren't that exciting. But I laughed. A lot. Credit goes to the inspired pairing of De Niro and Murphy. They have great chemistry. Murphy delivers the one-liners, De Niro cracks us up with a look or grimace. This movie will get a RUSH HOUR-like reception from the critics. Don't listen to them. If you're a fan of De Niro or Murphy, you're going to enjoy this movie.

this is a teen movie and while u watch it expect some nonsensical stuff added here and there but overall it's good. the acting was very good, the storyline was decent enough. there is action and romance and good music. the special effects are good and i loved the graphics. but i don't think this movie will change the perception of this genre for most of us. if u r a fan of romance movies u should go for it. this was an excellent movie. i have not seen a movie that is as good in the last couple of years.

In Nordestina , a village in the middle of nowhere in Pernambuco , Antônio ( Gustavo Falcão ) is the mayor, but has little to do in the village because there is little to do here. He spends the day writing letters, which is when he discovers his true passion: playing the piano. And when one of the people in the village says he doesn't have any talent for music, he goes to São Paulo to look for a job in the same industry. In São Paulo he finds his brother, a musician, and together they will try to get a job in the music industry.

I was n't expecting a great deal from this film , so I was pleasantly surprised when I watched it. Although it doesn't have a lot going for it in the way of originality, I did enjoy it. If you are bored and don't know what to watch, this is one for you. This movie was a bit slow to begin with, and at times I did find myself getting a little bored, but it picked up and I found it to be an entertaining film. Although it is nowhere near the best film ever made, I did like it more than most.

Containing Billy 's famous humor , this more modest comedy with heavy bittersweet overtones is a big departure , pleasantly surprising and satisfying , and a real treasure from the 80' s . Billy Crystal in this comedy plays a man who has lost all his money and is forced to live with his sister in a small town in the mountains. There , he gets to know an attractive female lawyer , played by Deborah Harry and starts a relationship with her . Meanwhile , Billy finds a new love for his sister and they become best friends .

Is this a good movie? It's hard to say -- but in 1953, for many people, it was a remarkably effective movie, suspenseful, scary and then, amazingly, actually touching when "the old gentleman" meets his unhappy death at the end of the movie.Yes, what lurks in the Maze turns out to be something of a surprise and, for a lot of people, a hilarious one. But the basic idea (ontogeny recapitulates phylogeny) was a very real one at the time the book was written, and does have some basis in fact.

What I enjoyed most in this film was the scenery of Corfu, being Greek I adore my country and I liked the flattering director's point of view. Based on a true story during the years when Greece was struggling to stand on her own two feet through war, Nazis and hardship. An Italian soldier and a Greek girl fall in love but the times are hard and they have a lot of sacrifices to make. Nicholas Cage looking great in a uniform gives a passionate account of this unfulfilled (in the beginning) love.

One of the most magnificent movies ever made . The acting of Charles Buchinski ( later known as Bronson ) is brilliant, the scenery is beautiful, the music and sound superb. An excellent film and one of the great classics. I don't understand the negative reviews on this site. It's a must-see and one that I will watch many times more. I have it on DVD now. I was lucky to catch this one when it was first released in 1970 and I was so excited I saw it multiple times. This was a great film from a great writer.

This is Christmas time ! A nativity in terms of rebirth , or at least this is what can be inferred from a simple reflection on the symbols and images of this season. In the Catholic faith, and also in some Protestant denominations, a Christmas nativity scene is part of the Christmas celebration, which is considered as a family tradition in some homes. Nativity scenes are popular decorations in private homes, as well as in churches and public places, usually displayed close to Christmas, especially the night of December 24 or 25 when Christians typically celebrate Jesus’ birth.

The Paul Kersey of DEATH WISH 3 is very far removed from the Paul Kersey of the original film . If you remember the 1974 film then you will remember Kersey was a " Conchie " during the Korean war and that he was physically sick after he committed his first execution . Ten years later Kersey seems to have learned unarmed combat and how to handle anti tank weapons in his spare time . But I`ll overlook that gaffe because DW3 is the best of the sequels , lowlife scum bags get shot dead , burned alive , their teeth smashed , and thrown to their deaths by middle aged housewives armed with sweeping brushes .

Was very fortunate to see the movie Hari Om at The Bermuda International Film Festival. It was the opening night and was such a delightful movie. It was shot beautifully around India and I want to go there now. The main actor..Vijay was absolutely incredible. He was the highlight of the movie. Apparently he was also in the movie..Monsoon Wedding. He was the total star of the show. Benoit's character cracked me up...was very funny. And the girl (forget the name) was great too. They were all great!

When `` Madame '' decides to let her cats inherit her it spells trouble . The snobbish Butler Edgar who thinks himself above work and the other servants who are more than willing to take on work and get the cats out of their hair and do the jobs Madame has assigned to the cats. The film takes us into the world of the butler who thinks of himself above all the other servants . The butler has been assigned the job of the new Madame's chauffeur as he takes the place of the late Sir Charles who the butler was fond of.

Films belonging to the "film noir" genre usually contain similar elements: a "deus ex machina" plot twist that drives the main character headlong into bedlam, a pretty but psychotic girl, a handsome but psychotic thug, lots of money, lots of brutality, and usually a denouement in the desert. Think "High Sierra" or "White Heat. "There is plenty of hard-boiled bad film noir out there. But when film noir is good, you can't take your eyes off the train wreck of human lives.It is this latter tradition that "Blind Spot" belongs to.

Try to look for another movie that is such a trip without having a story or plot and you 'll probably not be able to find it. Even a movie that is based on the life of the main character would have to have something to it. But this is a story of a kid who was brought up in the woods by his parents and who is now lost after his parents have died. His parents taught him all sorts of weird stuff like how to walk on the bottom of a swimming pool. And we are supposed to go with it.

Wow , What a wonderful film-making ! Mr. Im has done it , again ! His last work , ChunHayang (1998 ) is one of the most beautiful Korean films that I have seen. And this time he brings us an even better film. The film is based on the real-life story of KIM Jeong-Ae , a young girl who was gang-raped and brutally killed by her school mates in 1991 . The film , as the title suggests , tells us the story from the POV of the dead girl , but the dead girl is neither seen nor heard throughout the film.

Before I forget , let me say the artwork in here is outstanding . From garbage cans to the huge sculpture in the courtyard . It’s a good place to just wander for the sheer artistic content . I’d also suggest visiting the other courtyards as well . The museum itself is worth the visit . As you may have heard , it’s being built underneath a former military prison , which gives it an ominous feel . You’d never know you’re in a museum as you make your way down the corridors .

I'm not a massive Disney fan, but my 7 year old son is starting to get into them, so we've built up quite a collection, and this is one of my favourites. We first saw this a couple of weeks ago and we must have see it half a dozen times since! OK, as others have pointed out, not the most complex or inventive of plots, but there's more to a film than that.Great characters, Phil Harris stealing the show as Thomas O'Malley, but Edgar the butler not far behind.

I do n't usually like this sort of movie but was working at home and wanted something to halfway watch while doing other stuff so thought I'd see what the fuss was about. I thought the actors were pretty good, I thought there was some funny humor, I liked the idea of the two different storylines going at the same time, and overall the movie had a great feel. I think most of the hype is for the storyline and the fact it is different. If the storyline were any good, I would say this is definitely worth a look.

LOL.The mere fact that I start off my review with 'lol ' says it all . I used to watch the show but now it's just got too ridiculous for me to continue watching . This season has really been dragging out . I think it should have been 22 episodes but they made it 24 so we have to wait longer . And the season is already almost done. Talking about the actual review , there was just too little going on this season . It was very boring . I am not gonna go into any details since it would spoil the show for people who havn't watched the show yet .

(Synopsis) Graduating high school senior Bartleby "B" Gaines (Justin Long) finds himself without a college to attend. He has been able to talk and con his way out of every problem he encounters, but he hasn't been able to charm his way pass the college admissions board of eight colleges. His mom and dad are very disappointed that Bartleby hasn't been accepted into college. His parents think that if Bartleby doesn't go to college, he will have no future. Several of Bartleby's friends are in the same situation of being rejected by all the colleges they applied to.

I saw this movie on it's opening night, and enjoyed it. I probably would have enjoyed it more if I hadn't been sitting by my father. My father saw the original (unfortunately, I have not seen it yet) and kept talking through the whole thing. He kept saying that the movie sucked, and that it was stupid. The thing is, he didn't understand that the creators were slightly making fun of the horror genre with the film. In every horror movie, there is always a certain character depicted.

The movie starts with a board meeting at a major advertising agency . Putney Swope is on the board for the first time. He has just been named the new president of the firm. The other board members are very unhappy because he has just been hired off the streets by a black activist group. The other board members feel that it is their time to run the agency and they are all white. Putney Swope is a black man who just happens to be very rich. This movie is a comment on the business world. It is a satire on advertising.

I just saw this film and I recommend it. It has a very good plot, it holds your complete attention, the acting is superb, Tom Wilkinson was fantastic and Emily Watson was also very good. A very good film indeed, about great and unconditional love. Tom Wilkinson's character is a man who is not prepared for the ordeal that is about to begin, but he takes the matter in hand as the story progresses, and this great actor gives a performance that makes you feel the character's anguish and suffering.

Who ARE the people that star in this thing? Never heard of them!! But this is one of the funniest comedies I have run across. It should win the Putz Puller Prize for Parody. The absurd starts with Dr. Jeykl snorting his powder and turning into a sex fiend.He is pursued by libido driven nurse early in the movie in one of the funniest scenes of the movie. Pay attention to the hospital PA system in the background; rather like the system in MASH. The final scene with Hyde accepting the award has had me laughing for years.

This is probably my favourite TV show ever. I love all the characters, especially Alex, who is the PERFECT woman! Always makes me laugh and feel good when I watch this show. There is just something about it that is amazing, hard to describe.It seems some or all of the episodes synchronise with music albums as well. Here are a few examples. (The episodes start again when they end - but DON'T play end credits until the very end, but always play the opening credits. With most the episodes the album plays once and the episodes play twice, but some go on further.

Lucio Fulci , later known for his graphic horror films like The Beyond and Zombie , was years earlier a prolific and respected director of gialli (Italian genre films, usually mysteries). While his work here is not as visually interesting as his later work, you get the feeling that he would later become the director of choice for exploitation and horror films. This film was made in 1968 and, like the other films made by his company, Apeiron, it's not nearly as well done as his later films. There is a good story here though, it just takes awhile to get going.

Jeff Garlin 's film is filled with heart and laughter . As in Curb Your Enthusiasm , his screen persona comes straight out of his real life. Jeff Garlin as Larry David would be so annoying and offensive. As Larry David on Larry David 's TV shows, Jeff Garlin is endearing and likable. And, yes, he's a little annoying and offensive too, which is why we love him. Garlin has said he got the idea for his feature film from Larry David : "When I was watching Curb , there were just these little moments.

I have to admit that I approached this movie with a sense of expectation and dread . Louis de Berniere is a fabulous author of historical fiction, I’ve read and loved his work before, and while the movie looked good and was directed by a man whose work I admire, Stephen Poliakoff, I had a gut feeling that a 136 minute movie was going to lose so much from being translated to the screen as a feature film. And of course it did! I think there is only one way in which I was disappointed by the movie and that is that I didn’t like it enough.

Yes , at times `` Unconditional Love '' overwhelms as it bounces -- no , as it ricochets -- from one pair of hearts to another, and then again, back again -- and the ricochet becomes the ripple, and it becomes the tidal wave --- yes , yes , it can be overwhelming , but I believe it is a necessary force -- a life force -- that keeps us all from falling apart -- yes , we all fall to our knees in awe of it all --- yes, it can be overpowering . . . and yes, sometimes I wish I were a little more cynical .

A mix of 70's drug humor along with parody of medicine and classic story line. As I've often said about this flick - if you don't get it - you're way lame..... Classic lines such as (parapharsed) "I've got this erection and it won't go away no matter how many times I do it. You're a nurse, what can you give me for it?" Nurse replies "all I have is 5 dollars and my wedding ring..." Great sound track.The classic "Hyde's got nothing to hide".

"Blind Spot" one of my festival favorites. I was totally intrigued by the idea of three strangers searching for a mysterious man who has loved and betrayed each of them in different ways. The cast is great. James Franco is particularly amazing as the broken-hearted boy from Los Angeles. His journal entries, which we hear in voice-over-narration, work well with the visuals and are quite intense. The film has a powerful style. It pushes elements like the road movie and revenge-drama in new directions. It also plays with time and perspective in ways that capture the frightening ambiance of lost love.

After a somewhat slow start I thought this movie about the Italian occupation of a Greek island during World War II picked up and became a quite enjoyable watch for a couple of hours, from primarily two points of view. The love triangle is an interesting one and strikes me as believable, because I know it happened in various places under occupation. Penelope Cruz played Pelagia, a young Greek girl engaged to be married to Mandras (Christian Bale). I had questions about the depth of their love from the start, but their future was torn apart when Italy invaded Greece, and Mandras went off to fight.

The Simpsons of course started off with Christmas special "Simpson's Roasting On An Open Fire" which had basic drawings and not laugh out loud jokes, but this episode has probably the first laugh out loud joke in it and from here the show just gets better and better. This episode centers around Bart who in this episode swaps on a test from Martin and gets into a school for the highly gifted, this leading to Bart mending his friendship with his Dad and losing all of his mates. The Episode is very humorous and shows what was to become the greatest show ever to come out.

I loved this film, which I have just seen at the Philadelphia film festival. In March 2005 I went to India with 2 friends, and this movie was very real. I related to everything, and savored every moment. The characters are believable, the story poignant and the ending realistic, but not sentimental. I also enjoyed the discussion with the director after the showing. This movie shows very well the blending, but not complete mixing of 2 worlds (East and West). The supporting cast was wonderful, depicting the life a tourist encounters in India quite realistically.

If you haven't seen this film, do it. Its a genremix as i've never seen another. Some very surreal scenes, some hilarious funny stuff, a film noir felling, musical numbers with a swing, sex scenes (The 2nd best played orgasm on Film, bested only by Sally), a pitch of Orson Welles blended together into a work of art. As an work of art it hasn't to be logical at the end, at least not logical for everybody ;-). I owned an tv copy on VHS but loaned it to an ex-girlfriend and now i can't get it back.

This film, winning Im Kwon-Taek the Best Director at Cannes in 2002 (tied with P.T. Anderson for Punch-Drunk Love), is about a 19th century Korean painter with a commoner's roots and significant impact on Korean painting. One of the strengths?of the film is that Im tries to help us see with the eye of a painter, so we see multiple scenes and objects which help our drunken painter friend, Jang Seung-up (Choi Min-shik),?receive inspiration.The costumes and the art direction are all impressive and the acting is even along being good.

I saw this movie on late night TV out of Buffalo about 30 years ago and I'm dying to see it again one more time before I... well.. you know. The interaction between the main characters after the Tiger (Eli Wallach) "captures" his prey (Anne Jackson) in a botched kidnapping attempt is absolutely hilarious. Charles Nelson Reilly's portrayal of a neurotic university dean(?) or department head is priceless. How many films can you name which are able to illuminate humanity's struggle for meaning and fulfillment by making you laugh from beginning to end?

This film is an impressionistic , poetic take on the immigrant experience , a reflective look at the turmoil and upheaval that an immigrant faces as he moves from a life of poverty in his home country to one of hope and opportunity in America . It is an impressionistic tale in which we never quite see the complete picture , but are presented a series of images and glimpses to create an overall feeling of what the immigration process means . This is one of the few films in the Criterion library that is available to view online , and as a result , the transfer to DVD of the film is very good .

There 's no point in comparing this with the original series . Though different in look and content , both work in the same spirit . And what an enjoyable spirit that is ! There are no featured audience reviews yet. Click the link below to see what others say about Yakitate!! Japan! : Season 2! I love this show. I love that they have a new story. The characters are just as funny. The story is just as exciting. I really hope they keep it going for 50 more episodes or even more. This show has great comedy, and drama.

I think that anybody whose dumb enough to risk being a wax dummy just so they can go to a ball on Halloween deserves to be mauled to death by one. If I were them I'd try to find a different way to spend Halloween and I'd also think long and hard about why someone would want to mutilate a life-sized doll. My best guess would be that someone is making a point about how insane it is to kill innocent animals for no good reason. My guess would be that someone is trying to get a rise out of me.

I've commented once on this Chucky great, but I had to do it again to say some things about the film, when I first saw it in a great balcony in a great theater. The film was a lot of fun in the theater and my first Chucky film ever in a theater, and that was a special moment for me, because I cherish Chucky. The other horror villains are referenced with GREAT COOLNESS!!! And the gore was shockingly great! The scene where the gay kid gets nailed by the truck was amazingly cheerful!

This is by far one of the best movies I have seen in a very long time . Top 20 Movies Of The 21st Century So Far - FlickPicks. 27, 1975) was a pioneer of computer animation. The Top 20 Best Movies of the 1970's. 5, The Godfather Part 1 is the best part of the best trilogy ever made. 2016 was a great year for new movies and some oldies, too. You’re just about to read our list of the 20 best movies of the decade.

I was so happy to learn that Hari Om will finally be theatrically released in 2007. I saw this film three years ago at the Vancouver International film Festival and have been waiting for it's release ever since so I could send everyone I know to see it. It's like taking a trip to India....colorful, magical, thought provoking. Aside from one rather strange Hollywood style auto rickshaw chase scene this movie is very realistic. This is not a Bollywood style song and dance movie but it does have drama and romance and humor.

Not a stunner, but a good movie to see once or twice. Bill Macy shows he can do more than just act; his writing was pretty darn good. Great supporting cast, especially Jamie Cromwell as the extortionist private eye.The movie's greatest strength is the work of Macy, who reminds us of his Jerry Lundergaard role from Fargo. He has numerous scenes where he is extremely funny as a slimy, manipulating and deceitful character. It's enjoyable to watch him be a weasel, and for a while I was happy that things were turning out well for him.

Barbora Bobulova 's portrayal of Valeria in this story was entirely captivating and heart wrenching at the same time . This is an exceptional story of love , betrayal and forgiveness , the characters are so well created that they are very easy to relate to . This author does an amazing job of expressing the pain and emotions of each character . The story is filled with twists and turns and will leave you guessing up to the last page . I enjoyed this story very much and highly recommend it !! What a captivating read! Great characters, great storyline.

Due to its predictable , second-rate title , ( the one it was distributed under in Italy , at least ), and notoriety for the notoriously awful acting in many of its episodes , The Master Race is often considered to be a very bad show , with the exception of the first season. Based on the series of novels from the 1930s ( written in the early 1940s ) , it takes place in 200001 AD ( that's right: the year is 200001 ) when a war between the humans and the androids has taken place and the humans have lost , leaving the Earth to be occupied by the machines .

When the new Outer Limits first started, the episodes were quite optimistic and challenging. As the series began to wind down, most of the episodes became just plain ugly and devoid of any entertainment value. The six episodes here reflect the very best, and worst, of the series.Since The Outer Limits always preaches a moral. I would like to offer my own. Starting with the most entertaining to the flops.1. Afterlife: As an institution, The U.S.A. military-industrial complex is both evil and paranoid, not to mention plain stupid.

The "old dark house" sub-genre that dominated the early talkies rarely fails to disappoint when we re-view the oldies to-day. Here is one that provides so very many suspicious characters you have to wonder how they will be able to tie up all the loose ends in the 6 reel running time.The Crooked Circle is a gang of counterfeiters and thieves who have decided to take revenge on Col. Walters (Berton Churchill) who has sent one of their ranks to prison. They decide he must die that very night. Meanwhile the Colonel's own group, The Sphinx Club, is determined to protect him at all costs.

I think that anybody whose dumb enough to risk being a wax dummy just so they can go to a football game or they don't want to leave their car "to get stripped" deserves whatever happens to them.The guy, Wade who "went to a barbershop and asked for the He-Man haircut" wasn't my type, but there's this really cute scene of him having his eyebrows and facial hair waxed. That's a little too high-maintenance for me. Also fun, but not my type is the fat guy in the big sunglasses who looks "like Elton John only gayer," but that whole plot goes nowhere!

Final Solution is a powerful christian film that shows the hate between the black and whites that was present in the days of apartheid. It shows how this hate was contrived and was groomed from generation to generation. Jan Ellis was taught that a black man was a plague. He was raised to be that way. Then he meets a man who is on the opposite side of his beliefs, Pastor Lekota. will he change his ways?. The film is a powerful movie that shows the perceptions the different races had for one another, it shows these perceptions with quite a lot of accuracy.

These days , you rarely come by a kid 's show that does not involve 1 ) a preteen/teen pop star , 2) a teen pop group, 3) an adult celebrity or an adult with a teenager and 4) some sort of dancing or singing competitions . This is the world we live in now. The same can not be said for the 70s , when shows like the Brady Bunch , Welcome Back Kotter , and Happy Days ruled. In fact , the 70s had very few singing competitions and almost no dancing. But what it did , it did well.

I 've commented once on this Chucky great , but I had to do it again to say some things to you guys. I have seen the film for the first time a long time ago with the original VHS version . I didn ' t like it , but I was a kid and it was not my film. Later I saw it for the first time on DVD and I loved it. I've seen it 2-3 time and I liked it more , because it is the best of this trilogy and the most horror.

it 's a great movie for the whole family . i do n't think many people have seen it cause most people are scared of snakes . i also like how the snake is not so mean . i don 't think there was anything in this movie i did n't like i would rate this movie 5 stars out of 5 . i also like how the snake is friendly and i really like this movie . this movie was really good i really enjoyed it and would recommend this movie too anyone . I watched this with my mother and it was one of her favorite movies as a kid.

I will admit , I had the opportunity in the past to watch this film , and after about 50 minutes , I said I had to get up and do something else. It just wasn't holding my interest . However , I have seen the 3rd one a number of times and it is a really interesting story . I am not going to post anything else about it here as I would like for you to watch the movie for yourself . I will say I am glad to read that the movie studio is considering making a sequel.

My Architect is a great film about Nathaniel Kahn 's search for himself via the legacy of his famous Architect father. Nathaniel, now an established Architect in his own right, grew up with this father who was a famous Architect of the Jewish Museum and the Jewish Heritage Center, among other notable projects. This is Kahn's first major film, having been a filmmaker for years, and I hope it does well. This film has the potential to do a lot of good for architects everywhere, but especially for those like Kahn and I who grew up in families with Architect parents.

Has the proliferation of relatively high quality shows on the proliferating TV networks made it possible for people to produce, direct, finance and/or star in their own films who might otherwise not have been able to? Is that a good thing? This film does not answer the latter question either way, but it does appear that without Curb, Jeff Garlin would not have been able to make I Want Someone to Eat Cheese With. Like most new producers/directors, Jeff Garlin's independent piece heaves a heavily more sensitive sigh than the vehicle he is primarily known for (Curb).

the first time I saw this movie , I just thought `` what the hell ? '' a 10-year-old kid making a porn out of his father's stuff ? But now , after watching the movie for like the 2nd-3rd time I realized that this film is not about the kid's porn , it is just about a kid trying to find a way to save his family , in his own way , without the adults interfering . The kid is only a kid with a big responsibility . I think the kid is the real hero of the movie . The kid is so realistic !

Gary Busey's best performance in a nicely-flowing biography. Since had a musical background, he was able to do his own songs and it really works. It's always good to see that fine actor, Don Stroud (one of the crickets) and Charlie Martin Smith as well.An 8 out of 10. Best performance = Gary Busey. Thankfully, Mr. Busey was Oscar-nominated for this, losing to Jon Voight in COMING HOME. A fairly low-budget flick that doesn't disappoint, with GREAT SONGS by Mr. Holly. I hope this made plenty of dough.

This movie was great. It had everything a true action fan could want. Plenty of people getting shot and/or maimed, minimal romance involving sex, a hero that can be identified with, violence at many intervals instead of pointless plot storing up just one scene at the end, and villains that are just asking for it. Bronson appears to be at his lowest level of tolerancy in this film and it shows. Ed Lauter makes a great cop and was seamlessly worked into Bronson's plot without stealing his spotlight. The movie doesn't involve a plot so boring or over-consuming that you watch this film once and never again.

WTF ! ! Do any of his books/movies end in a happy ending ? ? The Notebook was good ... until the end. That's the one I'm referring to. I don't want to spoil anything if it is a must read but I did enjoy the storyline of The Notebook. I also have heard a few others saying it was a little disappointing at the end. But, I am not going to be discouraged! I have seen the movie, but not read the book. I'm pretty sure that there was something that ended badly in the movie.

This film was one of three that were later combined by Chapin into a compilation that was released to theaters. The other films were "Into The Wind" and "From The Earth To The Moon". The film is notable for featuring the song "Mine All Mine", which was later released as a single in 1974 and reached #1 in Cashbox, #2 on Billboard and #5 in the U.K. This version was later released on a live album in 1976 and is still available today on DVD as part of the Chapin Anthology Series.

Another popular screening for a British picture at Coalville's Century Theatre. A well crafted, solid drama with an ever developing plot and ongoing 'twists in the tale'...as the lies piled up! A masterclass of acting by a flawless cast, well marshaled by first time director Julian Fellowes. Outstanding performance, as usual, by Tom Wilkinson but good turns by all concerned including supporting actors Linda Bassett and John Neville. Our audience was engrossed by this film, which includes a couple of shock incidents which really make you 'jump'.

I hope, from his seat on Heaven's comedic throne, Spike Milligan can see and can enjoy this film, as Terence Ryan and Ken Tuohy have taken a book that the author himself said writing it "nearly turned me mad" into a joy to watch.The film tells the story of the Irish town of Puckoon and the problems befallen upon it when the partition between Northern Ireland and the Republic is drawn up, cutting its way through the centre of the village and, more worringly, through the middle of the churchyard.

I've been looking forward to seeing this film ever since I first caught the trailer, and I'm so glad now that I have. It's truly a wonderful film. The actors are superb, the writing is fresh and real, the whole thing was just spot-on. I love James McAvoy in this, and I can't wait to see him in "The Lion, the Witch, and the Wardrobe" movie this December. Romola Garai is wonderful too. Be sure to check her out in "I Capture the Castle" or "Nicholas Nickleby," two of my favorite films.

This is one of my favourite Disney films. It has everything you could hope for in a Disney animation: cute animals, great songs, a nasty villain and lots of adventure. The story begins in Paris, where aristocat Duchess and her three kittens live with their Mistress in a mansion. Life is perfect for them until the Mistress' fiendish butler Edgar discovers that she plans to leave her entire fortune to the cats. He realises that if he even stands a chance of claiming the fortune, the cats will be out of the way.

That this film flopped at the box office , and still struggles for the recognition it deserves today , is a crime in itself ! The film is the best film to have come out of the Hindi movie industry in last 25 years ! To put things in perspective and in order to make a comparision, I will put up a link to the top five grossing films in Hindi cinema over the last 50 years . Link to the data : http://www.boxofficemojo.com/alltime/india.htm
The list is self explanatory . Of the top 5 grossing films , the film with the highest ranking is Dabangg with 350 crore .

Death Wish 3 is exactly what a bad movie should be . Terrible acting ! Implausible scenerios ! Ridiculous deaths ! The movie is so bad , yet so good. This movie proves once again that when it comes to movies , you can’t judge a book by it’s cover , or the title in this case . The movie is filled with ridiculous action , over the top scenes , and bad , bad acting. This is what we live for. The acting in this movie is superb . The acting is the highlight of the movie. Brilliant work !

1930 's comedy mystery about `` The Crooked Circle '' a band of hooded crooks who set about plotting the perfect crime, only to fall apart at the last minute. They are led by Professor Lupo, an ex-con who takes his criminal studies seriously. After a few successful heists, the professor is persuaded to lead a more daring caper, the perfect crime. A bank robbery, with no violence or harm to any of the hostages. The professor's plan goes awry, however, when several of the crooks are unable to control their fear of guns.

People comparing this movie to big blockbusters like Lord of the Rings or the Matrix will inevitably be disappointed with the way this movie turned out. Although it lacks in the big special effects department and there are no battles with hundreds of extras, there is still a masterful amalgamation of two old folk tales here. The acting talent, although not A-list, is still great and the interaction between the characters is perhaps more sincere than in a larger movie with an A-list cast. My particular favourite from this movie is Bridget Fonda, whose performance as the Snow Queen herself was quite moving, assisted enormously by a stupendous wardrobe and makeup.

this is a teen movie and while u watch it expect some nonsensical stuff added here and there but overall the movie is effective very effective it makes you question and leaves you thinking the story is kinda far fetched but is believable and makes you feel good in sequences, its not like its the usual done and tried path. the characters are pretty well defined and are convincing. Justin long stands out among all the others and watch out for his speech in the end he will convince anyone with that speech he is simply brilliant in that speech.

i did not read the book. nor do i care to. the movie was a beautiful romance, and i think women will enjoy it. no, it was not a "10" film, but it was enjoyable. women, if your man is bored as mine was, then watch it yourself. hurt is wonderful as the philosophic doctor who delivers a thoughtful monologue on "in love" and "loving. "also, if you like nick cage, he was terrific and funny. i enjoyed watching the developing romance. also, if you like Christian bale -- do see him in equilibrium.

I was pleasantly surprised by the depth of story and character development. Fulci was a master at creating horrific atmosphere using inventive camera work, vivid cinematography, and yes - wonderfully explicit gore.This film is no exception, however, compared to his later films (The Beyond, Zombie 2, City of the Living Dead, House by the Cemetery, etc.) the characters here are extremely well developed and the emphasis shies away from the supernatural and is more on the suspense created by a classic who-dunnit amongst the lush hills of Italy.

I wish there were more films about middle aged people . The intellectual journey and the twists and turns of getting older . This film is great !!! It is a good story, but in my opinion not well told. A bit of an uncomfortable feeling while watching, but I still recommend the film to anyone looking for some entertainment. The only way this movie is even watchable is because of the two main actors. Loved it. Worth watching over and over. This is a must watch for all young people!

This was one of the worst Columbo episodes that I have seen , However , I am only in the first two seasons , I hope that the episodes get better. Jerry Lee Lewis plays the main bad guy , in a way , I felt sorry for him , he played his character in a way that you can feel for him, I had to keep watching to see what he was trying to accomplish . In the end, of course, he loses, I will watch this episodes a second time , to try and figure out what he is trying to do.

I saw this today with little background on what to expect of the storyline. I go to the movies as an escape, to leave everything behind and enjoy a "story". I found this to be a good movie, not great, but good. It was worth my money and my tears :)Diane Lane was wonderful as always, Richard Gere isn't an over-actor. He held his own and has a certain presence that we always come to expect. He brings his own style to the movie.I think it was the kind of love story that doesn't always get told.

A mix of 70 's drug humor along with parody of medicine and classic story line . As I 've never read the original story , I didn't know what would happen next , but in general it was predictable . What made it a bit different is the fact that it was a satirical comedy that didn't take it self too much serious . The story has a great pace with a lot of humor , and I'm sure that at times it will be hard not to laugh at certain situations or the things the main characters say and do , which makes the movie even more interesting to watch .

I have to offset all the terrible comments. I love this movie. I own the movie and the soundtrack. I watch it whenever I need a pick me up. Granted it's not like the Sound of Music but it's as much fun if picking at movies is not your thing. I adored the late (and great) Bobby Vann, and James Shigeta has always and will always be a favorite. I saw this when it first came out in the theaters. I'm a big musical fan and this one is 100 times better than Twiggy in "The Boyfriend".

I absolutely adore this movie ! I had never heard of it when I saw it at the video store. I am really glad I gave it a try, I loved it. I will definitely be checking out some other films from John Carpenter. One of the reasons I like this movie so much is because of the way that it was shot. I feel like it really has an atmosphere and a feeling that most films don’t capture. John Carpenter also directed Halloween, The Thing and Escape from New York which are other movies I highly recommend.

To say the truth , I went to see this movie only because Nicolas Cage is my favorite actor . But I'm not disappointed , this film is a real surprise , so I advise all fans of horror movies to take time to watch it ! I liked the soundtrack , but I didn't find it scary enough and the story isn't the most original. Still a good movie to watch on a cold day ! Very entertaining. The movie is about a father trying to save his son's soul. He does this by killing all of the demons who have been trying to posses the boy.

This is a stunning movie. Raw and sublimely moving. It felt like a very gripping, intelligent stage play (but without the overly theatrical feeling one actually gets from watching people on a stage) which plays on everyone's terror of a white lie escalating to monstrous consequences. All of the main players are mesmerising. Tom Wilkinson broke my heart at the end... and everyone else's judging by the amount of fumbling for hankies and hands going up to faces among males and females alike. Julian Fellowes has triumphed again. He's a national treasure.

The Golden Door is the story of a Sicilian family's journey from the Old World (Italy) to the New World (America). Salvatore, a middle-aged man who hopes for a more fruitful life, persuades his family to leave their homeland behind in Sicily, take the arduous journey across the raging seas, and inhabit a land whose rivers supposedly flow with milk. In short, they believe that by risking everything for the New World their dreams of prosperity will be fulfilled. The imagery of the New World is optimistic, clever and highly imaginative.

`` Blind Spot '' one of my festival favorites . I was totally intrigued by the idea of three strangers trapped in a car together on a deserted road and the way they deal with things . It was very well acted by the three main actors and I really didn't expect the plot to move in that direction . I loved the cinematography , the sound effects were superb and I think this has the making of a good film . Looking forward to future projects from this talented director . Thank you for inviting me to watch the film , I hope it gets a wider release.''

This is NOT the masterpiece that is Snow White, Cinderella, or Bambi, but it IS a very sweet, enjoyable, romantic, well-done Disney animated feature.There are, of course, lessons included herein for the kiddies, and some very appropriate kiddie-cheek, but there is plenty herein for the adults, as well.While this is somewhat of a regurgitation of the Classic Disney RomCom Adventure, it still holds some elements, which solely belong to the AristoCats. O'Malley is the "tramp" and Dutchess is the "lady," but Dutchess has several kittens and they are all trying to get home.Phil Harris is our tomcat O'Malley.

The story starts out with a soldier being transported to a desert town then goes back in time to tell the tale of how he came to this place. He started out as an officer in Napoleon's army fighting in Egypt but became separated from his unit. After nearly starving and/or dying of thirst he came upon a leopard which somehow became his bosom buddy. It brought him food and before long the soldier became almost totally wild so acute was his bonding with the animal. All things do end however and the man decided it was necessary for him to leave the critter.

Blind Spot 's images are great . The action draws you in completely , even though the movie is a bit weak , and you feel that you have seen it all before . It is the acting which really stands out , and it is a very believable performance all round . Blind Spot is a great movie , thanks for the share , I enjoyed it very much . It's a little slow moving in places , which is why it doesn't quite reach 10/10 . Thank you for uploading it , please keep it up , it is greatly appreciated 10/10 .

It 's Showtime ! Showtime is simply a bump in Eddie Murphy and Robert DeNiro 's careers . It 's showtime was filmed in 1992 which was the peak of the comedy genre. It 's Showtime is a movie about a stand-up comedian who is going to make his big comeback after eight years of struggling. It is about the struggle of the main character to get back on his feet after being fired from his day job and having to go back to comedy. The movie 's plot is based off his life. Eddie Murchy and Robert DeNiro have similar career paths which is why they made a film together.

I saw the trailer and read some reviews , and I had low expectations for this movie . I was wrong when I went in to see it. it is a very good movie and has a good story line and a good pace. The action scenes are also well done. I give it an A.
I don't know what movie you're referring to, but I'll give you that the trailer was a little misleading. It gave me the idea that there would be a lot more action going on in it.

Ross Hunter 's musical remake of the 1937 fantasy , based on James Hilton 's enduring bestseller , was written as an all-star vehicle for its stars, William Holden , Ava Gardner and Robert Newton . It was a box office success, earning over $4.25m in America, but the critics didn't exactly go wild about it. This is not the first version of Lost Horizon that's come along; the first was an all-silent version that didn't do well. The third version, a straight remake, was done in the late 50s by Charles Jarrott , but it's not a film I've seen.

Let me clarify that . This is not a `` good movie '' , but I am so glad it's a good movie , because i can talk about it with you guys :D , this is a nice movie . The movie has so many plot that's make me so confused , but when i think back , i can found that there is a pattern . There are three main character , each with their own motives and ambition , but they all get involve . I know the main theme here , which is , we should not be selfish to the other people or even to the people we love .

In an early scene , Luca ( David Pasquesi ) and James ( Jeff Garlin ) are walking down a street in LA and a homeless man approaches them with a sign. Luca says he'll give him five bucks. James says, "How come I'm always the one giving you the five bucks?" I'll be doing a bit about this in my show on Wednesday. As a matter of fact I'm going to try and do it like a riff. If I do it right I'll try and make you feel like I'm just spontaneously making all this up and you have to laugh.

Lucio Fulci made a lot of great films throughout his career and the way that many of them featured a lot of extreme gore and splattery blood, it is no surprise that he made an entire film dedicated just to that. This is a film made by a director who had a vision and a passion for the gory and violent scenes and this is what made him so popular with fans who enjoy his films. It is not a film for everyone, as there are a lot of extreme gore moments that would make many viewers turn away and say no thank you to ever seeing anything like this again.

I was about 14 years old as I saw the musical version of Lost Horizon . I loved the film so much, and the music in particular that I wanted to know more about the score. As I learned more I came to love that score even more. The score has such a depth and breadth that no one else has ever achieved in scoring a film. I’m glad that I’m not alone on this, as I see more and more people coming to appreciate the score for all that it has to offer.

Duchess and her three kittens are enjoying the high life with their devoted human mistress until the wicked butler Edgar, with his eyes on a big inheritance, decides to dope them and get them out of the picture. How can these fragile creatures cope in the unfamiliar countryside and the meaner streets of Paris? Only by meeting the irrepressible alley cat O'Malley, a rough diamond with romance in his heart. After they get a taste of the wide dangerous world, he guides them home, and Edgar gets his just desserts at the wrong end of a horse.

I 've been looking forward to seeing this film ever since I first caught the trailer , and I 'm glad to say it did not disappoint in the slightest. To start with the music is just brilliant, with a soundtrack that has the same kind of feel of the 70's and 80 's, when the genre was king. The film also has some wonderful characters, which have all been well-rounded, as well as a great story, which has you guessing right up until the end. It 's just a great film in every aspect and really worth the watch.

( Some spoilers included : ) Although , many commentators have called this film surreal , the term fits poorly with this film . The events are very real , and so are the actors , most of them nonprofessional. There are a few shots that have some surrealistic qualities , but these are few and far between. The narrative is tightly structured and the events in it are believable . A good film , with a lot of potential . It is not easy to write a good film script about an important historical event , particularly one which has received so much attention in the western world.

`` Do n't Torture a Duckling '' is one of the coolest Italian horror films I 've ever seen , in my humble opinion. It has a unique and distinctive atmosphere that is not very common in the genre. There are plenty of murders, brutal killings, a few twists and a great cast in this film that makes it very easy to forgive it 's shortcomings. First of all, the pacing of the movie. It 's pretty slow at the beginning and sometimes I found myself wishing something would happen soon. But when things get going , you get an awesome movie.

People comparing this movie to big blockbusters like Lord of the Rings or the Matrix will inevitably be disappointed with it. That’s not because they are not good movies. They are just not comparable to it. I will admit that it is a movie that does take more than one viewing to fully understand. As far as the story goes, there is a bit more to this movie than meets the eye. In fact, this movie could be considered to be in the tradition of Japanese anime and is actually based on a very popular anime series called Ghost in the Shell (1995).

I first saw The Victim ( aka Out Of Contention ) well over 25 years ago when I was very young and, I'm afraid to say, not really the discerning reviewer I am these days. As such, I was more concerned with getting to see as much on the big screen and in general just enjoying myself. There was also a lot of good publicity at the time so, despite my lack of appreciation, I thought it was a good show and it stuck in my mind. The Victim was the first big-screen feature for director Basil Dearden - one of Britain's best and most versatile film directors.

Chucky is back but this time he is not scary (a lot) - but he is funny!When Chucky is brought back to life (in the doll, of course) by his old trailer trash girlfriend, Tiffany, he promptly kills her and transforms her into a doll, too. Tiffany and Chucky are now on the case of 2 high school graduates - eekkk! !Don't miss this film - it is a whole lot of fun. It is scary, funny, weird, wacky and stupid all in one!My rating : 9/10.

I love this movie a lot. I must get this on DVD. I have 2 VHS copies, but the quality is so poor that you can't read one written joke over the door of the ward. I'm forever amazed that Blankfield did almost nothing afterward. He made both Dr. Jeckle and Mr. Hyde totally believable.The movie is plagued by it's low budget. (One atrocious edit jumps into mid-word and was described on, "Siskel & Ebert".) But, there are a thousand jokes, sight gags to subtle references, that more than compensate.

Truly unique and stunning film of Jules Verne 's `` For The Flag '' by the Czech master director Karel Steklý. Jules Verne 's short story `` For The Flag '' has a special meaning to this film. It was originally a short story about a battle between England and the Ottoman Empire, but the film shows the battle of the Austrians against the Ottoman Empire. The Austrians and the Ottoman Empire have been locked in this battle for over 250 years, and in the end the Austrians won this battle and became independent.

When I saw this film at a festival years ago I was very impressed and I started to looking for it. Nothing to do, not in the cinemas, nor on DVD neither on Blue ray. Absolutely nothing!!! How it's possible this could really happen??? The direction is IMPECCABLE, the story is intriguing and has been filmed in a very original way the music it's perfect and James Franco is hot as hell!! !Please release this master piece and allow it to have it's proper life!!!!!!!!!!

"Pearl Harbor, buddy." This movie is brilliant! Sure it doesn't exactly flow like an multi-million dollar comedy does, but the jokes that are constantly thrown in are unbelievable. I'm one that goes for silliness, much like "Dumb and Dumber", "Airplane" and "Wet Hot American Summer" and I have to say this easily ranks up there. Movies just aren't written with this kind of sporadic comedy anymore. Too many jokes in this are such a surprise to the viewer that it's honestly amazing that more don't know about and praise this slapstick masterpiece!

I saw this movie on it 's opening night , and enjoyed it . I probably would have enjoyed it more if I was not watching it with a film critic . (I was the only guy in the theatre by the way , and the girl I was there with hated it) . The story was original and fresh , and was a nice surprise from a studio like Paramount , the visuals and CGI effects were also top notch and well put together , but the story is the most important thing in a movie , and this is where Gamer fell short to me .

Blind Spot's images are great. The action draws you in completely, even though the movie is a bit long. By the end credits all that you can think about are the film's positive high-points. The lead actors have the most incredible screen presence. The story is heart-wrenching. The film score is nicely understated . Completely moving in its own powerful way. Not your standard melodramatic cuing. Trance-like moments add poetic resonance to the engrossing narration and terrific visual compositions. Hope you get a chance to see this film. It delves into some dark territory but you come out of the tunnel seeing nothing but white light.

Hey all you jive hustlers , you stone foxes , you mean dudes . Watch out cause Slaughter is back in town . Rockin' & rollin' in a pink Cadillac. We're talkin' about our rockin' rhythm & roll . And we're talking about you and me . You and me . We're the Slaughter House . Yeah, that right , and you better know . That the Slaughter House Band . You know we can't stand still , we gotta get back to our roots . And we want to get right down to business .

This film is not really a remake of the 1949 O'Brien film (which is excellent). It borrows the main premise--a man has been poisoned and spends the rest of the film trying to find his killer. But I like that the writers chose an English professor, instead of a private dick, as the protagonist. The plot is also quite original. In general, the film moves along fast enough to keep you awake. But what mars this film is a strange dated quality about it (probably due to the horrendous 80's original music score)combined with an affected "noir" feel.

After seeing The Aristocats : Special Edition in a two pack with The Fox in the Hound , I decided to get the 2003 Disney's 102 Dalmatians : Collector's Edition (Special Edition) that was also released the same week. This 2-Disc set is a nice upgrade from my 2002 DVD release since it has some great extras and the film has been fully restored and remastered. I was glad to see that 102 Dalmatians also has a commentary with director and producer, so I decided to watch it before going into the DVD.

The show start out with the boat. Desmond was i it. Then they went to try to save Walt. And Lock things that the button pushing is a big joke at the same time Desmond found out that hes the one that crashed the plane. Eko tries to open the door that Jhon locked on him, and Charlie helped him find the Bomb. While Sayid and Jack plan is that, Sasyid is to find the others first and see who and what the other are. And find if there armed and have any weapons. Micheal takes Jack, Swayer, Kate, and Hugo in a trap.

Buddy Holly was a pioneer and victim of the early days of rock 'n' roll. The young singer/songwriter from Lubbock, Texas left his mark on the template of modern music. Inspired by Elvis Presley, Holly would spend a lot of time fighting the system in order to get his rock-a-billy sound recorded. Before his untimely death, he was mixing lush strings with be-bop rhythms. Holly would take his place with Presley, Chuck Berry, Jerry Lee Lewis and Ricky Nelson as the voices of teenage angst.This easy to watch bio is not without flaws.

Double Shock is one of the many good Columbo episodes which reaches the level of a good movie.It has all the elements we like in the Columbo episodes. We get the laugh when Columbo makes something clumsy, and it happens more than once in Double Shock. I can almost guarantee that you will laugh several times if you decide to watch this episode.We also get the riddle as usual with an almost perfect murder, but something about the murder troubles Columbo. The end is the usual, we get the story about how Columbo solved the mystery.This is another good Columbo-episode, and I will rate it 7/10.

James Franco is totally cool in this movie. Not just handsome and charismatic but genuinely open and vulnerable in a sincere kind of way. At the Tristan screening some folks were on his back for being pouty and sullen and doing the whole James Dean thing but I don't think this true. Blind Spot is proof positive of his tremendous talent. In this film he carries himself with a different sort of weight entirely. It's a unique performance. Bittersweet and really moving. The lines from his journal cut you like a knife. You sense a sharp intelligence of observation behind his words.

This is a good film for die-hard Chucky fans. Okay I'm sure it's not as good as what the Child's Play movie were like, but this can get really funny and enjoyable, Chucky's laughs are hilarious. (SPOILERS)Now not one doll, but two, meaning double the impact, Jennifer Tilly played the part really well and definitely pulled off the best kill of the movie.If you have seen the Child's Play movies this would be a worthy film on your Chucky collection, but if you've never seen the Child's play movies before, this'll will be a new start.

This is my favourite Columbo . Martin Landau ( excellent ! ) plays twins , one of whom may have been responsible for the murder of his brother in law who is played by John Cassavetes . Cassavetes had a problem with Landau who was at that time a big movie star ( he was in Ed Wood ) , and had a reputation for being a difficult man on set . He was very tense and nervous with Landau , and even refused to be interviewed . It doesn't seem to have mattered much to Landau as it was his second of three appearances in Columbo , the first being in ' Identity Crisis ' .

This is one of those movies where I just want to move my feet and dance around the house. It's a very positive and happy type of music. The movie has some sad parts but mostly the music is what makes me happy. Gary Busey did a great job as Buddy Holly. Buddy Holly kept on going even tho his pastor, his parents and the Nashville record producer told him no. Buddy Holly didn't give up on what he liked. I didn't know much about Buddy Holly until I watched this movie.

Mark Blankfield played Jekyll and Hyde.Michael McGuire was the dad.Tim Thomerson was the plastic surgeon.Did you even see this movie? It sucked.I saw it at a movie theatre.I had no idea that it had been made into a tv show,until a couple of months ago,thanks to the internet. The tv show was great.I wish that I had the opportunity to see it on a local station,but there wasn't. Anybody know where to get the dvd of the series? Re: The Jekyll and Hyde show from 92-93
The best way to find these things is Ebay, I think.

Contrary to what many may believe as this movie being an "against the system" type of movie and attitude. It is an excellent portrayal of the "system" in question and how ridiculous it truly is. The funny parts in the movie are in fact funny because they speak the truth about the world around us. Anyone who finds this movie to be unrealistic is simply denying the self evident truths about life. And that is to learn what you enjoy. That is what college should be about..I come to find that a comment must have at least 10 lines.

A nice and pleasant movie full of meditteranean sceneries ( Cephallonia is a very beautiful greek island ) that keeps the audience on the edge for all of the 142 minutes . The acting is superb and it has the right combination of romance and drama. I have seen the play and the movie, and it was hard to compare. I can say that I liked the play better because it was a bit more dramatic. I have been to Greece and I can't say it was like Cephallonia, but I have seen similar towns and villages there.

i love this film ! ! maybe it is my generation but i can really connect with what he is trying to do with the whole thing. i would have liked to have seen the whole book, but what we saw was amazing! i can't stop laughing... i mean, why don't they ever talk to each other ? how do you even meet a friend when you are surrounded by people who are more like strangers to you ? i hate to say this, but this is so true, at least for some of us, who never get to meet new people because it feels so awkward.

They Made Me a Criminal is a remake of an earlier Warner Brothers film, The Life of Jimmy Dolan which starred Douglas Fairbanks, Jr. as the prizefighter on the lam.Even with the restrictions now upon production by the Hays Office, this remake actually turns out to be better than the original. Douglas Fairbanks, Jr., is horribly miscast as a pugilist. John Garfield with his background and style steps into a part he was born to play.They Made Me a Criminal was directed by Busby Berkeley who Jack Warner believed in keeping busy in between musicals. Berkeley in fact would soon be leaving Warner Brothers for MGM.

Gary Busey did a splendid job playing the rock-n-roll legend Buddy Holly(1936-59). He does have a spitting image to the man. Being a garage band in the 50's is sure different from today's. Having a group of three is usually simple back in those days. I bet that Buddy Holly(Busey) was a much better musician than most of what I heard. Since he lived in Lubbock, Texas, it was only a quiet country town back then. His parents were Christians, though his mother was a strong supporter of her son's work.

Not a stunner , but a good movie to see once or twice . Bill Macy shows he can do comedy . The movie is slow moving and the character development takes a back seat to the action . The film's best sequence has the bad guy going up against a woman in her own home . The last half of the movie is very good , but it could have been improved if the story was more tightened . The ending was rather weak and could have used a bit more closure . Still , an okay movie to watch while on the couch one Sunday night .

The cinema of the 60s was as much as time of revolution as the politics and the music . Filmmakers began to take more artistic and creative risks, using experimental film techniques to create some of the most memorable and influential movies in cinema history. Here is our list of the top 25 movies of the 1960s
This 1962 classic staring James Dean and Natalie Wood was the third and final film that Dean ever made. It tells the story of a group of California teens who fall into the drug and alcohol culture of the time, and their struggle with the consequences.

Despite of all the negative criticism I really enjoyed this movie. I am not saying this lightly. I love movies and am fairly picky about them (my home DVD collection is over 9,000 movies - some are great, others are OK, a few I do not like at all). And, to all those with criticisms: this is a comedy. I simply love this movie. It is light, funny, and very restful. I am aware of all (or most) of the deficiencies but I love it.

There are a select few cartoon films where animals or something "not human" is portraying human beings and I think that this film is one of them. Apart from a few points of the plot and the characters - this film could be changed with all people rather than mainly animals. Although - it's good someone did not - I feel the cats are jolly good in this film portraying humans! :-)This film also focuses on quite a lot of adult issues - which is rather odd for a Disney film.

By convincing the Prime Minister to back the totally unsuitable Ali G as a candidate for Staines in the local elections, I'd done it. A year ago, if anyone had predicted this would happen, they would have been laughed out of town. But that was then and this was now. What I couldn't foresee was that we'd lose the election, too. That was a surprise to me, but then, of course, everything in life is a series of surprises, so that's not a surprise.

I had heard of John Garfield , but , did n't know him . I loved this movie . I would like to see more movies from the 40's. Another excellent film from Hitchcock! The story is suspenseful and exciting. This was a good movie, I recommend it to anyone who wants to see a different kind of movie. Very suspenseful and intriguing . WOW! this movie has a lot of depth. I never expected it to have such meaning. I love this movie, it makes you really feel what the characters are feeling. The suspense of this movie is just amazing.

Jenny Lewis plays an awkward girl called Jade . She smokes and drinks . She does n't have a lot of money. She has a crush on a girl called Jenny and Jenny doesn' t know it. Jade can 't talk much as she is too nervous. Jade 's mother is an alcoholic. They have just moved out of their flat and into a hotel. She is very poor and has no friends. Jade 's dad is a doctor and doesn ' t like talking to his daughter . Jade 's mum is really embarrassed about being a doctor 's daughter .

I'm not sure why this film is averaging so low on IMDb when it's absolutely everything you could ever want in a horror film. This is the definition of being a horror film. I consider myself to be a big horror fan and I must say that this house delivers the goods. House of wax Is the story of a group of college kids on their way to a football game whom decide to camp out for the night and have a run in with a local weirdo. Upon waking the next morning they make a gruesome discovery and decide to go into town for a broken car part.

The Ali G show was really something amazing - he was so stupid wannabe rapper , but no one he met was too bright and everyone was happy to play along with his stupidity. I wonder if any of the guests on his chat show were like that, and if they took him seriously. I think it depends. I wouldn't do it if it wasn't my profession, because it is not always a great pleasure to pretend you are interested in some stupid conversation. And it would also be very boring for me if it was like this.

I watch the show every day and it is very entertaining. It provides updates of tech news, video games pretty much everything geek. They are also the official broadcasters of E3 and Comiccon. If you are a geek, gamers or anything really, you will enjoy this show. They have definitely upped their game since the guy below me's review (2006). It's the only place that I get my tech info. Kevin Pereira and Olivia Munn work beautifully with each other and the show always has segments referring to things in the game, movie, comic... Universe.

Enhanced by the expressive cinematography of Agnes Godard ( Beau Travail ) , Golden Door is a visually striking tone poem of the migrant experience—a modern parable about what happens when dreams become realities and what happens to those who are left behind. Based on an idea by acclaimed American author Jhumpa Lahiri ( The Namesake ) , the story begins in 1950s rural Italy where a young, pregnant immigrant woman, Vincenzo’s mother ( Marisa Borini , a non-professional actor ) , has been shipped off by her family to the land of opportunity by her older sister.

I've heard a lot of different opinions about this film and then to find out that Paris Hilton was in it as well didn't give Me the best impression of the film .... then to be dragged to the cinema by a group of my friends and sit there expecting a pile of pants i was shocked to find that i was scared stiff all the way through the film ... it was predictable yes but the build up of the deaths and the whole atmosphere of the film made it REALLY scary for me ... i was watching through my fingers the whole way through.

The animation quality here is decidedly below par IMO , regardless of the age of the OAV . The plot is clichéd to say the least and the script seems to be lacking a lot of logic . There are so many flaws and discrepancies here it is not even funny . But most of all I really don’t understand the purpose of it all ….. This entry was posted on Saturday, April 21st, 2007 at 12:02 am and is filed under The Anime Years: 2006. You can follow any responses to this entry through the RSS 2.0 feed.

If you have n't seen this film , do it . Its a genremix as i 've never seen another movie like it. The story is so interesting and its really funny. I've seen this film a lot of times and i'm still not tired of it. There are more than a few things about the film you can cherish , like the acting of the actors . But what about the main actors you may well wonder ? We think that this film was one of those rare gems you find from time to time , if you know what we mean .

It took me a while to find this movie since they don't have it yet on DVD (and my VCR is not worth hooking up again). I guess all the referencing to drug use is too much for some folks. But I found a decent bootleg on Ebay and I must say that anyone who takes this movie too seriously is just retarded. It is a slap stick spoof in the vein of "Airplane." I must say that when I watched it on Showtime or Spotlight growing up in the 80s, I enjoyed the humor a whole lot more then, than I do now.

Is this a good movie ? It 's hard to say -- but in 1953 , for many people , it must have been an unforgettable experience . Here , in 2005 , is it still worth seeing ? I'd say , yes . It's an excruciating experience , but one worth watching. The acting , especially in the last act is superb . As a film , it works extremely well -- the camera , lighting , music -- everything -- it all seems just right . But , for me , it's the storyline and the situation it describes that is its most compelling aspect.

I don't see what the problem is with SOME people and their NEED for intellectual humor. You need to get your head out of your up-tight ass if you don't find this movie hilarious! If this isn't your "cup of tea", so to speak, then look at it for what it truly is- a damn funny movie. Maybe they DID set out to make yet another drugs/T&A movie, but in this case, they've truly hit the spot. It's especially funny for the Ali G fans, because he delivers everything we've come to love and expect from him.

This is one of my favorite films , ever . The story is just so fantastic and the characters are amazing and just perfect for this film . This is a film that you can just get lost in and forget that it’s only about 116 minutes long . The cast is perfect for each of their characters . This is the kind of film that I love to show people who just want to see a good movie . There’s so little of this type of movie that I love and I want more people to see it .

What's the point of this messages if not to discuss and share thoughts about the next season... Here is my forecast: 1. The hatch was indeed blown, but somehow everybody inside survived. Buts lets see about that. 2. The episode at the end with the tent is an observation team monitoring the tracking device installed on Desmonds boat by Penny. Now that the magnetic shield around the island was lifted, the signal was picked up by the observation station and they are going to send a rescue mission. 3.

David Attenborough brings his fascination of wild life, this time the creatures under the sea, in this extraordinary 8-episode trip to all the animals under the sea!The cinematography is astounding, bringing to the screen truly breathtaking footage of those whales! But the best thing about it, as well as seeing each episode, is how they made it! Whether it is making models of creatures, or those impressive shots of the whales, they explain to you in about 10 minutes how they did it!2001 had some great tv shows to our screen.

Charles Chaplin 's 'Shoulder Arms ' of 1918 was his longest film to date , though , at just over 53 minutes , it was only marginally longer than his previous masterpiece ' the Kid ' .
