Captain Corelli's Mandolin is one of Nicolas Cage's better films. He turns a fine performance as the title character. This is a romance set against the backdrop of a worn torn island. John Hurt's character gives his daughter, played beautifully by Penelope Cruz, some honest advice about love. This movie doesn't have the fault of being completely predictable. This movie also allows Cruz to turn in a performance as a strong woman who knows her own mind and heart. Once the film warms up beyond the opening sequence this film keep you focused on it.

I Loved this movie . Mark Blankfield was perfect for this role . More Classic sci/fie/Horror films should be remade in this way. I hope that there are more classic films that will be remade with such a treatment. They should not try and update the films too much as they would lose there charm. This film would make a good dvd double feature with the 1980 classic "Humanoids form the deep"
Very funny and very cheesy, as I expected, and I liked that. It was like watching an old movie from the 60's.

Dr. Paul Flanner ( Richard Gere ) , a successful surgeon , has his wife leave him , his son leaves him for school , and he can t get any work done because his staff is so incompetent. His friend and fellow doctor Dr. Michael Hfitz ( William Hurt ) tells him he should move to France to get a fresh start . Paul moves , but his life gets even more bizarre as he moves from Paris to New York . Paul starts a new job , gets a beautiful girlfriend , and a chance to have a life . However , there s someone out there who wants Paul dead !

*May Contain Spoilers*The first time I saw this movie was when it was re-released on video when I was around 8 years old. Now I am 17 and still watch it whenever I get a chance to. "The Aristocats" was a cute heart warming film that I immediately fell in love with. I loved the songs on it especially the one the kittens sing by the piano. In fact I even sang it in a talent show with my sister and friend since I loved it that much. All three kittens are so cute and their mother is one of the prettiest cartoon cats I ever saw.

This is one of the best sequels around and a very good movie too even there were some mistakes but still I enjoyed it. This time, Charles is not just fighting one or two muggers but a whole army of them. Death Wish 3 has a lot great action scenes and I enjoyed it every single second of it. Director Michael Winner knows how to direct a good action movie like this and Jimmy Page providing the music, with producers Golan and Globus still doing there thing and Charles Bronson is still acting good for Paul Kersey.

Nominated for best documentary feature at 2004 's Academy Awards , My Architect follows filmmaker Nathaniel Kahn in his quest to understand his father's life and career as an architect, especially in light of the fact that his father -- Louis Kahn -- died before his son was born. Along the way, viewers are treated to stunning footage of some of Kahn's most acclaimed work. Architecture & Architectural Monuments
Louis Kahn is the subject of this biographical documentary about the architect and artist, whose work included the Kimball Art Museum in Fort Worth. Kahn was a celebrated modernist, and the filmmaker, Nathaniel Kahn, is also an architect.

When the Romulans come , they will not be bearing gifts ; no , they bring with them war - and death. These are the Romulan War , and this is the beginning of the end . In the depths of the Star Empire of the Romulans lies a secret that could mean the end of the UFP , or the salvation of the entire Federation. But who is telling the truth? Who is willing to do what is necessary ? The Romulan War is about to begin - and a new hero will emerge from the shadows to face a new destiny - one that will shake Starfleet to its core.

Accepted is one of the best teenage comedies I have seen in a long time. It has an original script, talented cast and it delivers an hour and a half of pure unadulterated fun.It tells the story of a high school graduate Bartleby "B" Gains (Justin Long) who is not accepted in any of the collages he applied to, so to avoid his parents' disappointment he creates a fictional collage. In the attempt to fool his parents completely he creates a fake website and turns an old psychiatric hospital into a school.

From the creators of Bruce Almighty and Liar Liar! The film took a while to pick up from the start, at least for me seeing as I expected this was a run-along America Pie flick. But it was slightly different-- a fun-loving slacker who finishes high school and makes his OWN college, running it accordingly. As you can expect, there's a lot of parties and hot girls in bikinis but this film tried harder than your average teen flick. Bartleby Gaines (Justin Long) encourages his students / peers to learn through freedom of expression and ultimately 'shove it to the system.'

I do not think that this movie deserves the low rating that most will give it. It's one of the best "teenager" horror films I've ever seen; and that's saying a lot. Nothing is left without an explanation to back it up, the characters and plot break countless horror movie stereotypes, and it has got nothing to do with some other horrible pieces we've been submitted to lately. (A clear example is the mindless "Saint Ange".) The first 30-40 minutes might be downright boring with the exception of the beginning, although some minor light mistakes can be easily spotted.

What a shame this movie was never released . ( It is now playing on cable . ) I tuned in to see this because the trailer looked pretty good. I had to turn it off. I never read the book but the movie was so slow moving I never got into it. I think that maybe the book is a little too long but it was so slow in the movie. There is no way to follow the story and the characters do not come alive . It is so much like a boring tv movie that it could be shown anywhere .

I 'm not a massive Disney fan , but my 7 year old son is starting to get into them , I think as he starts school next year he will enjoy this. Great review, my son is very excited for this to arrive in the post. I haven't watched Frozen as I am not keen on watching animated films, even if it's in 3d. Aww my daughter is loving Frozen! We saw the film at the cinema and I was a bit worried it would be too much like Tangled, but I actually really enjoyed it and thought that Elsa was amazing.

When I started watching 3 of the episodes of this series on the Action Channel , I have to say, I really enjoyed it. I’m glad I discovered this series. The action scenes were very exciting and it had a great plot. The fight sequences are very entertaining to watch and it has a great story line. I would definitely recommend this for a marathon of an action packed weekend. Action Channel is a Singaporean pay television channel which was launched by MediaCorp TV12 in 2007. It is the second channel to be aired in HD format, with 1080p high definition video and 5.1 surround sound.

Even after nearly 20 years apart , the original members of Black Sabbath have not lost a thing . In fact they sound as if they never missed a beat with the opening number , "The End of the Beginning ". As is the norm at the beginning of Sabbath tours , the band opened with a track from the first album , which was the beginning of their career. The band's set was a mix of classics like "War pigs" , and songs like "Behind the Sun" from their most recent studio album 13.

Well , I guess I was in the mood for a movie that really grabbed me from the beginning . This is the first movie that I have seen with a woman as the leader . The movie really was good , I really did not know where it was going after the first few minutes and it turned out to be an extremely good movie , I would give it 4 out of 5 . It's nice to see a movie where women are treated as people. I love movies with a strong female lead. This one did not disappoint.

Do you liked "Dead Man don't wear Plaid"? What about "Top Secret" and "A Chorus Line"? Well Müllers Büro is a fantastic Melange of all three of them, as unlikely it may seem. Very Funny "tongue in Cheek" Movie Noir hommage with stunning Songs and great Dancing. You have to have a little odd humor for this movie, but it is very well worth seeing it. I've voted it a nine, If the end would be a bit more logic it would have gotten a ten. Thats how Good that Movie is.

This is another film where the cinematography is the best thing to recommend it . That would be fine if it was a documentary but as it turns out this is a biopic which means I am watching a performance by someone in a role which is based on the life of a real person. And I hate watching biopics. To me, biopics of famous historical figures are nothing more than an opportunity for a mediocre actor to win a Golden Globe or an Oscar for doing something they could do without winning the award if they tried a little harder.

This is another film where the cinematography is the best thing to recommend it. That would be fine if the film were a travelogue, but as a dramatic exercise in cinematic artistry, that is not good enough. The theme of inter-species respect and co-operation ventures timidly into the forbidden world of inter-species love, but its approach is stereotypical, indicating a lack of understanding of the behavior motives of either species. As with many films, one always wonders what could have been achieved by a more innovative director and a more creative screenwriter. Alas, we probably will never know.

I never realized what a fabulous dancer Lana Turner was until I saw this movie . She was only 19 years old in this movie, but I was absolutely floored by her dancing skills, which were very much in the style of Gene Kelly's dancing style. I'm going to watch the rest of this movie soon and hope to find out a bit more about her. Lana was 15 when she had her first kiss with actor Artie Shaw. Lana also had an affair with Howard Hughes who was 33 years her senior.

I think it definitely is . The writing is of such a quality that beginner students of the English language should read it . The language is simple to follow . The story was simple and yet had so much meaning . I think you can get a lot out of the story , so much meaning and lessons taught . The novel was a classic in my family, and it was not hard to understand, the language was so simple that even a 7th grader can understand it. The lessons we can take away from this novel are numerous.

In the first transformation scene , what is the music ? I 've heard it was `` The Greeks Do It Better '', but what was the name of the song ? The name of the song is actually 'The Greens Make Love' and is played in a mash up version. The mash up in question is here. Thank You very much, I have been looking for it for years. Can anyone help? I'm trying to remember a song that was played during the opening transformation scene. In fact I think it may have been the first transformation in the movie.

This movie , based on a true story of Gerrit Wolfaardt , is one of the best films I 've seen in ages. The acting is superb, the scenery is beautiful and the music is magnificent. It tells the story of a young Dutchman , Wolfaardt, who, while on a journey on a train , finds himself stranded in a German town. He finds work with some German soldiers , and ends up teaching them how to play soccer. When the German's leave the little town, the villagers don't want to see the fields abandoned, and so decide to continue the soccer games.

I went to the pre-screening of "Rory O'Shea Was Here." I like this movie better than I expected, because the excellent casts and the powerful performance. It's a film about the friendship of two handicapped young man. Rory is free spirit young man who wants to be independent regardless his Duchenne muscular dystrophy. He can only move his two fingers but he can talk eloquently and help his new pal, Michael, who has cerebral palsy and is significantly speech impaired. I guess that's enough to start with a weeping drama. Well, it is.

Exclusively for Coop's lovers, though Clint Eastwood very strong though unobtrusive presence is a great asset of this very good documentary film. It is a biography of Gary Cooper, based mainly on his filmography, but also on more private archives, which show him as a child, as a young man, as a family man, with some of his friends (Picasso, Hemingway, etc. ), as an older man, finally as a sick and close-to-death man. After "the end", I did not have the feeling that I knew the man any much better.

I never realized what a fabulous dancer Lana Turner was until I saw this movie. She was only 19 years old and gorgeous. What a pleasure to watch her dance with George Murphy. The story line was typical for its day but the dancing was really special. I never tire of watching Fred and Ginger but Lana Turner in this movie was just as terrific. I always thought of Lana as a so-so actress who tended to over act. She should have done more dancing and less of the Maddam X and Peyton Place roles. I had a new appreciation for her after seeing this movie and her wonderful dancing.

by TyNesha Mells . In this drama , Ja Rule , who stars as Reggie , struggles with the loss of both his mother and brother to violence , and is on his way back to his hometown to put things back together and find his older brother's girlfriend who he left in a daze when his brother was murdered.... 11/02/2013 · I want to buy the book The Lost Boy: A Foster Child, A Foster Family, A Life Revealed. I know it's about Ja Rule. But it is not in my library. 12/11/2017 · This feature is not available right now.

In this early Fulci work the director shows his most mainstream side as well as a talent for compelling storytelling and more than reasonable elucidation for the genre. Personally I think he has been unfairly maligned throughout his career as an aesthete of gore. It's a pretty capable procedural and surprised me with its subtextually rich narrative that shows his distrust for small minded small-town mentality and the inefficiency of the police, as well as the twisted ideals of the Catholic church, the last of which seemed to have cut this film at its knees when it was first released and could have possibly given the director another direction so early on.

When I saw this movie i expected it to be a cheesy American movie done on the cheap with appalling actors. I was really surprised to find that i was totally wrong. The movie centres around Bartely or B who has been rejected from all of his colleges- the actor who play B is very natural and makes his character seem real- and decides to create a pretend school so his parents stop harassing him. However loads of people see his fake website and join. Feeling their sorrows B can't turn them away much to the chagrin of his best mate.

My Architect is a great film about Nathaniel Kahn's search for himself via the legacy of his famous Architect father, Louis Kahn, dead since 1974. The film builds slowly, but perfectly, and what starts out as a seemingly lost fortysomething's identity crisis unfolds into a beautiful tale with much deeper meaning with regard to the importance of love, loss, family and perhaps more importantly, our life's work.I had never heard of Louis Kahn prior to this film, although I was vaguely familiar with some of his work.

Very touching film, a great surprise to come up from Brazil, a country that usually exports features about social themes, violence, sex... Magical realism is a very hard task, and I believe João Falcão has made it wonderfully. It seems that he really didn't intend to make a realistic film, far from that. Although many people think the film was adapted from the play, he said in his interviews that he actually based the film on the book. Another mistake is to think that Falcão has been influenced by the series "Hoje é Dia De Maria".

Saw the film at the closing gala of the Ealing Film Festival in West London ( England ) . Enjoyed it very much, especially since I have never been to America . I thought it would be boring with all the baseball but found it interesting. The acting was very good , especially by the two girls. It was very real and I thought the casting was brilliant. I've not watched a movie in ages and this one had me laughing all the time. I'll definitely be buying this film. This is a fun movie, and I'm not a baseball fan.

*Could contain spoilers, read only after seeing last episode season 2* Think about it. The guys on the north pole? Center of the earth? Looking for abnormal magnetic behavior? They also said something about: "did we miss it again?" So there was another abnormality? Of course that was when the plain crashed! I think this whole Island is a setup. Set up by her daddy. She found out about it and is looking for her Desmond. How else can she know what to look for.So basically it's an Island in a magnetic shield.

i did not read the book . nor do i care to . the movie was a beautiful romance , so i would think the movie was a good representation of the book . i like the story and the way the story plays out . i found it interesting that the lead actor was not really a star . he had been in other things , but not starred in a movie . i thought that made him a good fit for the lead . the movie made me cry . and i know i will still be crying over this movie as the years pass by .

Chaplin is a doughboy in his final film of 1918, a doughboy who can not seem to get the marching down straight. He spends time "over there" in World War One trenches. Several gags stand out: Limburger cheese as a makeshift grenade for one. The cramped quarters of the barracks in the trenches and when Chaplin and his mates are washed out of their bunks by flooding are highlights. Chaplin ends up capturing several German soldiers single-handed, and he spanks the German commander for refusing a cigarette. When asked how he did it, Chaplin replies that he surrounded them.

I loved this film!! I have been waiting for this film to come out so I could see it. I saw it opening night and loved it, Some people told me that this film wasn't any good and to stay away but I thought it was great. The actors did great and it was scary and made me jump. Paris Hilton did a great job for her first film, everybody is giving her a hard time when she did great and she didn't even have that big of a role. The set was great has it was made of all wax and how it was made.

Separate LIES changed my life . Actually , the Q & A did.SPOILERS BELOW . Read only if you watch it . Separate lies is the most important movie of all time . I never knew it was a lie or that they are all lying . In 2017, I was working a summer job at a 7-Eleven convenience store. I was in the middle of working when a middle aged black woman came into the store and told me that I needed to go to the back office. The manager had asked to speak with me. I went back and the manager asked what happened.

Sacha Baron Cohen is a genius . And this movie is good ! Although the film does n't nearly reach the heights of the Borat movie ( which still is in my top five favorite movies ever ! ) but it's a good time , the film is very funny and the actors give some of the finest comedic performances of the year . The film is hilarious ( especially the scenes in the desert of Morocco , where a bunch of terrorists in full uniform chase our hero with a gun to his back ! ), the acting is excellent and the laughs just keep coming .

This is sweet. The actress who played the nurse with the gonzongas is the same actress who plays Elvira mistress of the dark. Another little tidbit is the actress who played the nurse who would give her wedding ring was the landlord lady of Roy Munsin in King Pin. This is most glorious story ever to be told. It should sell more copies than the bible. My parents played a part in suggesting the release of this movie to a local movie theater. The movie ran for a week and we were one of 4 families to see it.

When I first saw this movie , I also expected `` our boys '' to be cute , and more handsome than the actual. But it was actually a very good movie , I really like it , my parents didn't but that was expected . If you haven't seen it , please watch it , I recommend it . Oh yea , they did have a really cute Korean guy with a Korean accent . And the storyline is actually very good as well , and the Korean guy is not a stereotypical asian , it's a very normal Korean guy .

"Showtime" falls somewhere north of what some critics have been saying, and a little south of what I expected months ago when I first heard about Eddie Murphy and Robert Di Niro teaming up for a comedy. Overall, it was pretty good! As "real life" crime or cops go-- and plot, for that matter-- it is pretty illogical, but DUH--- this is a comedy. Also, while the special effects, chases, aerial shots, and skyscrapers blowing up were present but lower key than a Schwartzenegger movie, I found it a bit tiresome and overdone.

Was very fortunate to see the movie Hari Om at The Bermuda International Film Festival . It was the opening night movie. It was the last film that my mom saw and she passed away from cancer in October. I wanted to bring my husband but he was so busy in the city. So I took my son and his girlfriend. I didn’t know much about the movie and I will say it touched me so much that I cried. It’s so hard for me to get through the movie as I miss my mom so much.

I ca n't say how many times that one line has made me laugh or how often I 've described it. It has a way of making me smile and it has the most perfect imagery and rhyme that makes it so enjoyable. It was written by a famous playwright, but I don't believe he ever wrote anything quite as funny and enjoyable as this line. This is the line from the famous play, "A Man of La Mancha" in the play, the "Impossible Dream". This particular line has been used so many times that I've lost count.

I've never seen the original "House Of Wax" so I really didn't know what to expect when I went to a sneak preview of the new film. After a somewhat wobbly start introducing our young characters, "House Of Wax" shifts gears and becomes an extremely effective horror outing.The plot really doesn't matter too much here - I think most people know upon seeing this that these stranded kids are going to meet up with a nasty killer and find some awful things in the titular house of wax. It's all about the special effects here, and they are top notch.

If you expect that this movie is full of action and grabbing you from the start then don't watch it. But if you like those kind of meditative movies which stick in your mind for a while, until you get the details, then you will love it. Now don't get me wrong there is action and there are things going on just not in the usual way. Basically the plot is in a post-apocalyptic world where anyone fights in his (or their) way for survival. In this fight they lost the ability to speak...

I think this show was right on the money for me . I watched it over the plane but there was not a single boring minute , the story , the actors, everything was so good that I just sat there with tears in my eyes at the final scene. The acting was so great that it just hit you where to feel and I am glad I saw it when I got home , I can't imagine sitting through it on the plane, it would have been just to much to handle . Thank you all so very much for the great job , my sincere applause and praise to everyone .

`` Live Together , Die Alone '' is divided into three main story lines , and each one of them is more or less connected with each other , even though these three are very different and unrelated . First of these stories , and this is our main story , is about the first time , or better said the first meeting , between Jack and Sawyer , while the second is a flashback to the past of the man who is now known as Sawyer . These two stories are actually very similar , since both are stories about two people coming together , Jack and Sawyer , to work for a common goal .

NOBODY (1999) is a fantastic piece of Japanese noir. It's about three salarymen who get in way over their heads when their innocent, drunken cheapshots p*** off three OTHER guys one night in a bar. When these three mysterious strangers, who are up to much more deviant no-goodness than even the film allows us to know, beat the living daylights out of one of our "heroes", the trio decides to return the favour in kind - only they accidentally KILL one of the other guys!

The `` all I have is 5 dollars and my wedding ring ... '' scene was a riot . I'm gonna be watching again and again. The scene in the hotel room was good. It's kind of what I thought was gonna happen and it made sense. I didn't want to see them getting married. I wanted to see her with her daughter in the future. The scene was good, I was not disappointed. I'd love to see it with the original cast and see them in their late 30's/early 40's.

I first saw The Victim (aka Out Of Contention) well over 25 years ago when I was very young. Being a passionate fan of Bewitched since I was a child, I loved to watch anything that starred Elizabeth Montgomery. This movie was (and still is) a real treat - whether you are a fan of Miss Montgomery's work or not. Elizabeth always shines in her roles, such as her portrayal as the rape victim in A Case Of Rape and as the suspected murderess in The Legend Of Lizzie Borden.

I think that this short TV series, was absolutely wonderful, and gave both a in-depth and clear explanation of everything that was on the screen at the given time. This was by far David Attenborough at his best. I personally thought this was one of the best documentaries in the past decade. This is definitely worth peoples money!I also found the bit about the abyss and deep water the most fascinating and interesting part. It was incredible to find out that the 'Blue planet' team discovered more than 10 new species of underwater life!

There are a select few cartoon films where animals or something `` not human '' is portraying human beings and their actions and or behavior. In most of these types of film characters, whether animals or something else portrayed as a human, usually has some human qualities. One thing that is common is that these characters usually live in a non-human world. Most animal cartoons are about animals in some type of fantastical world doing human things like going to work. Most of the times, the animal or whatever portraying a human character, in the animal world is a loner, which makes the animal character different and unique.

I thought this movie was pretty good!OK, so maybe it had a few scenes that could make people think of other horror movies, but i have seen a lot more pathetic movies that got much higher ratings than this! Many movies nowadays are remade to a more modern version and there's nothing wrong with that, it keeps the story alive. i don't think this movie was pathetic at all and i'm not just saying that because i'm a major Chad Michael Murray fan, but because i enjoyed it.

I was 19 or 20 , years old at the time and living in Salt Lake City , Utah and was driving to work one morning. The radio was tuned to our local station and as it came to the end of one song it segwayed into a news bulletin about the shooting. The voice on the news said the President had been shot. My first reaction was , "Its a joke and they are just playing a song about the shooting." After a few moments my brain registered what was being said and I thought to myself," That can not be" I turned off the radio.

Pierre Jolivet plays a Don Quixote character , unable to speak , living in a world incompatible with modern life , with a great sense of humor. He’s hilarious and sad at the same time. This is a film in which the characters find themselves in a world they cannot accept, a world that has nothing to do with what they are used to. This film is also a portrait of a small community. There is no such thing as an urban community these days, but a community that is geared around the world of agriculture.

This version of "The Lost Horizon" is actually not a bad film at all. I think the problem is people like to pick on musicals, especially those made in the 70s. I saw the film upon its original release in 1973 (I was ten) and really enjoyed it, the music especially. (Burt Bacharach has always been a favorite.) The story is fun, the acting is good, and technically it's excellent. Sure, there are one or two rather silly dance numbers, but hey, you can't win 'em all.

When I saw this movie i expected it to be a cheesy American movie done on the cheap with appalling acting. But it was actually a very enjoyable, well thought out, well acted and intelligent movie made on a fairly modest budget. The acting is uniformly of a very high standard and the dialogue very well written. If this had been a big budget American movie with famous actors it would have received much better reviews and would have probably been a box office success (although it would have also been more overhyped).

probably the best horror movie in 5 years.. there's been lame remakes, attempts to make you scared (when all they make you do is walk out of the theater) and movies that just shouldn't have been made. but this one is worth it. the only reason i didn't give it a 10 is because Paris Hilton is in it (but her death scene makes up for it, believe me)....so here they are.. the SPOILERS of all the death scenes in the movie..1. my favorite death scene ever - Paris Hilton's!

Try to look for another movie that is such a trip without having a story or plot and you'll be hard-pressed. HEAD is a masterpiece of non-linear non-structure, surrealism and experimentaion. In less than 90 minutes, it manages to be not only a time-capsule of an era, but also a full-length experimental feature that defies time,space and convention in a way that only underground films of the sixties could.HEAD is a reflection of those films. No matter how one feels about the Monkees, this is a film every filmmaker should see because it cracks wide open the endless possibilities of film as an art medium.

What a cast of actors and actresses in this Columbo episode , beside Peter Falk , you have Julie Newmar , Barbara Anderson , Leonard Stone , Sam Waterston and of course William Windom , as the suspect in this episode. This Columbo episode is a good one. It has many plot twists and turns. It's about a murder , the murder of an acting coach and it also has an affair between the actress he was having an affair with . If you haven't seen it you need to watch the episode to see what I am talking about .

Louis Khan was one of the most influential architects of our time , and this film speaks volumes about how he and his ideas changed the way we see our world. It is the story of how Louis I. Kahn's work and his philosophy transformed the lives of his students, his patrons, and an entire nation. It is told in intimate interviews with members of his family and with leading architects such as Frank Gehry, Robert A. M. Stern, Robert Venturi, and Philip Johnson, whose work has been greatly influenced by Kahn.

Fantastic Chaplin movie with many memorable moments as Charlie joins the army to fight in WW 1.At first he goes to boot camp, where he has to learn how to handle his rifle and how to walk in line. That's a really funny scene as the tramp is not used to keeping his feet straight!Next thing you know he's in France in a trench. Hilarious scenes here include a starving Charlie eating the cheese of a mousetrap and reading a letter from home over someone's shoulder.When Charlie goes to sleep he finds his bunker all flooded and his roommate snoring.

I saw Borderline several years ago on AMC. I've been looking for it ever since. It was haunting: visual, textural, sensual. This movie took me somewhere like a dream and I didn't care where. I will never forget the curtain blowing in the breeze. I still remember the way it made me tilt my head. I remember my facial expression when I saw it. I didn't know what had happened when the movie was over, but I find life is that way. It didn't bother me.

This is an example of what film school lecturers would call a good debut movie. It follows all the rules. Short scenes, to the point, cheap to shoot, guerilla-film-making, no sets (just disused buildings) and possibly an empty hospital wing. Also, even the black&white film-stock was a stroke of genius, probably selected more for its low expense rather than film effect, but it worked.Reno was amazing as the Brute. Everyone's acting was brilliant. The plot was simple and effective and no flabby bits left to distract you.

When I saw this film at a festival years ago I was very impressed and I started to looking for it. When I got a DVD, I didn't find the movie in the best form, but still worth to watch. The story takes place in the period between the 2nd and the 3rd world war. A man and his wife move from Berlin to the country with their little daughter. They bought a nice house, but they soon notice, that the neighborhood isn't really friendly and the town is in deep depression.

A very suspenseful giallo from the director of `` L'Anticristo '' ( 1974 ) , this one begins with a murder in a sewer. The body is dragged out by a man who works in a restaurant, and when he notices a knife that was used, he is told that it was a robbery. He discovers that a very beautiful woman worked in the room where he found the body and he is convinced that she was responsible for the murder, and not the robbery that she reports. This is a very interesting giallo film that moves along at a rapid pace, with much suspense and drama.

Duchess and her three kittens are enjoying the high life with their devoted human mistress until the wicked butler Edgar has a plot to take them all over to Paris. So it's up to the kittens to save the day and the family. The Cat in the Hat Knows a Lot About Halloween by Dr. Seuss - 364 pages
When the Cat in the Hat steps on the mat, Sally and her brother are in for a trick or a treat! From the best-selling team of Tish Rabe and Joe Mathieu comes a book as wild and wacky as the original classic.

It was a terrific movie! I like to watch it again and again. The actors were awesome. The movie kept me on the edge of my seat. I would recommend this movie to anyone. I wish Lifetime would put this movie on DVD. I would most definitely purchase a copy. This movie just proves that you should be very careful about who you get hooked up with. You may think you know someone, but you never know. My daughter watched the movie with me. She thought it was great. All I know is, I will watch this movie every time Lifetime airs it.

Frank Langella steals my heart in everything he has ever been in! I love watching him!! i was 10 yrs old (1979) when i seen him for the first time.i eagerly await each and everything he'll be acting in. hopefully one day i can see him in person. he's very hypnotic and mysterious and that voice is commanding and strong! he is very attractive, even now at 65 he is absolutely stunning!!!! In my opinion he is the greatest actor iv'e ever seen!

Cult-director Lucio Fulci is probably most famous for his gory Zombie flicks from the 1980s that earned him his rightful title as the “Italian Zombi King.” But before his breakthrough success, Fulci’s career spanned 40-plus years, with over 40 films under his belt. One of his earliest features was The White Slave Trade, a 1964 Italian drama. It was recently released by Grindhouse Releasing on a brand-new HD master. The White Slave Trade was originally released as the Italian title Il trafficante di bianchi, a nod to the crime thrillers of Italian director Roberto Rossellini.

Hey look, you don't watch this movie to change your life! But if you are female especially and have always had a little thing for Richard Gere; this movie is right up your street. Diane Lane and Richard Gere have on screen chemistry going way back. 'Nights in Rodanthe' is not a Oscar winner movie and it will probably be forgotten sooner rather than later but if you want an atmospheric, beautifully shot love story between MIDDLE AGED good looking people (they don't make your stomach turn and even when Gere is 'on top' he does not look too jowly) then this is the movie for you.

`` D.O.A '' is an involving and entertaining little picture from start to finish . Dennis Quaid is at his best here , as he brings his character to life in every frame and gives his all to this great little character role . A lot of great supporting work from the likes of Ned Beatty , Joe Mantegna and Tony Shalhoub , and good music and cinematography round out the experience of this great picture , and it's one of those films where you really start to wonder where it all came from . This one is certainly worth at least one viewing . A lot of fun.

Too bad somebody did not have the smarts to release this movie to theaters . I had never heard of the movie and was very pleasantly surprised that this is one of the best films i have ever seen. The storyline is very good, and i found myself wondering if the events depicted were based on real life events. I am very pleased with this movie and it has a slot in my DVD collection. Highly recommended! This is a film that I came across when it was aired in the 90's on HBO. This film features a very strong cast and a strong story.

It's up there with Where's Poppa, The Groove Tube, Putney Swope. It memorializes the NY city mind set of the period, a wonderfully strange man with a bizarre plan, hoist by by own petard, and at last retreating into the bed of his adoptive parents. Totally absurd, its the life one sees through the magic glasses, seeing things as they "really are"... I don't think it is ever shown anymore. If so, surely someone would Tivo the thing and put it out there.

i love this film!! maybe it is my generation but i can really connect with what he is talking about and means to do. it kept me laughing for the duration. duration of the film, the next day, and beyond. i think this film is not one to watch if you mainly care about the plot and character development. this film is pretty much only for the generation that will understand it. there are lots of things you just know being brought up in that generation that you wouldn't if you were say 40. i think Sacha barren Cohen was Very and i do mean Very good.

If you like who-dun-its , you will like this film , considered the best Italian detective story ( giallo ) of the 1960s , starring Jean Seberg and Anthony Perkins . Although it was a failure at the box office , it was a big hit in France , Spain and Germany. I can't believe this film is not mentioned more often as one of the best thrillers of the 1960's . It is full of twists and turns that keeps the viewer on the edge of the seat. It is one of Jean Seberg best films, who is also the film's lead.

Another popular screening for a British picture at Coalville 's Century Theatre . A well crafted , solid drama with strong characters played well by an excellent cast . This was an opportunity to see two of the great British comic actors of their generation , John Thaw and Dennis Waterman , together in an intelligent screenplay and directed by the very talented Ken Loach . Though a fictional story, it does have the feel of a docu-drama , being loosely based on the lives of two young people growing up on a housing estate near Manchester in the late 1950’s / early 1960’s .

This movie is beautiful in all ways . It is visually stunning , and this is a good thing since the movie follows the story of the artist's life in Paris in the 20s. However , it does feel a bit long and drawn out. This movie also feels very melodramatic , especially in the middle. That said , I did feel a bit emotional at the end of it all. I could understand the reasons he did what he did. The cast is good. The movie is well directed. I didn't dislike this movie , I just thought it wasn't perfect.

This is probably the second best of the Death Wish movies. Death Wish 5 is the best one.Death Wish 3 reminds me of "West Side Story" with a new twist. Not even the recent flick "Gangs of New York" can measure up with one New York neighborhood in Death Wish 3 which is plagued not by two rival gangs---but one big gang. A gang that is willing to do things like cutting a person to death with an ax if he trespasses on its set.Deborah Raffin, who plays a public defender, plays gently in this action-packed movie that is filled with a lot of shoot-em-up violence.

I saw this movie on late night TV out of Buffalo about 30 years ago and I 'm dying to see it again. Anyone know where I can get a DVD of this movie? Hi, This was the 60s/70s series on NBC. I've not seen it. Maybe it's available on DVD. You may want to try Amazon.com . They have a lot of obscure old TV series' on DVD. You could check their site and see if they've got a copy available. Hope this helps. DONALD WOODS
DONALD WOODS, Apr 30, 2006
Hello there, Donald!!

We saw La Spettatrice last night @ the Chicago International Film Festival & we were both immensely moved by it. This is a haunting tale of loneliness & missed connection in which the longing for intimacy conflicts with our fear of revealing too much about ourselves to another. The three leads (Barbora Bobulova as Valeria, Brigitte Catillon as Flavia, Andrea Renzi as Massimo) are all excellent and the dynamic between them is very surprising. After all the movies which devalue older women, it's wonderful to see Flavia (who is a law professor at a university in Rome) presented as beautiful & sensual as well as seductive & powerful.

It amazes me that production companies will sue because of reproductions they will not supply . I 've been looking for one of these for awhile. Thanks! I have never seen it. Yep, I don't see why anyone would have the right to sue for reproducing something you can buy in a store, even if you're reproducing for profit. I don't know how that works, but it's bogus. I don't care how much a particular item goes for in stores. If I buy it at the store, it's mine.

Obviously the previous reviewers here are not fans of this genre , but I think this one is done quite well. Some of the tracks sound kind of the same, but I guess that's what this genre tends to be like. If you're a fan you'll enjoy it if you're a non fan you may not. If you want a good collection of tracks of the genre this is a good album to try. Hardly a review of this genre, more of a "look I'm a metalhead, so this genre must be shite, right?"

What a surprise. A basic copycat of the comedy classic 'The Nutty Professor' only naughtier. Funny guy Tim Thomerson (who steals the show as Blinkin in Robin Hood-Men In Tights) is downright hilarious as the anal retentive Dr. Jekyll and the sex crazed Hyde. The one scene that is really funny is when Dr. Lanyon (Mark Blankfield) catches Jekyll in bed with his daughter and says: "how dare you take advantage of my innocent daughter." Jekyll replies, "but sir, I'm going ahead with the operation. "Lanyon replies back, "oh.

This was the greatest movie I have ever seen in my life , the action was great , and i would be very disappointed if there was not a sequal. I think that the people who gave it a bad review were the ones who dident pay attention to it or just didnt get it. They were probaly the people that were crying or screaming during the movie. If there is a sequel I think it will be really good because we will get to see more of Jackie Chan in it!!!!!!!!!

I watch the show every day and it is very entertaining . It provides updates of tech news , video tutorials , reviews and how to's , and more . I wish you guys would get more popular. It's very helpful and entertaining. Thanks for all the info. I am a new subscriber and I've been watching it for about 6 months or so , but I just recently started commenting . Hope you keep up all the great shows you guys do. Thanks. I like this show and I like the hosts. Good luck to the hosts for the 1000 subscribers !!!!

where do we go from here? that is the overriding question of this film. And make no mistake, 'mainly ETC. ', the 2003 effort from director john jansen, asks far more questions than it answers, but none so poignantly or so powerfully as this one.much of the the film plays like a running conversation between you and your college drinking buddies, and I'm sure many of the questions raised by the main characters you'll recognize from your own evenings of drunken debauchery. however, one of the many beauties of this film is that we are rarely given an answer.

I do n't see what the problem is with SOME people and their NEED for intellectual humor . You need to grow a thicker skin if that is an area where you struggle with. You need to realize we all have differing senses of humors, and I don't understand why some of you feel like you need to attack and tear down others for having different opinions on what is funny. I was laughing my *** off at the OP's response and have nothing but respect for anyone who can post a response like that and not get butt-hurt because someone else doesn't agree with it .

If you get a chance to get a hold of this lost (for many years) gem, I doubt you will be disappointed. PS has an odd blend of social satire and ultra-cool blaxploitation-- even hints of slapstick, but it's so odd that it was not only ahead of it's time, nothing has been seen like it since.I strongly disagree with people who say that the film is dated, especially with Spike Lee's "Bamboozaled" (SP?) a few years back which was a misfire of trying to capture the same message. (Good filmmaking, disjointed script.

This is a funny movie . The Bob & Eddie Show feel of it could lead to a sequel but it didn’t seem like one was planned. This is a great family film. It has lots of action, humor, and a very good moral to it. It is very enjoyable and entertaining, as well as an adventure. This movie is great for the kids and has a good family feel to it. There are some great one-liners in the movie that will have you in stitches. This movie has great special effects. This was a great movie.

We saw La Spettatrice last night @ the Chicago International Film Festival & we were both immensely moved by it. Great, great, great film. There is one scene that you have to watch for. We both left the theatre stunned. It is a scene with two elderly women that will make you gasp with the depth of emotion on display. Brilliantly directed, shot, acted. I want this film to be seen by as many people possible. It has a limited run in Chicago and if you have the chance to see it - please go.

Duchess is a pretty white cat who lives with her three kittens in her wealthy owner 's mansion in Paris. Her owner is taking her to his holiday villa in the South of France for a relaxing break. He will be gone for two days, leaving Duchess and her kittens to enjoy themselves in the luxurious villa. Duchess wants to enjoy the holiday with her family. She just has to keep out of the claws of her owner's snooping neighbor, Mrs. Pepperpot. And then there is the problem of Duchess' kittens - her three little kittens are so cute that Mrs. Pepperpot is determined they are hers.

I really enjoyed this film, it definitely keeps you on the edge of your seat. It was very well directed. I think it was important that they showed the other couple's life as well as Terry and Bobbys and show them as people with emotions. As this film needed to show Bobby as a cold and vindictive person.I agree with another review it was sick love, not true love. He didn't need to go to great lengths as murder to give his wife a baby. He should have been honest with her and told her that he was sterile and decide to adopt a baby together.

I loved this film ! ! I have been waiting for this film to come out so I could see it ! ! The book was good, The movie was amazing . The actors did a great job, the story was good, and the special effects were awesome . It is a movie about a boy who turns 13 with a special power which can kill or heal someone with one touch. If you don’t know the story, read the book. Or watch the movie with your family. It’s amazing ! I give it 4 stars.

I 'm not sure why this film is averaging so low on IMDb when it 's absolutely everything you could want in a 21st century reboot of a classic movie monster. This is a fun, exciting, visually stunning, emotionally engaging story. The cast is great. I think Bill Hader is perfect as the villain and his performance is so strong that I think he will be one of the more memorable things about this movie. He brings some of the best laughs and I 'm already looking forward to the sequel to see what he does in it.

This interesting film noir features three very good performances: Sanders, Patrick, and Blackmer. The scenes between Sanders and Patrick are particularly outstanding. Demming, as the detective, is unfortunately not nearly as good. He lacks the intelligence, strength, and cynical world view of a Bogart. Had Humphrey played this part, we could have had a classic.Pace, location (a library), and atmosphere are all good. But there are a few plot holes. Sanders strongly fears Blackmer and the ruthless organization (Nazis) he represents. Yet after mistakenly killing Blackmer, Sanders seems to experience no anxiety or remorse.

Oh my word!! I have never seen a film so lacking in any kind of moral judgement or consideration for anything other than the death of the scum! Michael Winner here makes a valid observation of human desires in displaying a gung-ho troth world of deep and damaged execution. Not only does he spoon feed us with utter hell on earth seen through the face of the moustached Bronson, but he also shows us the spoon he's feeding us with and says "look at what your watching now look at your self and ask the question: Are you enjoying this?"

As with so many modern US films , there has to be a supernatural element to the plot , but this time it's aliens who have abducted a young couple and subjected them to horrible experiments. As if that wasn't bad enough, they also want to make them into sex slaves. But, in the meantime, their two best friends have come to spend the weekend at their house , so that the guys can find them. It's like one of those nightmare horror movies, where everybody you know turns against you , and you have to fend for yourselves.

I just thought I would add another observation , here . While there are a couple of visual sub-references , the overall feeling of this story is one of the "real" world with a slight hint to fantasy or mythical creatures. It's an odd mixture of the fantastic , but the characters still have to make sense in a "real" world. I think you have to think about it like "Blade Runner" , with it's "real" people , but a slight hint to the SF of the film . The film is very much a fairytale with a real world setting, ala Alice in Wonderland.

The Child 's Play series is n't a favourite of mine , but Bride Of Chucky is actually an okay movie. It 's a little cheesier than the rest of the movies, but it has a few really good scares and moments. The Child 's Play movies are not my type of movies. I find them to be a little to cheesey and i do not like Chucky. Chucky was a good villain in the beginning, but when you keep making movies with the same character it becomes to repetitive. I really like this one. I think its my favorite Childs Play Movie.

`` Nuovomondo '' was a great experience . Many filmmakers tell their stories to a big extent via dialogue . Here, we are told it via images . And yes, there is music , which helps it . But the music is only there , as if we were listening to a great symphonic piece with a big orchestra , with its different melodies . With some images, the music almost seems to be an extension of what you are seeing on the screen . So, if you are a lover of films with a good story and lots of images, then this is your movie .

I 'm not going to go into too much depth , but Showtime was a pretty funny movie . There are some parts that are a bit boring , but there is a whole lot of laughter throughout. It's one of the best movie I've ever seen. Showtime is not an average film , but it's an exaggeration. It has a little stealing moments , but it does not mean it's the whole movie . I'm going to describe it first once you check out this movie you'll know it's good and not just a piece of crap .

Just as in `` Columbo '' we see the fatality occur right at the beginning . What follows is an investigation of the events surrounding it . What was the reason why the murder occurred at the very start of the episode ? Was it to establish the scene and atmosphere in which it occurred . As well as for the obvious reason that the murderer could be anybody . If we look at this episode from a psychological viewpoint ( and we have to do this) we may ask why the murder was committed in such a strange way .

Too bad somebody did not have the smarts to release this movie to theaters. I had never heard of it when it appeared on cable. After the first shock of realizing this is not like any other movie you have seen since Bringing Up Baby you have to let it sweep you along and run with it. Not until it's over do you realize it covers issues that are not only subtle but significant. Alienation, denial, wish-fulfillment, for a start. Cathy Bates owns this movie, she's never been better.

The show start out with the boat . Desmond was i it . Then they went to try to save Jack . Kate was with Jack and she was not happy . Desmond and Sayid showed up. In the hospital they had to give Kate something to stop the birth. They needed a heart beat so they gave her chloroform so she would fall asleep. They said she was going to die. Desmond was trying to say that everything would be ok. The nurse told them she could feel Jack's heart beat. They all got really happy. I don't have much time.

I remember this film of old . It 's a great , chilling , atmospheric horror picture about a man who has to protect his daughter from the evil in their house . This film is a definite must own if you are a serious horror collector . If you haven't seen it you are missing out on the greatness this movie has to offer . A young couple moves into the apartment across from the beautiful young widow of a local man who had recently died. They become friends and the widow invites the couple to her house. But the house is not quite as innocent as it would seem.

I don't usually like this sort of movie but was working at home and wanted something to halfway watch while I did. I got so engrossed I gave up working to just sit and finish watching the last half hour uninterrupted. And I sure don't usually shed tears over this sort of show, but I was crying at the end. A lot of emotional nuance. Great acting, and good southern feel. John Corbett is one of the most talented actors out there, and the guy who played Luke was really good too. Highly recommend.

'Captain Corelli 's Mandolin ' is a fantastic film in itself . It is nothing like the book , which I did not like . This movie is a brilliant love story with great actors and music. It is a love story in World War II, but it is more than that. I don't want to get into too many details. This movie has everything you'd want in a movie : great scenery, incredible music , great acting , love story , war , comedy, etc. The only bad part is that it's too short , it's only 104 minutes long.

I wish there were more films about middle aged people. The intellectual journey and the twists and turns of life's moral highway make interesting viewing. There seems to be a different standard of judgement on women who have extra marital affairs than on men. Amy Watson's hurtful and humiliating behaviour towards her husband seems to pass without comment. Reverse the roles and one could expect a torrent of condemnation towards the man. If she found her husband boring and judgmental she could could have told him so, left and waited for a no doubt large financial settlement upon divorce.

This film was made right in the area where I grew up and now live . I know personally most of the people in the film . It's not a bad film . I just think that they were a little too kind in the way the film was edited . If you watch it to the end and the credits then you will be able to see some of the mistakes in it . The film was made by the National Film Board . Their job was to make films about every day life . They were able to do this as long as they got the money to make these films from somewhere .

Head should have been a proud moment not just for its stars (The Monkees and Victor Mature), or its director/co-writer (Bob Rafelson), but also its other co-writer (and brief cameo) Jack Nicholson. As it stands, most of them seem to shun it, and to outsiders the movie is regarded, at best, as a curio.While the T.V. series was famously based on the antics of the Beatles' 'Help! ', this film is also judged by the same accord. Yet far from the trite and painfully overrated Beatles films, and even the dated Monkees T.V.

When the new Outer Limits first started , the episodes were quite optimistic and challenging . As the series began to get more viewers a new darker theme was added . The stories were darker and much less hopeful , the series lasted another 3 seasons but never quite recovered from the change. This episode has a lot going on , from an astronaut returning from deep space to an alien visiting an early man on earth . While it starts with hope , it ends in tragedy . The story is an interesting one and takes us to a place where humans will never be .

Easily Lucio Fulci 's most respected film , `` Do n't Torture a Duckling '' is highly renowned for it's gruesome violence, bizarre imagery and surreal quality. In the town of Aquila, a young boy is discovered murdered in a shallow grave. He was apparently killed because his mother refused to give up her duck. When the body of another young boy is found, it becomes apparent that a serial killer is on the loose, but the town's corrupt mayor (Fulci) refuses to allow any real investigation to be conducted.

What a surprise this film was . I 've seen a good few of Fulci 's horror and zombie flicks over the years. This was my first time watching a movie he directed but didn 't actually make. The movie is about an anthropologist returning from South America with a rare plant to see his daughter who he hasn 't seen in some time. Upon his arrival he finds out his daughter is not living in her college dorms anymore and that she 's living in a shit hole with a bunch of roommates and a man named Paul.

As with so many modern US films, there has to be a supernatural element to the plot, but if you just let that go, this is a tale with heaps of charm and a kindly heart cased in a crab shell.We are presented with a scene of a town in an economically depressed area struggling to find anything to be happy about. Beau Bridges' character is really up against it with a family on the increase, a nil bank balance and a brother-in-law who's sold out to a big business chain which he secretly hates, but in which he is willing to rub Beau's nose.

Oh my word ! ! I have never seen a film so lacking in any kind of moral judgement or redemption . I did not want to watch the whole thing, but I felt I should because the story was about something important. I watched the film through tears of rage and grief. The film was made by 4 men in the US who are, to all appearances, nice, well meaning, ordinary guys, but the men who made the film were blind, ignorant or arrogant in their judgement of this subject matter.

`` Back in the Day '' is an interesting , but flawed effort . Ja Rule stars as Reggie Cooper , a young man in mid 1980s New York City . He and his buddy Dex ( Dante Brown ) are having a hard time holding down jobs , due to Reggie not wanting to be serious about things . They are also hustling in an effort to make ends meet . Reggie and Dex , along with a couple of friends , decide to get a better life by opening a limousine service , but it soon becomes apparent that they are running into trouble , both from the police and from crooks .

David Attenborough brings his fascination of wild life , this time the creatures under the sea , in this extraordinary documentary about the creatures that inhabit the seas around remote Pacific islands. This is a follow up to "Life on Earth" and "The Private Life of Plants " series . The show features a vast array of species and is filmed at the world’s foremost laboratory and filming location for this type of wild life documentary. The show covers the evolution of fish and other creatures from water into land animals, their adaptations over the ages , their life cycle, reproduction, hunting and feeding .

Valeria, an elegant and pretty young lady lives in a world surrounded by the walls of her shyness and depression. Although she may have a one-night lover or if someone lives with her, it makes no difference of being completely alone. Valeria is also a passionate woman who can take actions to approach that special man, Massimo, and at the same time the fear that allows her to answer his questions only with a "yes", "no" or "I don't know". The way to accent the loneliness of the character is magnificent.

I tend to get furious when hearing about Lucio Fulci 's reputation as a director . Too often he 's regarded as a master of gore , when really his forte was atmosphere . This is a film which is not so much about splatter or violence, but of the eerie, the unsettling , and the macabre , and the realization that humanity can be as horrible as anything you can think of. A group of young tourists come to New York for New Year 's celebrations, and soon enough are picked off by a mysterious killer , dressed in black .

"Showtime" is a funny film starring funnymen Robert DeNiro (Meet the Parents,A Bronx Tale) and Eddie Murphy (Shrek, Dr. Dolittle). The story is this: In the beginning of the movie detective Mitch (Robert DeNiro) and another detective go into a tv store trying to bust some criminals. When the cops arrive, Tray(Eddie Murphy)a cop, tries to arrest Mitch not knowing he's a cop. During this scene loads of funny things happen which catch the eye of tv producer Chase Ritz.

I did n't know what to expect when I rented this widescreen DVD . I knew it had a cult following and some interesting artwork but didn't know what to expect of the plot or how the film would turn out . This is not a typical slasher film with a masked killer or a psycho with a butcher knife or a machete, it has a very creepy atmosphere and an almost dreamy pace . There are two main characters but we never really get a feel for them until they begin to be killed off one by one and we begin to get an idea of who they were .

I usually give horror films around 6/10, but this one caught my eye. House of Wax was by far the best horror film I have seen... Even better than the Amityville Horror.Paris Hilton was quite good in this and I must say, has a good future ahead. Her death scene was probably the coolest. I'll just say how she dies...She gets a giant pole right between her eyes and they close-ups on and everything. Gory, eh? Brian Van Holt was very good as both the killers, Bo and Vincent (Vincent had the long hair).

What an incredible story and what a beautiful film! Hat's off to Ben Daniels, Lavinia Currier and the great Honore de Balzac. This captivating film conveys the passion experienced by the characters so effortlessly and yet so powerfully. I watched it mesmerized, almost holding my breath as the story developed towards its inexorable end. This film's execution was almost flawless: simple and pure, it plays with our hearts, guiding us in understanding the strange platonic, absolute thus possessive bond between two creatures not meant to be part of each other's world.

I saw this movie on PBS the first time . Then I bought the video and watched it countless times. My daughter is in her teens now and we just bought it again because it is so good. She loves it as much as I do! I think it is the best movie I've ever seen. Not only is the story great, the acting is excellent, the music is superb! It is the best of the best. I hope everyone else will take the time to see it. Everyone should own this movie.

Containing Billy's famous humor, this more modest comedy with heavy bittersweet overtones is a big departure, pleasantly unexpectedly so for Billy Crystal. This movie has different tear-jerker, dramatic, serious underlying themes (particularly with a scene with Steven Seagal). This movie was both entertaining and serious, a movie about lost love, about relationships with father-son, husband-wife, about friendship and values with a good dose of humor thrown in, especially at the beginning. The balance between drama and comedy isn't always maintained as with the new classical genre of this type, but the real message and motivation for this movie remains solid.

This searing drama based on a true incident concerns several ambitious African nationals who decide to temporarily leave their families behind and try for a better life in Belgium, where they may find work as servants. One of them, who works as a cleaner in a Belgian brothel, marries an unscrupulous Belgian who makes her work as a sex slave in order to pay back her family's debts. Soon the other Africans arrive to join her husband, and they all form a community which they protect as if it were a small African village.

Film auteur Stephan Woloszczuk explores the depths of love, passion, and brotherhood and the devastating results of loss in his latest film BLINDSPOT.BLINDSPOT'S diegetic world is exploding with suspense and takes the audience on a twisting  journey to the core of the human soul. As a director, he manages to draw the human spirit from the performances of his actors. With superb editing, especially in the flashback scenes and beautiful cinematography, BLINDSPOT is a thought provoking suspense from beginning to end. A thriller which leaves much to the minds' eye.What an  astounding accomplishment for Stephan Woloszczuk. Cheers Stephan!

Just exactly HOW director John Madden come to settle with Nicolas Cage and Penelope Cruz playing the roles of an American writer named Paul and an ex-girlfriend respectively. “It was a very easy pitch. We just sat down and talked about it.” says John Madden who is best known for directing such hits as Shakespeare In Love, Proof and The Debt. As to how much of an impact this movie has made on him, John has this to say: “A film like this can change your life and can also change your view on life in general.

Chucky ( the murderous doll from `` Child 's Play '' and 2 crappy sequels ) is dead . But he can come back to life , and that's just what happened here . This time Chucky is voiced by Brad Dourif . He plays Charles Lee Ray ( Chucky to his fans ) , the murderous 30 year-old man-child who returns to life as the devilish doll . Dourif has a distinct voice that fits well into the part . He also gives the voice to the voice box that Chucky is stuck inside , and Chucky has some interesting things to say .

I thought Besson 's film managed to do without words what few films have been able to do with them, in that it managed to create and sustain a strong sense of connection between the two central characters. This was done without the characters even having a single real conversation. This was achieved by the use of silence, which was filled in, not only by the background music and soundtrack, but by what was going on outside the main focus of the shot. In Besson 's film, there is an air of romance throughout the film without the characters ever having to say so.

I hope , from his seat on Heaven 's comedic throne , Spike Milligan can see and can enjoy this post. I am soooo grateful that his son, Ross, gave me permission in March of this year ( 2007 ) to post the video of Ross and his Dad's last conversation , together on stage . It will be with me always . A treasure to be cherished always. In May of 2006 , Ross and his Father , Spike , together in an intimate setting , at The Bickford Theatre, Drew University , New Jersey .

Years ago when I first read John Irving's The World According to Garp, I was astounded that most of the younger adults with whom I had contact didn't like the book when I loved it. I began to understand that it was an age and experience thing. I experienced somewhat of a déjà vu when reading some of the comments on this site that were clearly written by younger viewers. Fully enjoying Separate Lies is surely an age and experience thing.In this film the viewer sees a seemingly happy upper middle class couple - he a successful lawyer - she the perfect wife of a successful lawyer.

This is a good film , no doubt , but with some odd aspects . Without spoiling anything it takes place in a prison , with one of the guards being the protagonist . However there is nothing really about prisons or prisoners , except for the protagonist being in the prison . It has a really good character study in it , and this is what makes it stand out in a very crowded field of crime films . There is really nothing else to say , the acting is good , the story is good , and that’s about it .

Mark Blankfield (from the old late night TV show "Fridays")plays Dr. Daniel Jekyll, a mild-mannered surgeon who invents a powder that turns him into a drug-crazed party animal. This was not, of course, his intent, he had higher aspirations, but he goes with the flow. This is actually a fairly stupid movie, but it's also pretty fun. Of course, once the good doctor realizes what he's done, he's ashamed, but he's also not above doing it all again & running through Hollywood as a crazed sex machine with frizzed out hair & gold chains.

Then again , I like Rachael Ray . She is fun , sweet , fresh , and such a joy to watch on TV . I will admit that she is NOT a foodie or food connoiseur . What she IS is fun and funny , fresh , and a joy to watch on TV . I like Rachael Ray. She is fun, fresh and a joy to watch on TV. She also has the best cooking show I've ever watched. The reason is that she doesn't talk about food. She talks about life.

In the first transformation scene, what is the music? I've heard it was "The Greeks Don't Get No Freeks". Is that right? I really liked that sound. I also liked the "Hyde's Got Nothing to Hide" in the final scenes. Truly a doper movie, but with many laughs and puns, sight gags, and slapstick. Madam Woo-Woo's place was reminiscent of some places I have visited myself. Ivy Venus has appeared in some other stuff that is truly amazing. She looks much different in the movie we're talking about, but her maturity didn't hurt her a bit.

Damien O'Donnell has a good track record and in this film he handles a very delicate topic with sensitivity but without sentimentality. He also manages to be funny without being too farcical, so the movie is never too heavy going. The movie is well-written and has a few interesting twists, which keep the audience guessing right until the end. It does tend to be slightly too long and slow at times, though that's not a major complaint. This is also a beautifully-shot film. I'd definitely recommend it to anyone who likes thoughtful movies with a strong storyline and excellent acting.

The Aristocats is really quite charming , and is rated far too low on IMDb . The songs are n't that good , but its still an enjoyable Disney movie that kids and adults will enjoy equally . It's worth watching and it's definitely worth buying on DVD and/ or Blu Ray . It was very funny , and had a lot of good messages and morals to live by . There were lots of laughs in it , and it made me really happy to watch it . The characters are really cute , and there are some other great ones in the movie to .

Years ago I read the book ' A Máquina ' ( The machine ) . As I re-read this little book a couple of years ago , I came to realise how prophetic it had been . I was amazed. This book had been written back in 1971 and the story was set in a world where the government was in a state of permanent emergency due to a terrorist threat . A world where the citizens could be arrested without trial , where the police had the ' right to search and seize any person , premises or property' and where all letters and packages were read .

As far as I know I've seen most of Lucio Fulci's films, with the exception of some later ones that are popping up on DVD now, and I would have to say this was his best "pre-zombie" offering. In fact it beats out his later movies hands-down. This is a tale of superstition and suspicion in a small Italian town out in the middle of nowhere, where young boys are dying mysteriously. It's no mystery how they died, I guess, it's more who's doing it. Is it a woman that the townspeople have always considered a witch?

After seeing The Aristocats: Special Edition in a two pack with The Fox in the Hound, I decided to buy it since both of these films were childhood favourites.The Aristocats is a classic, definitely. It might not be a five-star classic, but it is a fun film and makes a good evening's entertainment. It is somewhat a light refreshment from the darker, more serious Disney classics. The Aristocats tries to be a light-hearted musical comedy, and I think it just about succeeds.The storyline doesn't really make much sense and I don't think the plot is particularly strong, but it is certainly not weak.

I was watching an NFL game and started surfing during a break and found this on one of the HBO type channels. I missed the beginning but when I started watching Deadly Voyage the clicker was put down and not even thought of until the credits rolled. You will find yourself rooting against the villans and on the edge of your La-Z-Boy throughout this one. If you get the chance take the time to watch it. Every once in a while I think about having the cable company take off my Movie channels but when you stumble across great ones like this you know why it is worth paying extra for them.

This is a wonderful movie , and I still love it ! It just so magical and it is funny too. This is a very funny and interesting movie. A very beautiful and touching film! I love the animation! Love this movie, the animation was very cute. The movie has so many hidden gems that people may miss during their first watch. Worth multiple watches just to discover more and more. This is such a great and funny movie! Really enjoyed the storyline! The animation in this movie is so beautiful, and I really enjoyed watching it.

Unconditional Love is one of the best movies I've seen in a while. It's an emotional roller-coaster. One of my favorite scenes is the pub scene. When Dirk tells Grace that he didn't want to go to the pub because the villagers don't like him, you expect the worst. When the old woman holds her glass up and says 'To the Memory of Victor Fox and the whole pub follows suit, I wanted to cry. The funeral scene is hysterical! Julie does it in her typical Julie Andrews style. Johnathan Pryce is excellent as Victor.

After learning that her sister Susan is contemplating divorce, Kate decides to travel to the distraught woman's remote country home and spend some time with her. When Kate arrives, however, Susan is nowhere in sight. That's because someone has murdered her and stuffed the body in a trunk in the basement. As a storm rages outside, Kate tries to figure out where her sister could have gone and places her own life in great danger...the killer is still on the premises! In her first post-BEWITCHED vehicle, Elizabeth Montgomery gives a solid dramatic performance.

Gary Busey did a splendid job playing the rock-n-roll legend Buddy Holly ( 1936-59 ) . He does have a slight southern accent ( his home is in Nashville ) that he does not use as often as others. He does a very good Buddy. He does not go all out as he does in other roles, such as when he plays a psychotic killer on the CSI Las Vegas show. But the guy does a creditable job in the movie. Gary Busey in Buddy Holly Story - 1985
Buddy Holly ( 1936 - 1959) was a rock n' roll and country singer.

( Synopsis ) Graduating high school senior Bartleby `` B '' Gaines ( Justin Long ) finds himself without a girlfriend, friend or prospect of either. In a last desperate attempt to turn his life around and impress the one girl he still cares about (Amanda Seyfried), he decides to make the biggest and bravest speech of his life. But just when he is about to give it, a group of misfit kids from his high school shows up at his house with their own agenda: to make a film on him and use it as an opportunity to relive their teen years.

What a great film! I never knew much about Buddy Holly, but was familiar with his lively and fun music. This is a wonderful biography of someone who helped change the music in the 1950's. Although I never cared for Gary Bussey, he was fabulous as Buddy Holly! I don't know how accurate the movie is, but assume at least for the most part it is accurate, which makes the movie all the more interesting. The music throughout the movie just adds the pizazz to this biography. I don't think I would change a thing in this film, it was all good!

1969 was the year . New York City was the place . Putney Swoope was the second Robert Downey film to hit the big screen . Cream Cheese was a thing . And a man named Harvey Gould was the first to ever make it rain on Broadway . Harvey Gould is the name of a man known for making the first ever bubble machine. Harvey was born in the year 1909 in England. He loved making things, and one of the first things he wanted to make when he was a kid was a bubble machine .

This is one of those films where it is easy to see how some people would n't like it . I am not one of those people . It is well made , well directed and a very intelligent film . I liked the way the characters interact with each other , the music , and the fact that the viewer is allowed to use their own imagination in some of the storylines . There is a certain elegance about this movie , and I found it very refreshing to see it was not so full of violence and sexual content . Loved it!

I have to admit I had never heard of this movie . I caught it last night on TMC . I know , I should have been more educated on my movie viewing . It was pretty damned good . I always love movies that are shot on film , and this one is no different . It’s a well made film , with excellent performances . It is the story of a 17 year old boy named Billy . He is the son of a Vietnam veteran who died in Vietnam , and he has no fatherly guidance in his life . His mother is a drunk , and a prostitute .

Oh my gosh!! I love this movie sooooooooooooooooooooo much!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! It is so incredible......I loved it as a wee babe and still love it as an adult. It is my favorite Disney movie of allllllllllllllllllllllllllllll time! You should watch it, watch it and love it. My friends and I watch it a ton.....It is soooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo good. I recommend it to anyone who is a child or a child at heart.

This movie is an awesome remake of the original by the same title . The movie was cool , despite some of the flaws , it has enough to keep you enthralled till the very end . Verdict - A MUST watch . I think it is not fair to compare this with the original. They are totally different beasts and one is just a good movie while the other is a cult classic with a cult following. But that said, its a decent movie with some cool effects and interesting story. The kids who play the children were really cute and the lead guy was very impressive too.
