I still ca n't describe what to feel when I received this by the fnac site . Such a rare item and so well packaged, and then you receive such a good product. It's a must have. Thank you. After years of using other brush cleaners, I decided to try out a new one that would actually do a good job at it. And this seems to be the right choice, since I have never had problems with the cleaning. I really appreciate the bristles being detached, so you do not have to be careful when storing it in your purse or handbag.

I absolutely love this film and have seen it many times. I taped it in about 1987 when it was shown on Channel Four but my tape is severely worn now and I would love a new copy of it.I have e-mailed Film Four to ask them to show it again as it has never been available on video and as far as I know hasn't been repeated since the 80's. I have had no reply and it still hasn't been repeated. The performances are superb. The film has everything. Its funny,sad,disturbing,exciting and totally takes you back to school days.

For those out there that like to think of themselves as reasonably intelligent human beings, who love film, have good attention to detail and enjoy indie movies with funny, smartly written dialogue then this is a film for you.For those with a poor attention span, high expectations and no brains.. well.. um.. you may get bored and find things dragging at times.This is a charming, modest and well paced movie with the actors bestowing a real sense of depth and warmth to their roles. I chuckled to myself pretty much the whole way through..This film is a little gem.

My friends and went through a period of time when we would rent movies that none of us had ever heard of. The only good that came from it was this movie, "Take it to Limit" Right as the movie started, we could tell we were in for a true classic. The music is probably done by rural white boys from Colorado, but it sounds just like early 90's rap. The star of the show, actor Leo Fitzpatrick, plays the bad-boy so well, especially sporting a big zit the entire movie.

Head should have been a proud moment not just for its stars ( The Monkees and Victor Mature ) , its crew ( The Monkees and James Cagney’s older brother William) , and even its writers ( The Monkees and William Rose ) , but also for the songwriter. It was released in 1969 when the music scene was just starting to change, just starting to branch out into things like “psychedelic,” “folk rock,” and so on. Head was a comedy film, but not a slapstick comedy film; it was a black comedy with a dark theme.

Another enjoyable Warner flick . I really liked John Garfield in this , though I 'm wondering why Cagney was nominated for best actor , his role was very small . It's also hard to imagine how this was rated 18 in 1959 , there's no nudity , bare breasts are shown but the characters are so young that its not meant to be suggestive , and the violence is very underplayed . Great flick , I'd say if you're going to watch a movie about juvenile delinquents , you might as well watch a good film . I really like The Blackboard Jungle.

OK, so I loved Rachael Ray before, but now, I ADORE her! How innovative. I love that she has a cooking section- I admit that occasionally I skip that part, only because it makes me WAAAY too hungry! But I also love that you can get the next day's grocery list on her website. I love that she has regular helpers and that she's made some of her viewers become her regulars. I love how personable she is and how creative she is. I also like how she does her Mystery Guests.

Accepted is a 2006 teen flick that stars the guy from the mac and PC ads. The movie is about Bartelby .B. Gaines a guy who has rejected from all the colleges he has applied for so decides to make his own college and invites all the other people who did not make it, problem is hundreds of people sign up to his school. The movie is hilarious and I was lucky enough to buy it for $5.00 at a sale and I have always watched it since. Overall this movie is a must watch for fans of all comedy as it is funny, witty and just a good movie all up.

The writers of lost have outdone themselves . Season two 's finale is even more heartbreaking and intense than the pilot episode , the writers really know what they're doing and i hope season three is just as good as 1& 2 . I cant stop watching the show it's just sooooo good !!!!!!!!! 3.0 out of 5 starsNot as bad as other people said it is! Well this is my first review so be gentle! :D Anyway, the storyline is really interesting. I would like to know what happens next, however I did think the ending was very rushed.

`` Pearl Harbor , buddy . '' This movie is brilliant ! Sure it does n't exactly flow like an action movie and is more than an hour longer than it really should be but who cares ! I don't. The cast, script, direction and music all gel together to create a truly epic movie. Everyone is outstanding in it and it's one of my absolute all time favorite movies . If I were to pick just one movie, it'd be Pearl Harbor, and if I were to pick a director, Spielberg wouldn't even be in the running.

I did not know what to expect when I decided to watch this documentary. I knew it was about an ex-Viet Nam POW in Laos who escaped, but I didn't know much else. In reality, I wasn't expecting too much. Oh what a surprise! The story of this man's life is very interesting in itself, but what sets this film apart from other biography-type docs is that Dieter himself tells most of the story himself. Dieter is very comfortable in front of the camera. His personality really shines. He tells his story about his life growing up in Germany during WWII and the hardships.

I ca n't get this flick off my brain . It 's definitely totally different than anything that 's out. I have been searching it for 2 weeks and that I can not learn where to buy it. Is it possible for someone to assist me please. I'd greatly appreciate you. I have had the opportunity over the past year to see many of his films. He really is a genius! If you like foreign films, you'll love it. If you don't like foreign films, you will also love it.

I will admit, I had the opportunity in the past to watch this film, and after about 5 - 10 minutes into it, I felt like many did. I was expecting a Monkey movie that was similar to the television show, but instead I was given... well, I didn't know what I was given to be honest.However, after finally watching this film, I realized that not only had I had a closed mind to the brilliance it depicts, I also found myself watching it over and over again.

Lost has been one of the most mesmerizing and thrilling experience I 've ever seen . Not only it 's a very well written series, directed with great talent , it is also the most imaginative and surprising show of all times. The story is amazing and the actors amazing too . This is a series in which the characters and the actor who play them are extremely realistic and beliveble in every detail. It 's really sad to see the end and I really hate it . It 's the first time that i really really hate an end in a serie , it 's my favorite of all the series i ever watched .

This movie possesses something most other movies of its genre do not: intelligence and good messages. Accepted, is the story of a kid named Bartleby (Justin Long) who gets rejected by every college he applies to. His parents are incredibly strict, frustrated and disappointed. So, Bartleby and a few other students who face similar problems start a fake college, to pawn themselves off to their parents as college kids. Not everything goes to plan, and the movie is about them winging it. But behind this plot which sounds ridiculous, there are good messages, morals and a new outlook on the American educational system.

He did one at Christmas to try and bring back a number one song , and now the terrific Justin Bieber is attempting to repeat the trick, this time for Easter with the release of his new single “Easter”! It is the first of two Easter themed releases from Justin. The other is “That’s What Love Can Do”, due for release next Friday. This track, “Easter” was recorded in LA and was co-produced by Justin along with the renowned Skrillex. It features guest vocals from Halsey, plus the track’s production was mixed by Grammy Award winner Diplo.

Jenny Lewis plays an awkward girl called Jade. She smokes and drinks. She doesn't have a lot of friends and she has a nagging mother(Beverly D'Angelo). Jade finds herself growing closer to her mom's boyfriend Billy(Rob Estes), maybe she is attracted to him. Of course, I don't need to tell you what happens after that. This is probably my favorite TV movie. This movie shows that sometimes everyone is to blame. This movie also has the best acting that I have seen in TV movies.

What a shame this movie was never released. (It is now playing on cable.) I tuned in based on my high regard for the stars and was rewarded by seeing a movie far better than the ones I've been paying to see in theatres recently. I like to be surprised. So often movies are marketed as "offbeat," but are in fact more of the same old recycled drivel. This movie is genuinely different, with the bonus of a heartwarming message. Jonathan Pryce sings like an angel.

This movie is a love story set in the backdrop of war. Everything about the movie was perfect. I just saw the movie yesterday and I want to get my own DVD asap and watch it many times over. The story ends as it started I was very happy that he came back and I was proud of her for becoming a doctor and fulfilling her father's dream. She honored her father, boyfriend-husband, and her lover. The character had many shades. Christian Bale is also an phenomenal actor. Some stories do have happy endings.

Pity the Monkees. People always accused them of being manufactured (which they were) or being nothing more than a American knock-off of the Beatles (Again, which they were) but to the kids of the time they were real, they were important, they were legitimate. Discussions about who were better The Monkees or The Beatles were common on school yards but the critics, well they never quite bought into it. Despite recording some very catchy, classic pop tunes, the Monkess did not receive much respect for their albums.

I think that this short TV series , was absolutely wonderful , and gave both a in-depth and clear explanation of what is going on around us in the World. I was amazed at how it explained so many aspects about the world around us, and it helped me put in perspective a few things that I had no clue about . The only drawback , was not being able to explain more in-depth , about what I believe is the root cause of the world's issues. This is really a fantastic series, and one that should be required viewing for every member of the United Nations!

Despite all the hoopla about THE TROUBLE WITH TRIBBLES episode, THE BALANCE OF TERROR might just be the best episode of the series. And, while I have always loved A PIECE OF THE ACTION because it is so much fun, I really do have to cast my vote as this Romulan episode as being the very best.The movie, interestingly enough, is really like a WWII submarine movie in that it bounces back and forth between the cloaked Romulan ship and the Enterprise as it seeks to destroy the Romulans before they sneak back across the Neutral Zone after a raid on Federation outposts.

At first I did n't think I would like this movie , but as it progressed it became better and better. This is an amazing movie about two young girls that are the best of friends, but one of them has a secret that will destroy everything they have worked for . It was a nice movie and I thought the two main characters were good actresses , but I did think that in the end the movie was too abrupt , it could have been better , but other than that I enjoyed the movie . I recommend it to anyone who likes good movies and a good story line.

TV churns out dozens of true-crime movies every year . You can see 3 or 4 every Saturday on Lifetime. And yet somehow, every week I find a movie that is a true crime story that I have not seen. That happened to me this weekend with Eyeball Kids, a 2018 horror movie about a serial killer who targets teenagers and removes one of their eyes. I can’t even remember where I first heard about it, but it was just enough to pique my curiosity and I wanted to find out if it was any good.

Gary Busey 's best performance in a nicely-flowing biography . Since had a musical background , he was able to make this film more effective . It is a tribute to a life of a real person , not an actor , and he has done his best . I really liked it , it was the first film where I could see his emotions , I never really saw him in other films , he was an actor , but in this movie I felt that he really is a person . The music and his voice made him a real person . I am very glad that it was a success .

This is one of the best of the early "Star Trek" episodes, with Kirk and his crew venturing into the unknown to do battle with an enemy known only by name. Imagine their surprise when they find out that the dreaded Romulans are racial offshoots of the Vulcans! Young Mr. Stiles, well-played by Paul Comi, is one of the few truly unlikable characters in the "Star Trek" universe. His barely disguised hatred of Mr. Spock is eerily similar to the post-9/11 hatred and suspicion many Americans have of people of Arab or Middle Eastern origin.

TV churns out dozens of true-crime movies every year. You can see 3 or 4 every Saturday on Lifetime, and Court TV can be relied on for a few every weekend. So I started watching The Morrison Murders thinking I knew very well what to expect: a more or less competent retelling of a real-life family murder. What I got was a subtle, beautifully acted drama that engrossed me from start to finish.Both the brothers were totally convincing, and Jonathan Scarfe was perfect in the challenging role of Luke. The look and feel of Georgia was in almost every frame.

Anyone who has seen Ali G before, should be well prepared for the full motion picture that is 'Ali G Indahouse' Although I prefer Ali G when he is interviewing the rich and famous, his brand of completely off the wall comedy definitely entertains from start to finish on the big screen too.Ridiculous plot, ridiculous characters and a ridiculous script, that all make this film a riot for fans of Ali G.If you've seen him and didn't like him then avoid this film like the plague, because it's definitely just more of the same; for everybody else - watch it Aiiii!

If we could have "Separate Tables," why not "Separate Lies. "This becomes somewhat involved. A housekeeper's husband is killed when he is hit by a car while on a bicycle. The culprit turns out to be the woman she cleans for. The latter was having an affair with a friend and was driving the car with the lover in it when the accident occurred. To complicate matters further, the housekeeper once worked for the guy's parents and he had her jailed for stealing. Therefore, people will hesitate to believe that it was his car that caused the accident.

What a surprise . A basic copycat of the comedy classic 'The Nutty Professor ' only naughtier . Funny guy Eddie Murphy seems to be out of ideas lately . The movie is just an excuse to use his gross out humor and bad taste jokes . Murphy plays three different characters all of whom have his looks but different voices . It's kind of cute to see him switch from the snooty doctor to the red neck biker guy but the story goes on too long and it gets old . The movie doesn't make any sense . Eddie murphy is a very talented comedian .

This film, like much of their music, is either underrated or unnoticed by the casual observer. It is terrific and, in many ways, ahead of its time.The images are funny, disturbing, and at the very least, engaging. The music is amazing. This is not the "candy pop" sound they are unfortunately associated with. This is the sound of a band in exploration and revolt.HEAD, alone, should put The Monkees into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame. Can anyone tell me why these guys are not in there?

Captain Corelli 's Mandolin is one of Nicolas Cage 's better films . He turns a fine performance as the title character, who is a military man trying to find his place in occupied Greece during WW II. His relationship with a woman who has been left behind provides much of the emotional core of the film. It is a war story, and that is not my preference, but it is well done. There is also a lot of beautiful scenery and period costume and decoration, and that I liked. It is based on the bestseller by Louis de Berniere, a British author, and that helps as well.

Motorama viewers should already by keen on other offbeat b-grade desert-based films such as Bagdad Cafe or Repo Man (which more or less takes place in the desert). It also models some of the bizarre humor (and especially eccentric trail of characters) of writer Joseph Minion's comedy, 'After Hours.' In a sort of desert roadtrip fantasy, a metaphor of temptation and redemption, Gus (played well by Jordan Christopher Michael), a clever 10 year-old boy cashes in his piggy bank, steals a Mustang, and runs away from his grossly neglecting parents.

Another go round with the monkey king going west .... sort of.Beginning in the middle of some action the movie fast forwards to sometime later with the Monkey King and Pigsy meeting two sisters that the king is going to test on. The sisters pass with flying colors with the Monkey King taking an interest in the older sister. He also takes a liking to a beautiful painting of her in his room. This causes some trouble for Pigsy since she has a thing for him as well and she becomes jealous. The King then decides to test the younger sister who he is less interested in but the king is interested in.

I know this movie is n't for everyone , and I wo n't push my opinions on you , but I have to admit I did like it. I was surprised with some scenes , I have to admit I cried and laughed , I enjoyed the humor , the action , and the twists. So if you like horror and comedy movies, you might want to check out this flick on a free movie night with your friends or on a movie night with you and your spouse or loved one, I give it 4 / 5 stars for sure.

Death Wish 3 is exactly what a bad movie should be. Terrible acting! Implausible scenerios! Ridiculous death scenes! Creepy, evil-for-no-reason villains! The last 30 minutes of this movie just might be the best 30 minutes ever put on film, especially in the scene where the decent, hardworking citizens string chains across the street, knocking down the evil bikers and then shoot them, only to be joined by the neighborhood children (!!!) in celebration. And how can I forget the elderly woman with the broom? She's sweeping out the scum!

Just exactly HOW director John Madden come to settle with Nicolas Cage and Penelope Cruz playing the roles of an Italian Officer and a Greek Villager in an honourable story: "Captain Correli´s Mandolin", just escapes me! Witness: a wobbly, inconsistent accent by Cage amid horrendous over-acting, with Cruz -- more adequately cast as a spoiled Latino opposite Johnny Depp in "Blow" -- in basically a repeat performance under the guise of a Greek nurse... ay, it was painful. But there were saving graces.The story itself is thrilling-to-tragic, and Cage does have some (-- redeeming, this is !--) musical ability.

A labor of love . Each frame is picture perfect and grabs you . Then the sheer emotion and story-telling. Thank you!! I'm not an artist, just a fan. Thank you. Beautiful and moving. I'd love to see them in a film. This is absolutely stunning! You should be so proud! Beautiful and poignant. I love the pensive, reflective look in his eyes in many of these. Thank you for capturing these precious memories for us. Such precious memories! Love them all.

The movie is excellent . Acting , cinematography , direction and music are spellbinding . It seems to me that most of the songs were composed on the spot. I don't know the director , but he's a genius and deserves all the applause that he is getting for this movie. I can understand why he has taken so long in making this movie . One can't possibly do justice to such an excellent script unless he is an absolute professional and a true genius. What is the song in this movie where an unnamed female singer wearing a green dress is performing infront of a big gathering of men?

I 've been watching Attack Of The Show religiously for about 6 months ( maybe longer but not much ) so I am pretty sad that it's almost over. I think that my favorite parts of the show are the celebrity interviews, I love how they are all so different and it's nice to see them being themselves and how they do their hair and makeup, and I also love the celeb videos and the bloopers
So if you've watched the show at all, do you know why it is almost done ?

If you expect that this movie is full of action and grabbing you from the start then do n't watch this. This is a simple story. This is the story about a guy who was born and grew up in slums who is not happy with his present job and want to get out of this. Then he meets a rich guy who offers a job for him. He takes this offer and gets married to his daughter and becomes a rich man. The whole movie is a journey of this guy who is happy with his new wealth and position and how he changes with time.

What an incredible story and what a beautiful film ! Hat 's off to Ben Daniels , Lavinia Currier and the whole team for making this happen. A must see for the whole family. Loved it. Very enjoyable, interesting story with some very good lessons. I think I might try to watch it again. This film is the story of the 50 year friendship between two great American painters and sculptors, Georgia O'keefe and Alexander Calder and how they helped each other through times of great personal difficulty. This film is based on letters, interviews, personal memories and art of the artists.

A surprisingly great cartoon in the same league as Batman:TAS and its ilk, I enjoyed it in my youth and recently had been able to watch them all again, great voice acting from Tim Curry, Richard Moll, Tony Jay, and Maurice LaMarche in various roles. The only qualm I had was Rob Paulsons voice seemed a little too old for the title character, but that wasn't a big deal as the stories were great, and the fact that the whole thing has a great time loop twist ending.

But a great cast! Jonathan Pryce, Kathy Bates, Rupert Everett, Lynne Redgrave, Julie Andrews and Dan Aykroyd! And that's just the beginning.I'm not totally sure that any description of the movie and plot are going to entice you to watch this one. Suffice it to say that it has something for practically everyone: death, singing, a sparkly suit, cell phones, a little person (nice looking woman, actually), a drawbridge (modern, not Medieval), a boombox, and a crossbow. Oh, and a psychotic.

I absolutely love this film and have seen it many times . I taped it in about 1987 when it was first broadcast on TCM. You can view my film notes from 1992 on my page for this film but I shall give a brief run down as it is a very enjoyable one and worth seeking out the film if you can find a copy. This film has some wonderful music and the songs used are not only good but are very fitting to the plot. This film has some superb sets which really help to place the film in the time and place that it is set.

A Formula For Murder is n't a well known Giallo , but that is n't to say it 's not a great movie. It takes place in London , where a group of people are being murdered with a sledge hammer, and then they are later strangled by a man with gloves. It has a great cast , and the movie is pretty entertaining, especially towards the end, where a great final twist unfolds on the viewer. I highly recommend this movie to any fans of the Gialli, and also to anyone that is just a fan of suspense movies.

As the mom of a 3 year old and a 2 year old, I adore AristoCats. It is a movie that contains no double-entendres, no almost-swear words like heck or darn, no parents who are functional idiots, and no crotch-smashing or flatulence jokes that are so prevalent in even the "best" kids movies these days. The story line is sweet and interesting. The music is great. The love story is quite romantic. The kittens are adorable, and the various other characters are unique and attention-capturing. The action is simple and not overwhelming or confusing.

I recently saw Blind Spot in Coyoacan , where it drew a huge crowd and some pretty intense discussion . It is an Argentine film directed by Lucía Puenzo, and based on a book by Argentine writer Eduardo Sacheri . The screenplay was written by Lucía Puenzo , Sergio Dubcovsky and Alejandro Pinto . It is a psychological thriller that tells a story of love, power, and greed in Argentina’s upper classes during the late 1970s and 1980s , following a blind girl whose dreams of travel and a “ normal” life are thwarted when she discovers the dark secret of her wealthy family.

This movie, based on a true story of Gerrit Wolfaardt, is one of the best films I've seen on race relations in South Africa; a very good history lesson of the turmoil of 80's South Africa. I put it in on the scale of American History X as far as it's depiction of how a young man can get seduced by the Aryan doctrine and how the "certain" segments of the Christian church taught a false doctrine regarding race to justify an injustice.It's strong message of forgiveness and redemption, is one of rarity in films today.

Ali G earned his fame on the small screen - though the big screen has not lost him any kudos. In an interview on the BBC's Newsbeat programme he has stated: "I've done about eight movies, some of the big ones like Big Daddy. I'd like to continue with the movies. I don't want it to stop, I like acting a lot, the movies have done a lot for me. I think we can work on it for about another two years, that's about right. That's my estimation of my career, that'll be the limit.

Little Dieter Needs To Fly is another in the remarkable body of Werner Herzog 's filmic work that is without comparison. Herzog has said that "It's one of his favorite films. He believes it was his finest work as a director". The film is based upon a true story, but the filmmaker's imagination has been allowed to roam free in creating his own version of the events. It begins by taking us inside the mind and soul of a Vietnamese man who has come to the belief that the only way to get out of his predicament is to become a famous actor.

The young John Garfield turned in a fine performance in the 1939 `` They Made Me a Criminal . '' This was Garfield's third film. He was cast as a young hoodlum who becomes a policeman to make good with his girl ( Eleanor Parker ). He falls in with the mob, is framed for the murder of a crooked cop, and goes to the electric chair. Garfield did all his own fight scenes, and the climactic death scene, where he plunges into a vat of molten metal, is a thriller in itself.

Great show ! About time a reality TV show comes along that closes generation gaps . Contestants range in ages from late 20’s to early 70’s. Most have worked for many years and have raised families, but never really knew each other. Some have been married. Some have had children. Many still working. Some of the women have never left the work force and are now coming out to play at their age. Some have worked their whole lives. The guys are not as different, as most of them have either worked or raised families.

I can't say how many times that one line has made me laugh or how often I've described that scene to folks not familiar with this film. I saw it the year it was released, I was 19. I don't think there were a dozen people in that East Village theater that night. For years I thought we were the only ones who saw it. Nice to see here that others found it as hysterical as I had, and see it's lasting value despite the time gone by. Rent it, buy it or steal it.... a must see.

When I was 10 (currently 14), I vowed to never see a movie that I knew would not have a happy ending. And until a few weeks ago I had done pretty well, except for Shakespere for English class...etc...I was still only watching things that ended happy. But then I saw Ramola Garai in Havanah Nights, which was cute, not good but entertaining enough to watch. After seeing this a few times over the two or so years since I first saw it, I grew to like it, especially the music.

Chucky 's back ... and it 's about time ! This time , with the help of Jennifer Tilly and John Ritter , we discover the secret behind the psychopathic doll. Indeed, the story is quite complex but it is never too complicated and it goes very well. A very good movie , a good movie for fans but a good movie at all . It 's a shame that the sequel was not really good . But it is very sad to learn that this was the last movie John Ritter , which was very good. Chucky is back for a fifth time ... but the story is about his wife.

I saw this film at a small screening. Even though it had a low budget, the creative direction and intelligence of the cast helped make this a small gem of a movie. It's April 8, 1994, each of the characters are in their "mid 20's" and pursuing some kind of artistic ambition (acting, music, film, writing) when they learn of Nirvana singer Kurt Cobain's suicide. They quickly get inspiration to travel from San Francisco to Seattle and attend the Cobain vigil. It's here where the film really picks up and serves up a series of funny and emotional scenes.

The "all I have is 5 dollars and my wedding ring..." scene was a riot. I also guffawed at the scene in the bar where Hyde snorted the horse radish and flipped the bird to the Japanese guy and said "Pearl Harbor buddy". I think my IQ is higher than 115, but I'm not sure because I can't count that high.Funny thing, this 10 line requirement. Seems as though they would bash you for making your comments too long, not too short. I hope I don't make it to 1,000 words before I get to line 10.I'm still two lines short.

I think I was recommended this film by the lady in the shop I was hiring it from! For once she was bang on! What a superb film! First of all I was convinced James McAvoy & Romola Garai were Irish so convincing were their accents; and by half way through the film I was utterly convinced Steven Robertson was a disabled actor and pretty sure James McAvoy was also! When I watched the special features on the DVD and saw both actors in their 'normal' guise, to say I was blown away would be an understatement!!!

If you get a chance to get a hold of this lost ( for many years ) gem , I highly recommend it. I've read it a few times in the past few decades and every time it just keeps getting better!! FYI, It has just come out in a new edition with a great introduction by Tom Stoppard . It's the first time it has been out since 1936 . I can't wait for it to hit Amazon and the rest of the internet so I can get a copy and read it again.

You know, people who make comedies so often forget it's really ok to be outrageous. Well, not this time. Unconditional Love has it all. Barry Manilow and a dwarf in a movie with Cathy Bates as the romantic lead...and it works. Not only does it work, it works very very well. In fact, I think it's perfect. I laughed so hard I think I hurt myself yet the main characters were all so human, so honest, and so very real. But isn't that where great comedies come from?

Enhanced by the expressive cinematography of Agnes Godard (Beau Travail), Golden Door is a visually striking tone poem that follows the journey of a peasant family from their primitive home in Sicily to Ellis Island in New York at the turn of the century. It is a surreal, enigmatic, often strange, but ultimately deeply rewarding experience. Interweaving dreamlike and symbolic imagery with gritty realism, the latest film by Emanuele Crialese (Respiro) is like an impressionistic painting - a cinematic artist's rendering of what the immigration process may have been like for our parents and grandparents.

Captain Corelli 's Mandolin is no Oscar contender but it was pretty good . I have to admit Ms Cruz is very pretty and I liked the Italian backdrop. The book is about much more than beauty though . It is a moving account of war and of love. In 1939 the island of Cephallonia in the Ionian Sea is conquered by Italy and the Italian occupation forces set up base in the old fort. They soon discover that the local doctor, the island's only doctor in fact , is incompetent. They decide to import an Italian doctor and send for Dr Pelagia.

Ah the Outer Limits. I love that show. It was surpremely creepy, or down-right mysterious. I loved all the genres of the show, from horror, to thriller to mystery, whatever the genre, it was good. I guess I must have started watching way after it got canceled, when Sci-fi showed it as re-runs, or played marathons of it. It was a really good show, I don't know all about the seasons and everything but I do remember that every time I saw the screen freak out and the voice on the TV say: "There is nothing wrong with your television.

I 've seen the 1973 movie Lost Horizons and read many of the reviews for this movie . I agree with most of what has been written about this film. I think this movie is overrated and that the story is not as complex as many film reviewers have suggested it is. Although I enjoyed the movie, it did not stand up to the expectations that I had. I thought that it would be a bit more complex. The movie begins with a group of Americans on a plane. One of the people on the plane is named Betty.

I never thought I 'd say this about a biopic , but there is a near over-abundance of characterization (and that's putting it very mildly). We know it was a sad life, but I'm sure we knew that. I would have liked to have known more specifics. The most interesting story was about the last few years of her life when she was in a coma in a London hospital, but, alas, it was not elaborated upon at all. Also, I thought the actors did not resemble the subjects enough.

I thought I might be disappointed viewing this film again after so many years. On the contrary, I was more impressed now than in my callow youth with its honesty and brave humour. In 1969, the transition among African-American groups from a predominant policy of conciliation and integration to one of confrontation and self-determination was still quite new, and more than a little controversial. It took courage and finesse to portray both the Establishment and the Anti-establishment as the caricatures they often closely approximated in real life. Special mention should be made of Arnold Johnson's performance: he successfully avoided having his character lapse into either sociopathy or buffoonery.

In Tweety 's S.O.S , Sylvester goes from picking garbage cans to being a stowaway on a cruise ship that's going to Japan, where he meets a Japanese feline. After Sylvester steals some sushi and gets into a fight with a Japanese cat, the ship lands on an island in the South Pacific with Sylvester now stuck there. Tweety comes along in a helicopter and gets Sylvester back to the States, where Tweety and Sylvester get in another fight with the Japanese feline and are sent back to Japan. Tweety S.o.s Episode 1. Tweety's S.o.s is a series that aired in 2002 and is set in the 18th century.

Being a middle aged mom myself , I very much appreciated seeing a romance between grown-up people that weaves in the tough issues of adoption and infertility. It's a book I've had on my bookshelf a long time and I was so glad I finally decided to read it! It made me think of all of the friends I've lost touch with over the last 20 years and how hard it is to see what their lives must be like as adults. I cried more than once as the book wound to a conclusion that felt very real.

Obviously the previous reviewers here are not fans of this genre, but I think this one is done quite well.It's twistedly cute clever & dark. This story brought back memories of the types of girls I was in love with as a child.Also, it makes me want to check out some of Nadia's other movies, many youtube comments about how hot she is in this video. Sure there is some Burton influence here, but I wouldn't say this Brad is trying to rip him off.He is just jumping in & adding his talents to a genre that I can appreciate.

Film auteur Stephan Woloszczuk explores the depths of love , passion , and brotherhood and the devastating results of loss through the story of a man and his beloved dog. This is the powerful, emotional, and visually breathtaking story of a man named John and his relationship with the dogs he's known throughout his lifetime. John has owned, trained, and cared for a number of dogs, and through those relationships he has witnessed love, loyalty, pain, and devastation. In the early 1960s John meets and befriends a puppy that will become his lifelong companion.

What an excellent movie, made even more so by the fact that my wife and I stumbled onto it so serendipitously, channel surfing on a nice frozen day in North Texas. Kathy Bates is at her usual best leading a cast of very normal and human costar characters thru one of the most wonderful feel good movies we've ever seen. Why this movie wasn't given the attention it deserved on it's release in 2002 is difficult to understand. Why it was head and shoulders above so many of the boring pieces of trash released with greater fanfare and attention is evident in the viewing.

I do not think that this movie deserves the low rating that most will give it . It 's one of the films that I will always remember it and the way that I will always watch when I am really down. A movie like this will never get old for me. I love all of the scenes from this movie , and if I could I would watch it everyday! It's not perfect , but it's very good! I recommend this movie for everyone! I am not one to give up hope, and this movie is another example of why that is a great thing to be.

Undoubtedly one of the best episodes ever , Balance of Terror is 45 minutes of well executed suspense , with excellent writing , direction , and acting. It’s a pity this kind of episode is so rare , but it is an example of how great Star Trek can be . The Enterprise is out exploring when a Starfleet monitoring station picks up a ship matching the Enterprise’s speed and heading. They can not identify the ship , but as it approaches the station it starts to fire weapons on it. The Enterprise responds by firing back , and after an intense exchange both ships go to red alert.

I did not know what to expect when I decided to watch this documentary . I knew it was about death. I was expecting to see death from many different angles , but I ended up seeing it from one point of view . The main idea of the video is that there is one moment in our life we are afraid of . I found this video really interesting and shocking . I really liked the video , because the way that the film maker presented his point of view and the idea he wanted to convey to the audience was really good .

Do you liked `` Dead Man do n't wear Plaid '' ? What about `` Top Secret '' and `` Cannonball 2 '' ? If you're a fan of all this type of movies i'm pretty sure you like this movie a lot. Because it's very similar, it's just a little bit better. If you want to see a better movie i can recommend you this movie called `` Top Secret '' with Val Kilmer, or you could watch some other cool movies, like this good movie i saw a few months ago called `` L. A.

This was the greatest movie I have ever seen in my life, the action was great, and i was so scared, there was a lot of gore WHICH MADE It GREAT, i would see it 1,000 more times, and Paris Hilton, D*MN she fine in that movie. But anyway, i would recommend it to anybody, even kids(like me) Adults like it to. You would probably have nightmares at night though, but beside that, IT IS AWESOMe, I CANT STOP BRAGGING ABOUT IT.

It 's up there with Where 's Poppa , The Groove Tube , Putney Swope . It memorializes the NYC blackout of the summer of '77. I saw this movie in the theaters. I remember it being pretty cool, but then again I was a young teenager back in the day so anything seemed cool. I watched this movie last night with my dad. I haven't seen it in the theater. It was entertaining, but also pretty silly. One of my favorite movies of the '70s. A classic film which I first saw around 1978 when it was on TV.

"Nuovomondo" was a great experience. Many filmmakers tell their stories to a big extent via dialogue. Emanuele Crialese directs his film very visually driven. For everything he wants to tell, he finds powerful images that are able to stand for themselves. Thus, he understands film as a medium that primarily tells its stories over the pictures on screen. Particularly European cinema is often very dialogue-driven (and many of the young US-American directors are strongly influenced by that). Crialese's opposite attitude was really the point, that made this film special for me.

Anyone who has seen Ali G before , should be well prepared for the full motion picture that is 'Ali G Indahouse'. It has a nice enough story about Ali, his sidekick, Baba and the gang, but the jokes are so similar to the ones in the television series that there was little to laugh at. Billed as a comedy, the movie failed to entertain and was a huge disappointment, which I would not watch again. If you want to know more about Ali G you're better off watching the tv shows. 3.0 out of 5 starsA funny and entertaining movie!

Warning--this film has some amazingly graphic images and should never be seen by kids.The artist who this story is all about was indeed a fine Korean painter who rose up from the lowest depths to become their greatest painter. Unfortunately, in so many ways, this guy was also a jerk in so many ways. Some of this was the artistic temperament and what may have seemed annoying was just his demanding nature when it came to art. But, other times he was simply a drunk jerk--especially when he was on his way to becoming a great artist.

That's right. Ohwon (the painter and the main character) is an exceptional person. What strikes me most is the message this film might address to all of you people there. And the message is sad. It says that, it's very difficult to do anything that's amazing or maybe even genius without having to obey the governments, establishment and other VIPs of this world. And even if you try, you might not be able to bear it. It is about the battle of a single person with a system. With many systems.A great film of this wonderful Korean director.

Louis Khan was one of the most influential architects of our time, and this film speaks volumes about how little everyone really knew. His son's desire to find out who, and more importantly what he was is moving, and emotional.This film captures the spirit of what architecture is really about, what good design is, and the emotional price that is paid for it. Equally haunting is the sound track. If you see the film, and then listen to the sound track you can revisit the film simply by listening.

This is probably the second best of the Death Wish movies . Death Wish 5 is the best one.Death Wish 3 isn't too bad though . I give it a 6.75/10 . It's worth your time but not worth your money , if you buy it on sale. I would wait for it on Netflix or get it on cable. Terrible film. Not one of the better 'Death Wish' films. It's a terrible remake and it is a terrible film overall. The worst of all the films. This movie was just a mess. It's too much of a downer.

An old man is riding his bike down a village road when a car comes out of nowhere , strikes him and sends him to the ground. The car stops, the window is lowered and a hand reaches out towards the bike and the bike’s bag. As the bike falls on top of the old man, the driver of the car looks over his shoulder, sees what has happened, shuts the door and drives away. The man lies there on his back; the blood is flowing from his head. His glasses are smashed and his face is cut and bruised.

This movie may be the best ever if you like watching movies and laughing and then subjecting your friends to watch those movies too. If you're anything like me, and you probably are, you'll be laughing for years to come at the jokes in this movie. One of the funniest parts is when Gus sharks some money off a guy with kids and then the guy takes those kids into the forest like Hansel and Gretel then he and his wife go home with them. The soup scene kitchen is rife with comic genius of buffoonery: "Inspection officer -- Here!"

From the creators of Bruce Almighty and Liar Liar ! The film took a while to pick up from the boring start and did not really make an impact with the viewers, in spite of the big name actors involved. The film is essentially about two people who are strangers and find their way to one another when they need someone the most in their life. The film was shot in India. The two protagonists, who are also the only actors in the film start out as complete strangers and gradually develop a bond as we see them grow together and support each other in their darkest hour.

This film was made right in the area where I grew up and now live. I know personally most of the property owners of the various locations used in the film. As a teenager, I worked in the fields surrounding the isolated road shown late in the film with Ron Perlman, Jonathon Furr, and the car. I am told that Jonathon Furr and Ben Allison are are natives of NC. I was fortunate to see it at a local showing. At that showing was one of the people who helped select locations and secure props, such as the bus (1938 Greyhound) used in the movie.

My college theater just had a special screening last night of this film. I have got to say that I think everyone was impressed with how good this movie was. Though, my roommate didn't care for it but he's not into horror movies anyway and just went to see if Paris Hilton can act. By the way, if you're worried about that, don't be. I'm not exactly one of her fans, but I must be honest and say she was pretty good and she has the best death scene. Overall, all the actor's were very good.

I've read a lot of reviews about Showtime on IMDb and many seem to miss the mark. I've noticed a lot of reviewers calling this the typical "buddy" film. De Niro is in no way Murphy's buddy throughout most of this movie. In fact, part of the comedy of this film is De Niro's reluctance to be friends with anybody.Murphy really shines in this one. He is back at doing what he does best, acting like a complete ham. He is a cop who wants so much to be an actor and enjoys being in the reality show.

Jeff Garlin's film is filled with heart and laughter. As in Curb Your Enthusiasm, his screen persona is hilarious; but in addition we get to see both warmth and a sense of emotional vulnerability that makes the story universal. While the film chronicles his character's dreams of love, performing success, and weight loss, it will appeal to anyone who dreams of a better life. The supporting cast brings the frustrations and joys of his life to the screen in funny and heartbreaking ways. The simple joys of food, friendship, and trying once again once life has disappointed us are all themes.

I think this show was right on the money for me. I watched it over the plane but there were parts in the movie that made me control myself from tearing all over the place. The chemistry between Richard gere and Diane lane was very believable (fantastic acting on both parts)! I loved how Diane lane's daughter acted in the show too. She displayed maturity and how she transformed throughout the show was easy to believe as what a teenager could possibly be like in real life. I loved this show from start to end. Definitely recommended for the romantic people out there!

Made at the height of the Black Power movement , this movie portrays African-American Putney Swope ( Arnold Johnson ) , an executive in a major Manhattan advertising agency who has been passed over for promotion because he is Negro , as he is chosen by the board of directors to succeed the dying president ( Bill Cosby ) . This movie was made during the height of the Black Power movement. This movie is about an African-American executive who has been passed over for promotion because he is Negro. He is chosen to succeed the dying President of the company.

Always enjoyed `` DOA '' ,1950 , which starred Edmond O'Brien and was very curious about this film . Dennis Hopper , of course, was very good but it was not a film that made any kind of impression upon my young mind . Perhaps the story is dated , and not enough of interest , but certainly not one of Hopper's finest movies , and it seemed to lack the intensity of his other films of the 1950's . But , who knows ? I may be wrong , it certainly didn't leave any lasting memories !

I can not say this movie was a hilarious , but I must have had a grin on my face the entire time. If you want a movie that is a light watch, not to deep, but also not stupid, then this would be perfect. I liked the chemistry between Ryan (Ryan Gosling), and Claire (Rachel McAdams). I thought Ryan had a nice sense of humor, with an edge. In fact his character is very much an edge. There was a sweetness to Claire's character, but also not to innocent. She was strong.

While I agree that this movie lacks any real substance and should not be taken seriously, its primarily directed to fans of the series who are looking for a quick fix. Bronson (Paul Kersey)once again takes to the streets (given a license to kill by the chief police no less) and moves into his friends apartment (who you guessed it) was killed by a street gang that has taken control of the neighborhood (which looks like Beruit). It's funny that people who associate with Bronson have a habit of getting killed.

We loved this movie because it was so entertaining and off beat-- Not your usual Hollywood drivel.My husband had a Blockbuster coupon and passed on a string of new releases of violent Hollywood stuff. He was about to walk out when he saw this and decided to take a chance. There was only one copy -- and with some glitches in the DVD that we finally had to flip to wide screen version and then back to the full screen version to make it stop stalling. But it was worth it. Cathy Bates is so good and she was so perfect for the role.

Lucio Fulci made a lot of great films throughout his career and the way that many of them featured a bucket load of gore lead to him earning the title 'The Godfather of Gore'. While Don't Torture a Duckling was made before Fulci became well known amongst gorehounds, and isn't all that gory; it's certainly a gritty and nasty little thriller, and for my money - the best film that Fulci ever made! Don't Torture a Duckling really is head and shoulders above a lot of the Giallo genre in terms of production values and unlike many of Fulci's later films, everything about this Giallo is great.

* * 1/2 Elisha Cuthbert , Chad Michael Murray , Brian Van Holt , Paris Hilton and Jon Abrahams . 90210 is an American comedy-drama television series , created by Rob Thomas , Gabe Sachs and Jeff Judah and produced by CBS Television studios . Based on the characters from the 90′s sitcom 90210 , the series , following a group of new characters , airs on the CW channel in the US and Canada on September 2, 2008 . The series has also aired in 2009 in the UK and Australia on E4 and Seven respectively, and in the Republic of Ireland and Italy in 2010 on E4 and Rai 4 .

Buddy Holly was a pioneer and victim of the early days of rock 'n ' roll . The young singer/songwriter made his name in the mid 1950s with three back to back number one hits and a string of big hits , including "That'll be the Day " , " Oh Boy " and "Peggy Sue ." The Texas born performer was 22 when a chartered airplane crash claimed his life , as well as his band the Crickets and Ritchie Valens . Holly remains one of the best known and beloved of rock pioneers.

When I started watching 3 of the episodes of this series on the Action Channel,I have to say out of all the shows that I've seen that ADV released,this one is one of the best shows of all time. I had to see it again,and that's when I got my chance. I bought the entire box set of this series at Best Buy for my 20th Birthday. And I got to enjoy it,and see more of the episodes that I missed on Action Channel,and the same 3 episodes that I've seen.

OK so Paris Hilton sucks in it ( typical Malibu Barbie ) but the rest of the actors are just perfect and so are the locations. I loved this movie a lot.. It is a remake of a hindi film 'Pyar Ke Side Effects" which was pretty decent.. This is about a young man and a young lady who are just friends but eventually end up together. It all happens very spontaneously and very realistically.. The story revolves around the lives of the young people and their respective parents. This is one movie you will enjoy a lot and will be able to watch it more than once..

This was a riveting film , one that really drew me in . I 'm a big fan of William Hurt in this role , one of his very best. And the storyline was well-written and well-developed with excellent acting and direction. I loved this film , the soundtrack is also great. It's one that will stay with me. If this movie was on television, and you could only watch it once...I would still buy the soundtrack. If this soundtrack had been made available separately, it definitely would have gone on my holiday gift list. The music was amazing!

I've been a fan of Rachael's since the beginning of 30MM on the Food Network, so I have seen her grow over the years. The minute I saw her interact with Oprah, I predicted that this show would happen, because I saw how taken Oprah is with her, and with good reason: she comes across as very natural, and willing to laugh at herself, which is very engaging. The set is appealing, and there are some fresh ideas (I love the lazy Susan that the audience sits on).

SPOILERSI love the Simpsons , and I have seen every single episode that had ever come out . I must say, I love it when the writers make references to the other things they've wrote, because I usually get it . In this one , I thought the writers made a reference to a character named Bart's Dad , who had a beard ( I am not making this up , the writers of the simpsons did make a character with a beard ) , and in the beginning of this episode , they say that Bart is 10 years old .

This movie is a love story set in the backdrop of war . Everything about the movie was perfect . Excellent acting , great story line , brilliant direction , wonderful production values and superb cinematography made it a very watchable one . The chemistry between Aishwariya and Abhishek was so good that you can actually see the love between them . I was very touched by this movie as it made me revisit my childhood . All the songs were so beautiful and suited the character perfectly . All the child artists in this movie are so cute and you simply fall in love with them .

This musical has a deep meaning which is appreciated by only a few . The wise can see the wisdom in it, but it is impossible to explain the whole of it. I feel like it's a very deep musical that will stay with me for a while. If you get to see it you will be able to see it for yourself, but for now I will just have to tell you my own interpretation of the play, and it's not exactly how the director wants the play to end, but more like my take on the whole story.

This is a brilliant film . The story starts off in Romania , where Billy Crystal stars as an agent in the US secret service who has been assigned the task of taking over the security arrangements for the newly elected President , who is played by Alan Ladd , for a trip to the U.S.A from Romania . The trip to America goes wrong and Ladd's plane crashes . Crystal finds himself in a remote location in the woods and has to go looking for help to find the plane wreckage and the passengers . Meanwhile Ladd is in the plane , but has no idea where it has crashed .

Mark Blankfield ( from the old late night TV show `` Fridays '' ) plays Dr. Daniel Jekyll , a scientist who invented a formula that will enable him to turn into his evil alternate personality "Mr. Hyde." After an accident, Daniel is exposed to a chemical that not only gives him the ability to transform, but also gives him the power to take over the world. Will he succumb to evil or can the power of love save him? Jekyll And Hyde was released on DVD 44d ago in the US. The upcoming release date is November 13, 2018.

There's no point in comparing this with the original series. Though different in look and content, both are true to the original idea. That is, an SF/horror anthology series. Due to indifferent scheduling in Australia, I've only managed to catch a small number of episodes spread over the first few seasons. The very first episode really did give me the creeps (nightmares at my age ...!) but a number of others did fall flat; generally when the stories moved into horror realms and away from SF. I only hope the DVDs reach us eventually.

Just about every commentator has mentioned the way that some of the interview footage is superposed over the concert footage in places. This is true, and is the biggest flaw of this film. However, it isn't so often, or so bad, that one shouldn't see this video. If you are a Black Sabbath fan, you have to see this. Aside from having seen Black Sabbath in the Sevnties and early Eighties, I saw them in 2005 or 2006 when they also headlined OZZfest just like in this video.

Chaplin is a doughboy in his final film of 1918 , a doughboy who can not seem to get the girl of his life to notice. Chaplin’s face is covered by makeup to give him a darker look. Made shortly before he was drafted for service in the Great War, ‘Chaplin’s Doughboy’ is one of the few American films from 1918 that survive in decent condition and which is available on DVD. It was directed by Arthur Berthelet, the man who would go on to direct Charlie Chaplin’s films in the silent era.

SPOILERS BELOW ` A Dog 's Life ' was most noteworthy for its excellent comic timing . In Charlie Chaplin 's movies, it was the little things that made up the bulk of the comedy. For example, in ' The Tramp 's Strong Arm ' , the gags are built up by little gestures or facial expressions: the Tramp getting out of jail and patting his backside to be sure it is still there, looking up at the moon and thinking ' Oh , I forgot I was outside ' . The little things that made his movies funny are what are remembered by most.
'

I'm not going to go into too much depth, but Showtime was a pretty funny movie. There wasn't any slapping-your-knee funny scenes (that I can remember), but it had it's moments. The cast is pretty good, Robert De Niro is good as usual and Eddie Murphy pulls off a pretty funny performance. Rene Russo was just fine in the film, no complaints there. There were two characters in the story that I liked that they didn't explain much at all. The first one was Trey Sellars' (Eddie Murphy's) buddy at the gym played by Ken Campbell.

I was pleasantly surprised by the depth of story and character development . Fulci was a master at creating horrific situations but he also gave his characters the depth needed to drive home his stories. He is often overlooked but is very much appreciated by me. I love Fulci's film-making style. He is definitely one of the great directors of horror. Loved it. I love to watch Zombie films. Loved it, this is one of my top zombie films. Best Zombie movie I've ever seen! I'd love a DVD release with English subtitles for my DVD player.

inspite of many movies dealing with great artists or a genius , chihaweseon pointed out the real dilemma in which the genius artist is trapped in , this movie gives you a great insight about the human nature . i must say its a must watch for all of us to understand the human nature and the dilemma an artist faces . it's kinda long but it is worth the wait. I am a fan of Park Chang Wook. I first watched his acting in "Dream High", then went on to watch his other dramas. I watched "I am Sam" and was completely blown away.

A Formula For Murder isn't a well known Giallo, but that isn't to say it's not a very good one! The film is directed by Alberto De Martino, the man behind cult classics such as The Antichrist and Blazing Magnums. The film was released late on in the Giallo cycle, but more than stands up to many of the films released around the 'golden' period in the early seventies. Despite a lack of logic in some areas, the film works mainly due to the competent way it mixes Argento style death scenes with some genuinely surprising plot twists, and a host of well defined characters.

I thought Besson's film managed to do without words what few films have been able to do with them; Capture true human emotions. The main character's struggles, triumphs, set backs, hopes and desires are all so honestly shown that you wonder if he is acting at all. The film has a low budget and is obviously made without the glitz and glamour afforded to most Hollywood productions but that minimalism is what allows this film to transcend the stereotypical Sci-Fi labeling and become a true drama. However calling this film solely a drama would take away from the fantastic post-apocalyptic plot.

I remember this film of old. It's a great, chilling, atmospheric horror picture about a man who moves into a Scottish castle, only to discover that there are strange goings-on in the corridors at night. And there are even stranger events taking place out back, in Hollywood's most familiar hedge maze. Yes, this is the maze you've seen in every feature-length film that ever involved a topiary puzzle, up to and including "The Shining." But the punchline to this story is about the last thing you would guess. I certainly didn't see it coming.

This interesting film noir features three very good performances : Sanders , Patrick , and Blackmer . The scenes between them are riveting and it's a shame this isn't a full-length feature. There are also a couple of scenes that could have been better shot. The movie has a lot of the usual plot elements, but the characters are so interesting that it keeps you glued to the screen. There is a lot of violence, though not graphically portrayed. Overall, this is a really good film. Beware. This is a 63-minute movie. It is advertised as being 83 minutes.

I am a guy , so i was very hesitant to watch the movie because i know that Richard Gear has played a woman and i was sure that this movie can’t be good. But when i watched it , i was very impressed. It’s a story about love, life, family , friendships and how difficult is to choose between those and the career. I really loved that the movie had not only romantic scenes, but also a good balance of family scenes with the husband and the kids. The story is not original , but the way it was interpreted is so good.

Being American, I have not been exposed to this character before, which is good because some of you have been disappointed. I have nothing to compare it to. I have found no enjoyment in the mindless idiot humor in the American teen movies, and although this is a slightly similar type of humor, I couldn't stop laughing. I hardly ever laugh out loud at a movie. And usually a movie has a few funny parts for me, but this movie was funny from start to finish. My only disappointment was when it was over.

Exclusively for Coop 's lovers , though Clint Eastwood very strong though unobtrusive presence is a great asset of this movie. The music is excellent , as well as the direction and cinematography. We have to wait for more from Eastwood as a director: I hope that he will give us something else. This one , however , will remain in time as an example of how a director ( with a great background) can work with a great script. The story , though simple in its basic concepts , develops with a nice pace, without losing its tension all the time.

Well, what's wrong with the title "Separate Lies" (accused elsewhere of not being "exciting"). It's cunning, subtle and a bit poetic. (Of course there's a Phil Collins song and a James Belushi film called "Separate Lives", which are alluded to here.) But the real point is the ethical dilemmas of telling lies at different levels that the film probes. OK, it's not an "in-your-face" hilarious title, but then it's not an in-your-face hilarious film. Please give British films like this a chance.

This film , like much of their music , is either underrated or unnoticed by the casual observer . It's not a masterpiece in the style of their earlier work but it is certainly worth listening to - and if I'm honest a better listen that the last two studio albums that they've produced since their reunion - although to be fair I do like the last album too . It's a very atmospheric album , quite dark and bleak but with it's own kind of beauty . As with all of their albums it does have some excellent songs on it .

This is one of those films where it is easy to see how some people wouldn't like it. My wife has never seen it, and when I just rewatched it last night, I waited until after she went to bed. She might have been amused by a couple small snippets, but I know she would have had enough within ten minutes.Head has nothing like a conventional story. The film is firmly mired in the psychedelic era. It could be seen as filmic surrealism in a nutshell, or as something of a postmodern acid trip through film genres.

Years ago I read the book 'A Máquina' (The machine). As I re-read this little book again and again, I could never stop getting more and more fascinated by the imagination of the writer and the richness of the Brazilian culture.When I knew about the movie, I was really scared that someone would spoil one of my favorites books! Well, happily, my fears were unjustified and the movie is such a wonderful and delicate piece of art.I can't recall of any other movie that could bring tears to my eyes due to the very beauty of the text.

If you've never experienced the thing that is Zasu Pitts, here is a Zasu zinger! In 1933 Mae Questel caricatured Pitt's voice for the character Olive Oyl for the Fleischer Studios animated cartoon version of the comic strip Popeye. Zasu (pronounced Zay-Sue) does her best "Olive Oyl" impersonation walking around whining and ringing her hands or attaching herself to the policeman's laynard. I kept waiting for her to say "ohhh myyyy", but instead it's "something always happens to somebody." The first time I saw this film I loved Zasu and found her character really funny.

The Aristocats is really quite charming, and is rated far too low on IMDb. The songs aren't as memorable as the ones in the Jungle Book, but they weren't bad at all. The animation is really lovely, the best sequence being the landscape of Paris in general. It looked beautiful. This is probably Disney's most relaxing animation I think, and as another reviewer quite rightly said, who doesn't love cats? Another great piece of animation was O' Malley looking into Duchess's eyes, as their romance was so believable while not obvious.

I 've read a lot of reviews about Showtime on IMDb and many seem to miss the mark . I've seen quite a number of movies that are in the genre of horror thriller and this one is among the best I 've seen in a long time. The plot is great , the acting is great . The movie does a great job at keeping your interest and making you really care about the main character and the people around him . I liked this movie and I think it is a very worthwhile movie experience .

Although this film never attained commercial notoriety, my experience has led me to conclude that many well-done pieces of artistic expression often do not gain mass appeal. The story line depicts a young boy stealing a car and embarking on a surreal, dream-like adventure with very little basis in our conceptualization of time and space. Therefore, anyone who attempts to view this film from the perspective of its conformity to reality will likely be disappointed; it is not intended to be "realistic." It is, however, intended to be metaphoric with extensive symbolism apparent to those with superb attention to detail.

Yes, at times "Unconditional Love" overwhelms as it bounces -- no, as it ricochets -- from one story element to another in the most unconventional use of thematic elements and characters. In fact, it wasn't until I watched the film for the second time that I began to understand what I think P.J. Hogan might have been attempting to do with this quirky, unconventional flick. Perhaps the entire film itself is a metaphor for the unconditional love for which Grace (Kathy Bates) yearns and describes in the later part of the film.

A beautifully photographed and paced short film . It evocatively captures the feeling of this family and much of the world. Inspired by the writings of H.P.Lovecraft, this film tells a story of two friends and their unexplainable adventures in an unknown realm. It’s a journey that leaves us questioning the unseen in the world around us. An unassuming, darkly hilarious examination of an American family’s misadventures when an outsider enters their lives. It’s a tale that will strike a chord with anyone who has ever been a child, a parent, or just human.

Pity the Monkees . People always accused them of being manufactured ( which they were ) or being nothing more than a novelty act ( and they were that too ) . However , despite all the criticism they received , they were one of the most talented acts in Rock & Roll history . This 5 disc box set is a testament of their amazing musical talent . It contains over 100 unreleased and previously released performances , including 60 songs recorded for various radio and television specials from the 60's . The box also contains the Monkees 20th anniversary reunion concert from 1986 and a full color 40-page book .

First off, I absolutely loved this movie. As a Billy Crystal fan, I must say that I was expecting more comedic situations than I actually got. However, it was nice to see him in a role with more depth and emotion. His portrayal of talent agent Sammy was brilliantly performed and uniquely him. In addition, Gheorghe Muresan (as Maximus) was superb in his first film role. When Sammy goes to Romania to visit his client on location he has his world turned upside down. He never expected that he would accidentally find the one person who could change his life.

What I enjoyed most in this film was the scenery of Corfu , being Greek I adore my country and this was just like a home movie being there , the rest of the movie just made me cringe and feel sick , I just could not relate at all with the characters and they were just a bunch of losers , it was a bit like a reality show and in that respect I did not enjoy the movie , I know its supposed to be satire and all that but I do not like this type of humor .

I Loved this movie. Mark Blankfield was perfect for this role. More Classic sci/fie/Horror films should be remade to this comedy level, which is at the very top of the line in my opinion. A no drink movie, you laugh so hard you will spill it all over yourself. Can We expect more? Let's hope so. I would like to suggest many movies for this type of remake. Mel Brookes made some remakes of classic films.He made some very strong contributions. A Picture of Dorian Gray would be a good suggestion.

In this era when almost everything makes it on to DVD (I'm expecting to see the My Mother the Car collection any day now) this film has been unfairly neglected. There are innumerable stupid comedies from the 60's as well as many other eras that have received at least a cursory DVD treatment. This one wasn't even released on VHS to my knowledge, despite the talents involved in the making (Arthur Hiller, Eli Wallach, Anne Jackson, Murray Shisgal (notable later for co-writing Tootsie), even Dustin Hoffman in his debut).

I watched this movie out of a lack of anything else on at the time . Quickly the movie grabbed my attention and I found it to be an enjoyable, interesting watch. It's about the lives of a group of young men and women living in Sydney in the 90s. It centres around the life of Darren who is played by Simon Baker ( who I really like as an actor , he's very good ) , the rest of the cast play his friends and girlfriends ( one of who he eventually ends up with ).

The 1973 musical version of LOST HORIZON is the most wonderful endearing and campy musical films of ALL TIME . I am sure you will agree with me in this. I am not saying that this is a wonderful movie because I love the music, no I love the music because this film is a great film. It is an absolute treasure and I love it. The story is a fun adventure romp, which is what the best 1970’s musicals were all about. The plot in a nutshell, is the story of an American pilot Frank Capra, who is lost in the mountains of Tibet.

The young John Garfield turned in a fine performance in the 1939 "They Made Me a Criminal." Celebrating a ring victory in a jammed locker room, boxer Johnnie Bradfield emotes about his love of mom, rejection of booze and clean living style to fans, including cops, who eat it up. Later in the evening he's plowed and tussling with his bimbo gal while his manager, in on the con, shares the evening. And the whiskey.A problem develops when another couple arrives. The guy is a newspaper reporter and he says he'll expose Bradfield's phony life on the front page.

To say the truth, I went to see this movie only because Nicolas Cage is my favorite actor. Folks may not agree, but he makes equally good performances in bad and good movies. I haven't seen a movie with Penelope Crus before, so I was anxious to see whether she is a good actress. So, here's what I think:The movie is good (I haven't read the novel, however). Some moments were really thrilling and... unexpected. Altogether you'll find the plot pretty simple.

Very touching film , a great surprise to come up from Brazil , a country that usually exports features about violence . This kind of short films have their importance too in terms of artistic creation. I agree with the other commentaries, this film is touching and a tribute to the work of those who dedicate themselves to the rescue of the street children. The characters are very well interpreted and they are very natural. It was nice to see this film that tells about the reality for the children on the streets. It would have been even more touching to see a little bit more their situation.

Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. The film captures and interprets his artistic method ('sketching' poems), his inspiration (the spirit of nature and its fantastic beauty) and his struggles to accept a harsh reality in the face of his idealist imagination.The film integrated excerpts of Miyazawa's poems into the plot beautifully. His relationships with his students was powerful, especially in one scene where he offers everything he has to a student who has just been caught stealing materials from the classroom.

Better than it has any right to be, this movie died a quick and painful death at the American box office. At times sophomoric, at others, bitingly satirical and witty, Jekyll and Hyde is mostly just a near perfect reflection of the times, laden with drug and sexual humor, reminding one at one time or another of everything from the Woody Allen of "Everything You Always Wanted To know About Sex" to the Mel Brooks of "The Producers", Saturday Night Live to Monty Python, Carlin to Cheech and Chong.

This is an example of what film school lecturers would call a good debut movie . It follows all the rules – there is a solid narrative structure which is easy to follow, it contains recognisable set-pieces, it’s paced in such a way as to build suspense and there’s a clear ‘hero’ character for audiences to root for (in the person of James Brolin, who plays the hapless father of a couple of boys). This is the type of movie that you can watch again a year down the line and still appreciate.

At one time `Buddy Cop' movies ruled the box office. It seemed that every summer flocks of Beverly Hills Cop wannabes descended on our nation's theaters. Not any more. Lately the gusher has dried to barely a trickle. The drought has eased a bit recently with the release of Showtime, a movie that is a genuinely funny and consistently entertaining example of the genre.Mitch Preston is a dedicated cop. He's not a Dirty Harry type by any means. He's just incredibly focused professional who's completely intolerant of anything that gets in the way of the performance of his dutieslike, say, a T.V.

The thing with Ali G is that he takes the mick out of himself and his character. The humour is very much a 'like it or love it' brand of totally politically incorrect, irreverent and self effacing type.Personally I totally love this film, and so has everyone i have met who has seen it. You can watch it several times and pick new gags up each time. The humour is both aural and visual, and the timing is impeccable. The humour is probably very English, and specifically London, so its possible that non-English viewers may not get some of the humour.

It took me a while to find this movie since they do n't have it yet on DVD ( and even when they have, you'll have to pay more for it). Luckily, I found it online and watched the movie. I was surprised with the movie, they did a great job in telling the true story about a young man who suffered from mental illness and the difficulties in finding his proper medication. I recommend watching it, it's a really good movie. I'm also hoping that it will help people to understand about mental illness more.

I saw Borderline several years ago on AMC . I 've been looking for it ever since . It was made in 1941 and starred a young actor named Jackie Cooper . He is the son of Jack Cooper, who appeared in movies with such actors as John Wayne and Roy Rogers . Jackie is the same Jackie Cooper who starred in the Mickey Mouse show and in the movie Skippy . I 'm trying to find out if Jackie Cooper is still alive. He would be 89 if he is . I would really appreciate any help or information you can provide . Thank you very much.

I remember years ago BBC1 used to show this movie in a very cut form . I tracked it down on ebay in a boxed DVD set and it turned out to contain the entire movie. Hmm, I was just about to buy this from BFI. I'll have to hold out now. I recently rewatched it, it's not just a great movie but an interesting time capsule, it's interesting to see how certain things have developed since it was made, it shows a lot of things in this movie are just as relevant today as they were in the 1960s.

`` Head '' is a film that has held up well since its original release date in 1968 . The story, which takes place in a parallel universe , centers around two characters that live in a society in which the government has banned sex and intimacy. There is a rebellion, led by this couple and they must try to get the government to realize their mistake. This film deals with the subjects of government censorship and prejudice . Much of the story in ` Head ` takes place within the home of the main couple, John and Anabelle .
