Even after nearly 20 years apart, the original members of Black Sabbath have not lost a thing. In this concert, they perform their best songs from their heyday (1970-1978), including "N.I.B. ", "War Pigs", and "Paranoid".Also included is priceless backstage footage with interviews and retrospectives into their days as the top hard rock band on the planet. The comments of Ozzy, Tony Iommi, Geezer Butler, and Bill Ward are just as interesting and intriguing to watch as the fabulous onstage performances.A must-see for all Sabbath and Ozzy fans.

Emily Watson and Tom Wilkinson together - what a treat ! With Rupert Everett and Linda Bassett rounding off the cast - it was hard to expect less than a good film - and the result was excellent. This is not a Hollywood film - it's set in 1947, after the war, in London - but it was shot in Wales. In fact it's a remake of a British film, 'Saving Grace' from 1929 - with a very different plot but the same title. In this version, Grace is an unwed mother in a care home run by Sister Ruth, played by Tom Wilkinson.

This film set the standard for all rock biopics to follow . It accomplished this through the energetic performances of the actors, the realistic portrayal of Jim, the music, and the gritty depiction of a life that was cut short. It all worked. And the soundtrack, featuring some of his biggest hits, will be a timeless reminder of his music. I don't think I would call this a true "rock" film. The music seems to have a lot more of an R & B and Soul feel (which isn't really my thing).

Years ago when I first read John Irving 's The World According to Garp , I was astounded that most of Garp's story took place off-stage and that the author left a lot to the reader 's imagination. I remember thinking at the time, "What's the point in telling the story of a writer 's life if you won 't even show it to me?" I had a similar experience with The Widow of the South by Robert Farris Thompson, and when I thought about it, I realized that it was probably more about the storyteller than the story being told.

Motorama viewers should already by keen on other offbeat b-grade desert-based films such as Bagdad Cafe or Repo Man (both of which starled in the early 80s, so it’s not too surprising). This is a movie that will be of particular interest to car-lovers and motorsports fans. It contains a lot of interesting automobiles in addition to a lot of great racing and drag-racing action footage, with some great-looking period shots of desert-based motorsports and off road racing action. The narration and voice-over script is pretty awful, but the rest of the movie is great.

I had the chance to watch Blind Spot in Barcelona and I enjoyed it tremendously . I thought it to be an outstanding documentary and one of the better documentary films I had seen over the years. The way in which it is shot and edited was brilliant as it was extremely artistic and poignant. One thing that I would say to anyone that hasn’t seen it yet is don’t miss it if you get the chance. I am really happy to be involved with the documentary and look forward to watching the finished product. Good Luck with everything and enjoy the rest of the editing.

Most critics seem to have dismissed this film, like so many other Charles Bronson vehicles, as just another patchwork of mindless violence. And while there is a fair amount of mayhem, DEATH WISH 3 is not that awful of an effort, particularly for fans of the series and its star.This time out, aging Charlie's Paul Kersey is let loose by a police chief desperate to clean up a rough part of New York City. The trigger-happy vigilante moves into the heart of gang territory, where he once again becomes a one-man army in an urban war of good versus evil.

it's a great movie for the whole family. i don't think many people have seen it cause i ask people and they say that they've never heard of it before. Sophie Heyman is my aunt's sister in law. my favorite scene is the whole movie i can't even pick a favorite scene. my favorite character is Hubert because he is a funny yet smart dog. if someone hasn't seen it they are missing out on a great adventure. i've only seen it cause my aunt is related to Sophie and she got a copy from her.

This film as it is now is far shorter than it was when released in 1918. In fact, it is now more available with two other medium sized silent Chaplin features (A DOG'S LIFE, and THE PILGRIM) that Chaplin re-released in the 1950s. In it's day SHOULDER ARMS was a big hit because of it's humor in uniform approach. It still is very funny (Chaplin in disguise as a tree, spying on the Germans, is so ridiculous it's hysterical), but it suffers from being set in it's own age.

Wow, What a wonderful film-making! Mr. Im has done it, again!His last work, ChunHayang (2000) was a great film, but this one is even greater. Selected as an official feature film in the Canne Festival for the second time in a two-year row, this 66 years old director is getting better and better at what he is making of with a Korean culture.Simply, Chihwaseon is about a great Korean painter, '(Ohwon) JANG, Seung-Up' who was considered as a prodigy in the late Nineteenth century.

This is a good film, no doubt, but with some odd aspects. Without spoiling anything it takes place in 3 places only- a Sicilian farm, the boat,and Ellis Island New York. All shots are close up so we never see a broad sweep of anything. I wonder if this was to save money? No street scenes anywhere, and we don't even see the boat except in close ups. And the music...what on earth was going on with playing Nina Simone songs, decades before they were out?

Pierre Jolivet plays a Don Quixote character, unable to speak, living in a world incompatible with modern life. He trusts to his homemade weaponry - helmet, sleeves, and spear - made out of hubcaps, seat cushions, and discarded office furniture. Just as Don Quixote rode Rocicante, "The Man" rides his contraption (literally) transcending the lost lives caught up the harsh and demeaning modern world - soaring above the earth, away from the plight of modern man. Both characters ride in search of adventure in an effort to right the wrongs of the world.

My husband and I watched this last night ... It was wonderful .... For once he was wrong in guessing where it was heading, it took a different twist than he expected. It was very moving, and it will be interesting to hear the next part when it appears. I'm glad you both watched it and found it moving. I too was surprised by how it turned out. Sorry you are still sick. You need a holiday. Yes - you are right ... I could really do with some time away from the daily routine of work and family ...

SHOWTIME is a mess , but it 's an entertaining mess . The plot is forgettable , the satire is half-hearted but the action sequences are impressive. The story centers on a small-town police department , led by Sheriff Sam ( Jack Nicholson ) . The town is being terrorized by two gangs - one lead by the sadistic Floyd , the second by the ruthless Havenshaw . The police have a plan to arrest Floyd , but when the gangsters find out , they take over the town and terrorize its residents . The police are now under Floyd's command .

A surprisingly great cartoon in the same league as Batman : TAS and its ilk , I enjoyed it in spite of my initial reluctance to like it
Sadly I have to agree with everyone else here, this was dreadful! The animation was cheap, the jokes were weak, the main character was flat and uninteresting and the story just wasn't engaging or funny! It really wasn't anything worth watching, it was a waste of time! Sadly I'll have to agree with everyone here as well, this was dreadful!

This film had about everything one could wish when viewing it originally, at the end of the 1960's decade. It was immensely entertaining, and provided a contemporary view of the many changes which had occurred during that period - and were still ongoing - in terms of the Black Power movement, Vietnam, and the volatile movement which followed the quieter, preceding postwar 1950's.All of this and one of the funniest films, then or now.Viewing it for the second time recently, I was surprised to find it as engrossing as when seen originally.

I love this movie a lot . I must get this on DVD . I have 2 VHS copies , one from when I first saw it on TV and one from when HBO ran the series . I was so disappointed when this series ended with only 1 season , but at least we got some movies . I wonder if they will ever show us another sequel or prequel . The first movie I saw this on was on a cruise ship and we couldn't believe how great this movie was and how it looked so real .

To experience Head you really need to understand where the Monkees were when they filmed it.This was as their series was coming to a close and the group was near break up. Their inventive and comedic series (sort of an American Idol of their day) took four unknown actors and formed a manufactured supergroup around them.This is their take on their "manufactured image" and status as the 2nd tier Beatles. They always felt they were in a box, trapped, and unable to find credibility despite their talents.It is also a hell of a musical-trippy, inventive (I have the soundtrack) and full of surprises.See it with an open mind.

Valeria , an elegant and pretty young lady lives in a world surrounded by the walls of her shyness and of her dreams: she loves to read books and to travel. One day the girl discovers a book with a title that touches her and she falls in love with the story and the characters of the book she has just found. Soon she decides to embark on a journey full of surprises, with no return. In the adventure, Valeria discovers amazing places such as Rome, Barcelona, New York City, San Francisco, Paris and Venice, meeting new people every day.

Not sure why the other comment on this film was so negative , but I loved this movie . I’m glad I decided to go with my own judgement on it , instead of relying on others . The actors, director , costumes, scenery , everything was so perfect ! I can’t wait until it comes out on blu-ray . I hope they have a lot of behind the scene features , just so I can keep watching . Great movie . By Katie B,
Loved it! It's been so long since I've seen a romantic comedy that was actually romantic.

Diora Baird is absolutely hot as hell in this movie. But really all the characters are amazingly fun to watch. (MINOR SPOILERS) As per usual, the main character, B, is the sane one of the bunch. B has this crazy idea to make up his own college when he's rejected from all colleges he applies to. He's known for making fake IDs. so an acceptance letter is no problem.Because B's dad is a hard @$$ and suspicious of this university he's never heard of, B gets his friend Sherman to design a website for the university.

Spike Milligan's books and plays have defeated film makers over the years, and 2002's 'Puckoon' is sadly no exception. The novel, set in 1924, concerns the partitioning of Ireland, in particular its effects on a solitary community ( the 'Puckoon' of the title ). Due to a colossal blunder, half the village is now in Northern Ireland, the other half is in the Republic. Locals go to the toilets at the bottom of their gardens to find a barbed wire fence blocking their path. Drinkers crowd like sardines into a corner of the pub to enjoy a cheaper pint.

If you are looking for a phony Hollywood action movie, this won't be one for you. If the Truth is what you seek, rent or buy this. From a true story, the movie attempts to capture the heart of what was/is happening in South Africa (and many other places).For historical knowledge, this rates up there with stories such as "The Pianist," "Schindler's List" or "Nuremberg." Millions of people today have no clue what apartheid is or that it even exists. This movie may help them learn, and may even help them dig deeper.

Belonging to the subgenre of post-apocalyptic future films, it is a stylistic and very very intimate installment. The most noticed element of the film is its silence; no one speaks. I don't think Besson, despite what is evident in most of his later work, meant it as any kind of cool gimmick. I think what makes it so clever and so effective is the fact that with no other way of communicating, everyone has to read each other based on intuition and conveying of emotion, no matter how slight.

When the trailer for Accepted first came up , many people began to get excited about seeing it ... really excited to see it. And then they waited. For some reason that I'll never understand, the film was released to video before it ever hit a theater. It wasn't a small theater release that got bumped to DVD before its run. It was a large-scale studio release that got pushed out the door to the home market before most people could even see it in theater. The movie itself was very enjoyable.

Cult-director Lucio Fulci is probably most famous for his gory Zombie flicks from the 1980s that earned him his rightful reputation as the "Godfather Of Gore". Fulci's absolute greatest film, however, dates back to 1972 and, while it is definitely gritty and violent, it is not nearly as gory as many of his other films. "Non Si Sevizia Un Paperino" aka. "Don't Torture A Duckling" of 1972 is not only by far Fulci's greatest film, this tantalizing and utterly brilliant Giallo is one of the absolute highlights of the genre.

I 've got to say it . Gary Busey saved this film . If it were not for his fine performance , this film would have been a complete and utter flop . Gary Busey really did a good job portraying a guy who was so completely out of touch with reality that it was not only hard to watch him , but very sad too . The other characters in this film were all rather boring and ordinary , but this one was the star . The movie itself was nothing special , but it was entertaining . I have had a crush on Sharon Stone since Basic Instinct .

All the characters in this cartoon were hilarious. Norman the Viking guardian had some memorable phrases and the skull master, the bad guy, would always be vowing to kill Max with some insane cackling. The writing is the best. I was glued to the set when this would come on when I was younger. If they came out with a DVD of all the episodes they made I would be forced to buy it. This and a Conan the Barbarian cartoon are the ones I miss the most from childhood. I think these cartoons are the most unappreciated out of all the great cartoons.

I watch tons of movies and had no idea this would be as good as it was. I was looking forward to it after reading the plot (even though I find Nirvana overrated). It sounded like it would be tons of fun but it was more than that. Jansen puts in little touches like the books (Kubrick book among others), movie posters, etc. I like when I see a director takes his time and put his heart into a film. And you can really feel that in this.

When I first saw this movie,I also expected "our boys" to be cute,and more like an extended version of the TV show. I didn't "get it" back then. But,years later,at a party YEARS later,at a 70s' type PAR-TAY,where certain substances had been smoked,inhaled,and with plenty of tequila,"HEAD" was on late at night.We watched it,and finally realized what "HEAD" was all about. It spoofed their own show,as shown in one song that called themselves,"a manufactured image".

The movie has taken a little flack for playing fast and loose with the facts . But it will put a smile on your face and make a believer of even the most stalwart skeptic. These films are so good that you'll forget that they aren't real, and then you'll forget that they are supposed to be faked. Either way you're in for a real treat! Science fiction fans will be thrilled at the appearance of so many famous characters from their favourite programmes. And for the rest of the family, the spectacular special effects will be a thrill in its own right!

Well, I guess I was in the mood for a movie that really grabbed me from the beginning. This movie wasn't it. It plodded along at a pretty slow, deliberate pace for the first 40 minutes, but there wasn't really anything in it that I was terribly interested in--there's an intriguing and mysterious feud between Jean Reno's character and an old man, but more of the first 40 minutes is dominated by the wanderings of the main character, whom I didn't know much about and couldn't really relate to at the time.

Nominated for best documentary feature at 2004's Academy Awards, My Architect follows filmmaker Nathaniel Kahn in his quest to find out about his father, the legendary architect Louis I Kahn. Lou Kahn died in 1974, when Nate was 11 years old, leaving behind an incredible but limited body of work, unpaid debts and three separate families all living within a few kilometres of each other. My Architect follows Kahn's life through chronologically examining his buildings, and interspersing their beauty with the story of a charismatic, but selfish and emotionally immature genius.

Like some people here , I love/loved Stingers ! In Norway it got aired a lot later . That also explains why I have a lot of the original VHS tapes. There are so many good memories. It is very hard to pick a favourite episode. I loved the first season of Stingers and it's not fair that it only lasted for one season. It was such a fun and original show. I think the reason it only ran for a season is that CBS didn't have the advertising budget for it. They had the rights for Stargate.

Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji , a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the Taisho and Showa periods. Miyazawa Kenji wrote many works in a unique style, with a combination of traditional Japanese culture and the modern Western influence. The writer's own words are interwoven with the music to create a truly unique piece. "Song of the Earth" is a piece from one of Miyzawa Kenji's best-loved collections, "Yume Miru Uchu." The piece depicts the earth as it changes over the years, and is sung and played by an orchestra and a choir.

This movie was great . It had everything a true action fan could want . Plenty of people getting shot , lots of blood and action . I really liked that they didnt spend half the movie talking. This was a very fun action movie that has some twists that I never expected . There are also a few very funny scenes in the movie . I have to say though that I think I have seen it all in this movie . They have done everything they can and there is nothing left to add to an action movie.

He did one at Christmas to try and bring back a number one song, and now the terrific Justin Lee Collins wanted to reunite the cast members and maybe some crew of one of his favourite TV shows as a kid, The A-Team. The only member he wouldn't be able to get was the late great George Peppard who played main character Col. John "Hannibal" Smith, but he did get some kind of psychic to try and help. He did manage to reunite all members including Dirk Benedict (Lt. Templeton "Faceman" Peck #2) who went to Celebrity Big Brother in 2007, Dwight Schultz (Capt.

A well written screenplay. A moving story showing the middle class English at it's best. Some great acting by Tom Wilkinson and Emily Watson. Tom Wilkinson is one of Britain's best actors. He knows how to be subtle and honest. Emily Watson is an actress I was not familiar with, but to her credit she does a great job of playing the ****** wife. The director, Julian Fellowes did not succumb to the typical Hollywood gimmicks to give the film some meaty storyline. It has not over dramatized it's portrayal of the English middle class.

I watch tons of movies and had no idea this would be as good as it was . I was pleasantly surprised by the amount of action, suspense, and creativity that went in to this story line. You're not going to find much action when watching this movie so it's more of a drama, but the story line is amazing. In a world where people have become so dependent on technology for everything we do, this movie showed how that could be a very dangerous thing, not only on the outside but inside of us as well.

I still can't describe what to feel when I received this by the fnac site. Such a rare movie, so little spoken and known, is difficult to find, even to fans, but the contrast betwen past and present is devastating: now I hold a DVD of the movie, with the finest quality possible. As I did in Atlantis, the other rare Besson movie I bought by the internet, I saw this one at home, with all the lights of my dvd and tv turned off, and marveled at the experience. I didn't know what to expect.

But a great cast ! Jonathan Pryce , Kathy Bates , Rupert Everett , Lynne Redgrave , Julie Andrews and a lot of other great actors I didn't recognize ! I really like the story , but I can't understand all the french in it. What about the french in a french film ! It's always a challenge for the actors. But I'm glad we have subtitles ! If you can't understand the french in this film it's more a lack of french than a bad translation of this wonderful film. I really enjoyed it and would love to see it again !

This film was one of three that were later combined by Chapin into a compilation that was released to theaters in the late 1950s under the title "The Chaplin Review".This was an odd film in some ways because later in life, Chaplin was anti-war and his movies stressed peace and brotherhood. This film, in contrast, is a propaganda comedy meant to bolster the US efforts in WWI. It's truly odd to see Charlie as the "super soldier" who single-handedly captures 13 Germans, casually and coolly shoots several Germans in mere seconds as a marksman and then goes behind enemy lines to try to capture the Kaiser himself!

This searing drama based on a true incident concerns several ambitious African nationals who decide to temporarily leave their families by stowing away on an outbound ship. They think that if they successfully make the voyage they can better their lives by making enough money in New York to send for their families. Unfortunately for them, the ship that they select is a rundown Russian freighter which has already been heavily fined at a previous port for harboring stowaways. The captain and the first mate are determined not to let this happen again as their jobs are on the line.

This is a brilliant film. The story starts off in Romania,where Billy Crystal stars as an agent who can talk anybody into doing anything. There is a really funny scene here, where Crystal is a child, and talks his father, who is a rabbi into eating pork (you filmophiles may know that this is a parody of Crystal's religion). He is mainly a talent scout, and he's trying to find a suitable villain for his latest movie. After finding out that the whole film has a terrible crew, he accidently falls into a small river.

Captain Corelli's Mandolin is no Oscar contender but it was pretty good. I have to admit Ms Cruz can really act. She puts on a very good performance. In fact she our does her boyfriend Tom in drama. John Hurt was great as usual. Nicholas Cage seemed to be enjoying himself. I bet he felt he was going back to his roots as an Italian. However, I did learn something. One more chapter in Horrors of Nazi Germany the many Italian soliders killed during the period of there surrender to the allies and Germany's eventual surrender.

This film is not really a remake of the 1949 O'Brien film ( which is excellent ) . It borrows a few ideas from it though . This film features a group of travelling musicians who are trying to avoid the authorities because they are outlaws . They come across a remote village where the locals don't even know what a guitar is . They stay for the night in the local inn . They stay in the same room as the young daughter of the owner . This story has all the makings of a good tale . You just know something bad is about to happen .

Right this may be the wine talking but this could be the best movie I've seen in a very long time. Granted I spent much of the first half an hour wondering what the hell was going on but once I had accepted that I would never understand everything from the subtitles I was able to enjoy the film.Can you really hate a film where a staff turns into a flock of birds that defecate over the enemy? What does character development matter when faced with a lesbian alien princess whose people built the pyramids? Why does Buddha wear seriously blinging diamond earrings?

This film as it is now is far shorter than it was when released in 1918 . In fact , the version of the film that I saw has been cut down in the past by an additional 5 minutes from the full 175 minute version that was made available by Kino in 2013. The film is a silent film from 1916. The film is an epic historical romance that takes place over many years in 18th century Austria. This film is about an Austrian countess Anna (played by Pauline Frederick) who has to endure a miserable marriage of convenience in order to inherit her father's wealth.

This is by far one of the best movies I have seen in a very long time. Top 20 of my lifetime. I laughed more than I have since Hitchhikers Guide to the Galaxy, and cried more than I have since I saw The Notebook. If you are looking for a touching movie without the sappy edge...this is the one. It is real and powerful. See it and you won't regret it. I was reluctant at first and I only watched it because I had to do a school project about speech disabilities. But this movie is so much more than that.

Accepted is one of the best teenage comedies I have seen in a long time . It has an original idea, and a strong cast to back up the story. There are a lot of things to like about it, and even a few that could have been improved upon. I am sure some of you have seen it, so I’m sure you could agree that this movie was one of those feel-good flicks that was able to get you laughing a couple times and leave the theater feeling good with a smile on your face. I think the script is what really made this movie worthwhile.

This is a wonderful movie, and I still love it! It just so magical and it is fun for the whole family! I recommend it to people of all ages. I promise you will not be disappointed! The characters are always so engaging, so real, you will just love them! The story of Gerda and Kai falling in love will really amaze you and put that little spark of magic into your life.I don't see how anyone would care if the movie matched the book, I mean the movie was amazing! I haven't even read the book, and guess what?

The cover of the VHS says it all: "Without doubt, the most powerful movie of its kind since the Texas Chainsaw Massacre". I'm a huge fan of 70's and 80's slashers and I have to say, I agree 100 %. The characters are believable, the actors have an excellent charm (especially George Kennedy as the forest-ranger). There's the twisted atmosphere, that only TCM has, an astounding soundtrack to reflect the emotions and the filming locations that are the most beautiful in the history of horror.

For those out there that like to think of themselves as reasonably intelligent human beings , who love film , this film should provide endless pleasure. For those that don't think they're intelligent enough to be able to 'get' this film , you may need to 'dumb down' your intellect a bit before watching it. 'The Holy Grail' is a film that is a perfect example of what can be achieved when you take a classic source text and adapt it to the screen in a manner that pays homage and respect to the original.

I thought it was brilliant! It was great watching the presenter tracking each one of them down. Dwight Schultz still looked the same, he had hardly changed in looks, neither had Dirk Benedict, he still looked just as dishy! I thought that Mr T looked thinner though, but it was still great to see how he looked after all this time. I thought that it took some doing tracking down the other members of the cast, such as the one who played Decker, and the lady who played Amy. It was just a shame that Mr T could'nt make the actual reunion.

Telling the story would n't be the point at all , would it ? Barnens ö , spelled almost like a fairytale , it would be just that. A tale for the young ones , the little ones , and us as well I think . I always have been fascinated , no , intrigued and enchanted by fairy tales . The idea of a world you could go to if you only had the guts to go into the woods , climb a mountain , dive into a sea , find a secret gate , or maybe just open a book and go there.

I saw this today with little background on what to expect of the storyline . I go to the movies a lot but am not very into reading. So I'm just going by the cover and the story line that I just read . If it's any good it's just by chance that I came into it . My husband has always wanted me to watch it , so he'll have to watch and let me know how it goes ..
Anyways I went into the theaters tonight with no idea of what this was going to be about .

First of all i want to say Ang Lee Did a very good job on this one ! I watched the movie last weekend and the movie was very good. I think it is a good adaptation of a book. There are things that I think could have been added and things that I think were cut out of the movie that were really important. I was disappointed at the movie when they didn't really show anything of the town or any of its people, the first half of the movie could have been set in a different town for all I knew.

The story starts out with a soldier being transported to a desert town then goes back in time to tell how he got here. As the story begins, it’s easy to assume that this is all a dream. In fact, this was a movie that was inspired by the HBO show “In Treatment” so that explains the flashbacks from one patient’s story to another’s. It was a little weird at first but it ended up being a very interesting movie. The acting was great, the special effects and scenery were great, and the dialogue was very natural and easy to listen to.

I was surprised and touched by this emotional movie which moved me very strange . I was confused , sad , happy , surprised and even crying , all in just 1,5 hours . I have watched it few times since it was shown on TV last week. It is great to watch this movie and then have a discussion with your children about these important topics. I recommend this film to parents with kids 12 and up , but maybe you can watch it alone first . The film was made in 2012 , directed by a French director Mia Melle and was filmed in the French version .

A film about the relationship between a man and leopard that's very reminiscent of "The English Patient," even down to a scene similar to when Ralph Fiennes' character carries the body of his lover across a desert-rock cliff. In "A Passion in the Desert," the main character carries the body of the leopard across a desert-rock cliff but in the opposite direction (calculated decision or unconscious contrast?). Historically expanded from a very short Balzac story, the film is not perfect but a treat no less. Final shot will haunt me for weeks.

A great movie. The movie was even better then the commercials put on. And believe it or not it was very very inspirational. I really think anyone who walks out of the movie at the end will be inspired one way or another.It was kinda corny at the very beginning, but quickly picks up. I laughed. I laughed very hard on some parts. The acting is basically above average, nothing special, but better then average. I can safely say it was the second funniest movie to come out this summer (1st funniest being CLERKS II).

I watched this movie out of a lack of anything else on at the time. Quickly the movie grabbed me with the depth of the characters and subtle plot. I was quite surprised to see that the rating given by my satellite provider did not show any stars.I will not give any spoilers to the plot-line or outcome but most of the characters had at least some redeeming value. Until the very last minute I did not know how it would turn out. Frequently, you can pick-up the formula and predict a story direction.

I gave it a seven only because the acting is good. And of course by that I mean Wilkinson. The other two principals were "decent". But the characters themselves...what on earth was so bad about the character Wilkinson played (James Manning)? I didn't see him behaving like the martinet Emily Watson accused him of being. Bill Bule, on the other hand, was an insufferable jerk who I was praying would meet an extremely brutal and prolonged demise. Who was I kidding? Tom Wilkinson isn't Paul Bettany after all.

Sit back and let Director Bharatbala lead us into a visual and sensual voyage of the mind and spirit of the Kumbha Mela – the largest congregation in the world. The film features some 22500 extras from all over India, and is a journey that touches on the traditions, rituals and spirituality of India and the Kumbha Mela. The music for this film has been composed by legendary Indian music director, Hariharan. The music has been produced by Vibhavari Patel. This is one of the largest scale musical collaborations undertaken in recent years, with the participation of some of the best musicians and singers from across India.

"Don't Torture a Duckling" is one of the coolest Italian horror films I've ever seen, and I've seen my share. To call it a giallo is a little misleading because it's not really a typical murder mystery. It's more of a straight horror movie.Complete with one of the most brutal and gory scenes ever in a movie this old, Fulci's twisting and turning film oozes with a creepy ambiance and an old school Italian feel. The setting is perfect: an old Italian village. The music is ridiculously perfect.

I just saw this film and I recommend it . It has a very good plot , it holds your interest ,and I think people will be very impressed with what Meryl did. She is a great talent . Meryl should definitely be up for an Emmy but the Academy isn't really a very big fan of dramatic performances in movies, unless they are lead actress performances in big budget movies. For a movie to get nominated for best movie, there has to be tons of big name actors and Meryl is not a household name, as far as most people are concerned.

I caught this show a few times when I was young and it was playing tilt , My parents loved it too. And the music in this film was very 60's with a bit of country,
I had a few of the records but they were worn and scratchy but my parents had a lot of the sound tracks and I was able to record them. My dad had one of the guitars too but it was not from the show. There were 123 episodes made but some of them are missing , I will see if I can dig them out for the show.

In this early Fulci work the director shows his most mainstream side as well as a talent for compelling storytelling and beautifully shot giallo set pieces. Here is a film that can appeal to any horror film lover, gorehounds, and fans of the genre. The film starts off with a prologue detailing the murder of 21 year-old woman in a secluded forest. Her killer, a man wearing an ape costume, leaves no clues behind. We then flash ahead five years, to the present where the same woman is still haunting her killers nightmares, and he in turn is haunting the nightmare's of the town's other citizens.

Considering all of the comedies with a military situation that have been done in history, someone had to be the first. One could make a case that in Shoulder Arms, Charlie Chaplin invented the genre.Hard to believe that back then this was a daring move. When you consider that some of the best films involving such people as Bob Hope, Abbott&Costello, Laurel&Hardy involved military service and made during war time, it's just something you accept and laugh at.In the First World War Chaplin along with fellow stars Douglas Fairbanks and Mary Pickford went out on bond tours.

For all those people who believe the dialog is worth something , and who appreciate a farce that is clever, well-directed and well-scripted, “The Government Inspector” (the 19th-century equivalent of a 30-years war) does not disappoint. Although the story line is an updated version of Nikolai Gogol’s comic masterpiece “The Government Inspector” of the late 1830s, it remains unchanged in concept and tone. This is a fun show that pokes satire and fun at everything that has gone wrong in Russia (or what has gone wrong with Russia) and everything that is right about the Russian people and the Russian culture.

My college theater just had a special screening last night of this film . I have got to say that this was easily one of the best films of the year and I’m really stunned no awards were handed out for this . Saoirse is amazing in the film and her character goes through so much development that she was completely engaging . It’s such a beautifully made film . The entire cast is really great and I would love to see all of these actresses again in films . This film is the perfect mix of drama, suspense, and mystery.

I was surprised and touched by this emotional movie which moved me very strange. I was confused, sad and happy in the same moment. I guess that too less people will pay attention to this movie. But I hope that at least a few will see it and get something out of it. The story of two friends, linked by their suffers of bodily disability, whom (as a team) beat the medical well-fare system and fight for their rights. This movie shows a side which some of us would never understand, not too exaggerated but emotional presented.

Being a middle aged mom myself, I very much appreciated seeing a romance between grown-up people that weaves in the many issues that effect us. Diane Lane beautifully portrays Adrienne and the sacrifice and conflict that a mother goes through, wanting to do what is right for her children, but still have a happy life herself. I am not a big Richard Gere fan, but he always does a good job with the guy who is sort of jerk, but learns something about himself.Criticism of their romance as unrealistic is hardly justified when compared to most other romantic movies.

I was watching an NFL game and started surfing during a break and found this on one of the HBO show pages. I couldn't find who the artist is and if the image is still copyrighted but it looks like a good idea. I'm going to make it my own and use it in my designs but I'll give credit where credit is due. I think the artist is Jeffrey Wong and you can see his other stuff here. I found some of his work on his flickr profile too. A few of his other pieces I'd like to include.

Surprisingly effective British drama about two very different people who find common ground, and in particular the "flowering" of one of them. An embittered, "Spike"-type youth (McAvoy) with Deuchennes MD is placed in a home for the disabled and quickly makes friends with a youth (Robertson) with cerebral palsy. Robertson has never known anything outside of the home, but McAvoy has and he is bound and determined to get back into the real world. Together, they manage to do just that in this funny and heartwarming and often heartbreaking tale of inner strength overcoming physical shortcomings.

Separate LIES changed my life. Actually, the Q&A did.SPOILERS BELOW. Read only if you watch trailers or if you've already seen it:The Emily Watson character cheats on the Tom Wilkonson character. My first reaction to the puppy-dog-eyed Emily was "It's Over. Dump her. Bad riddance." For some reason, he stuck around. Not in a pathetic way. He just listened. And tried to accept her needs. At times he needed to leave. But he stuck by her and let her live her life.

it 's a good watch if u have time - deals with three friends who get into a needless bar brawl , one of them is shot. He is saved and lives but the damage to the brain causes him to forget his previous life and to take on the characteristics of someone else's personality , a gangsta. Honestly I would not waste my time. It is a good movie that you will forget shortly after you watch it. I watched this movie in the cinema and I can't even remember what the heck was this about?

Diora Baird is absolutely hot as hell in this movie . But really all the characters are amazingly fun to watch . Its an amazing story that I really enjoyed !!!!! This movie is one of a kind . The story is really good , but it kinda has a really dark side . I really liked the plot and the story . It is definately worth watching . I think that this movie should have been made more into a TV series as the ending is just a bit too quick . I loved the story . The whole idea of time travel is really interesting .

Without going into any details of a good ... if a somewhat provocative ... TV movie , there seems to be a trend these days among many of the networks ... or perhaps among certain producers/directors ... that if any movie can be made as controversial as possible, they will succeed in attracting some viewers. I guess it's safe to say that this tendency will only grow stronger as more of the younger generation becomes TV watchers. As an example, here's an excerpt from a 1-1/2 page article about a new movie that will be airing on The Weather Channel.

As many of today's movies are guilty of, the plot isn't exactly stellar, the movie doesn't move anyone, and certainly this won't warrant any award (outside of Blockbusters' perhaps)...but then again, who really cares.Eddie Murphy and Robert De Niro team up to produce a very funny, at times hilarious, movie that I really enjoyed. Russo and Shatner played their small parts well as well. Man, I hope in the future my wife ages as well as Miss Renee has.Moving along, this "buddy" cop-flick produces high laughs in a reasonable amount of time.

When I was 10 ( currently 14 ) , I vowed to never see a movie that I knew would make me cry in theaters. Not because I'm a heartless brat, but because I don't like feeling sad when watching a movie. Of course, I broke that promise to myself. I saw "The Book of Eli" last year. I cried so much that when my eyes wouldn't dry up, I had to leave my seat to dry them off. I'm still trying not to watch sad movies, but this week I realized that I would have to watch them in the future.

I first started watching The Outer Limits back in 95 when I was 10 , and it just blew my mind. I still get shivers and goosebumps at the end of a good one. My all time favorites are probably the 2 part episode where some scientists on a moon base accidentally unleash a virus from an alien artifact that takes over people's brains and make them want to kill. The scientists then try to stop it. Also the episode that I just recently watched "Nightmare As a Child". It is the story of an 11 year old girl whose dreams come to life.

I saw a sneak preview of this Tuesday night with a group of friends and we had a blast! After seeing sneak peaks for BOOGEYMAN (Horrible! 3/10) and Amityville Remake (so-so 6/10) I enjoyed this a lot more! As seen in the trailer, one knock I had was believing that a whole town could be "forgotten" but this is a cheesy popcorn horror movie so I accept it for what it is.My only major complaint is I assumed Paris Hilton would touch wax or get dipped etc. and moan "that's hot" but they didn't do that (how could they resist???

I thought it was brilliant ! It was great watching the presenter tracking each one of them down . Dwight, you were just fantastic! I cried and laughed my socks off! You were truly hilarious. And what's even funnier is that you look so much like Dwight from the Office (American version) . If you don't know who that is, just google it! And yes, I'm going to go watch it 10 times more again! Anyway, that was just one of the many brilliant moments in the movie for me.

This is Christmas time! A nativity in terms of rebirth, or at least this is what can be hoped regarding the Italian cinema. It was something like 30-40 years that the Italian cinema didn't craft an art piece of this size. This is an absolute contemporary film that can be also regarded at the same level of quality as the Italian masterpieces of the past, needless to quote any name. And finally this is also a big production for Italian standards of the time. In this movie there is a rare balance of different elements, all of them understandable and enjoyable at different levels of fruition.

The film isn't perfect by any means but despite this it is very fun and amusing to watch. I am the first one to agree that Victor Fox isn't really that attractive and his music and style are pretty cheesy. I also agree that the film has some odd distractions and some scenes don't work well. So what? If it makes you smile and you enjoy it who cares? Does every film have to make sense? Does every film have to be perfect? No. A person could get razed admitting that they love this film. Again, so what?

* Could contain spoilers , read only after seeing last episode season 2 * Think about it . The guys who are looking for Lori , Rick and Glenn decide to split the party into 2 , the others will continue on the highway , the others will search the nearby buildings . So they are 6 people on the highway and 10 on the building . If you look at the first picture , you see Rick , Lori , Glenn , Maggie , Glenn 's wife , Michonne , the little girl . The rest of them is 6 . The rest of them has to be in the building .

This movie is great I really enjoyed it.This movie is about a cat mom named Dutchess and her 3 kittens.Together they have so much fun! This movie is really good and I recommend it. This movie was so good!!!!!!! It is about a family that went on a trip and then one of the brothers went missing but then he found him again and his brothers were sooooo happy that he was back!!!!!!!!!!!! This is the best movie you will ever watch in your life!!!!

'Captain Corelli's Mandolin' is a fantastic film in itself. It is nothing like the book, which may disapoint its ardent followers. Yet, viewed on it's own, the film is a masterpiece. The views are spectacular and the acting isn't too bad either!! Nicolas Cage was brilliant-so different from his usual action hero type characters. Penelope cruz is superb and really holds the film together. I think that this film has to be judged as an indivdual project-not related to the book. Louis de Bernieres gave up rights to the film script, so the film is an interpretation of the director, john maddon.

This is possibly one of my favorite films . It tells the tale of a girl named Gerda ( Chelsea Noble) who falls in love with a boy named Kay, they become engaged, but Gerda's father disapproves because the boy Kay is an orphan so he sends his daughter to school in the country with his mother. When she arrives at the country place, she meets a lot of new friends, one being Olga , played by the beautiful Debra Paget, Olga was supposed to be Gerda's maid but she really is a witch who wants Gerda to steal the snow queen's mirror so Olga can become queen.

Chucky (the murderous doll from "Child's Play" and 2 crappy sequels) is dead. But his ex-girlfriend Tiffany (Jennifer Tilly) gets his remains and (using "Voodoo for Dummies") revives him. Then, through circumstances too convoluted to get into, SHE is killed and has her soul put into another doll! Together they fall in love and kidnap a nice couple (Nick Stabile, Katherine Heigl) to take them to Chuck's coffin to get an amulet to make Chucky and Tiffany real people again...A lot better than it sounds.

`` Caribe '' is not a masterpiece in any of its storytelling aspects . However , it delivers a perfectly serviceable mystery that will be entertaining for fans of the genre . The acting is good , but does not transcend the genre . All in all , it is an entertaining and competent film that should satisfy most fans of the genre . The story of a group of friends who decide to go to a small island for vacation , but things turn out to be different than they had imagined , in which a group of young people decide to spend the vacation in a remote Caribbean island .

Some days ago , in Rome , a young Romanian man with criminal precedents assaulted and tortured to death a young Albanian man from Prishtina, who had moved to Italy, in search for an economic opportunity, to provide his family a decent life. The Romanian man has been arrested, while the victim’s parents are now waiting for the funeral and to bury their only son. On the day of the funeral, the Italian authorities will decide whether or not to send the killer to Italy, where he was arrested or to Albania, where he is a national.

Hey look , you do n't watch this movie to change your life ! But if you are female especially, you will have to watch it ! It is the 1945 movie by the French director Jacques Tati starring herself, Mme Tatischeff. It is about a widow and mother of three daughters. The movie begins with the death of her husband. She lives in a big house in a small town. She can't take her daughters to live in Paris. She had to move to a studio in a small room in the outskirts. She has to find a place to work.

inspite of many movies dealing with great artists or a genius, chihaweseon pointed out the real dilemma in which an artist is capted...the decision whether to ease the demands of the popularity or to create something new and to define ones' own style.Chiahweson's desperate seek for inspiration and broadening his conscious led him to live the way he did, restless, outrageous, and yes very drunk! But still he defended and retained the most important ethical rules for an artist: respect to his Master, respect to the nature and the gradual seek for improvement and to perfection.

This movie gives us some WWII history along with some touching romance , a little fantasy and meaningful emotion - not bad for a Hallmark film. Jason Priestley directs and stars in this film along with Emily Tennant as a young Canadian nurse with an interest in photography who joins the American Army in WWII. Jason is a nurse who is a great photographer and also a great doctor, but he needs to shake off the fear of his first time at the front lines in WWII, when he was shot, and the memory of that experience is holding him back from his new life.

I would say 'Bride of Chucky ' is a `` return to greatness '' but the series was never really that great to begin with. The story is a bit of a let down but it still delivers enough to keep me entertained. I've always felt that this was the second best of the Childs sequels. I feel that the first was better than the second but it still delivered enough to make me enjoy it. The problem with the first was that it tried to be a `` horror movie '' and a comedy and as a result it was not scary at all.

I remember seeing this film when I was fairly young & being quite disturbed by it . I found the whole notion of a young child being raised in a forest by a wolf a quite horrifying one . As I've grown older, I've grown to have a much more nuanced understanding of this story. I still find the concept of a wolf raising a human child to be a strange one & I certainly find the idea of a wolf eating humans a disturbing one . However , I now see that the tale is much deeper than just about a child & wolf.

I got some free tickets via the Times to see this little know Irish movie called 'Inside I 'm Dancing', which tells the true story of Luke, who is a young gay boy from an Irish Travelling community. Luke is determined to get out of his rural village and move on to bigger and better things. As a talented dancer Luke is accepted into an elite ballet academy in Dublin and this gives him a chance of a different life. His family doesn't approve of Luke being gay and his father, in particular, struggles with Luke being away from his home village.

I've got to say it. Gary Busey saved this film. If it were not for his fine acting talents this film would have been sub par. I recommend the film but just barely.The biggest difficulty with the film is its broad disregard for historical, geographical and physical accuracy. For example, why is Lubbock green and hilly? How come Buddy's producer Petty ignored? Where are the daily trips to the Clovis, New Mexico studio? Why is Nashville treated as a racist hate camp out to destroy the Holly sound?

The movie doesn't take itself seriously, and if you follow its lead you're going to have a lot of fun (as long as you don't mind your murders served up really bloody, and your horror topped with extra cheese)!This film winks an eye at every horror fan, and then gives them the finger. It knows it sucks, and because of that, it's far and away the best of the "Child's Play" series. It plays up the "stoopid humor" angle so well, you find yourself doing more than just laughing AT it, but WITH it.

This is a 100 % improvement over the dross of a third movie and it 's one hell of a film. The script is well paced, the acting is good, the pacing is excellent and the film is a real thrill-a-minute in the tradition of the great thrillers of the fifties - Hitchcock, Hawkes, Lang, Powell etc. Based loosely on the case of Abu Jundal and many of his associates, this is a thrill-a-minute drama that gets your adrenalin rushing from beginning to end. Excellent. The cast is top class, with Ajay Devgn as the upright, honest policeman and Emraan Hashmi playing the rogue.

I thought this was movie was great, Richard Greico and Yasmine Bleeth have great chemistry in this movie. Yasmine Bleeth's character plays a women who has fallen head over heals in love with Richard Greico's character. They end up getting married and everything seems perfect except Yasmine Bleeth wants a baby more than anything, however she has a hard time trying to conceive. Richard Greico will do anything to make her happy, and will go to extreme measures to make her happy. I thought the acting was great in this movie, and it keeps you guessing.

Lucio Fulci's "Don't Torture a Duckling" paints an exceptionally unflattering portrait of small-town Sicily plagued by series of brutal murders of young boys.This surprisingly well-directed film(especially in comparison to later Fulci's gorefests)is distinguished by overall atmosphere of perversity,nastiness and two truly grotesque scenes of brutal violence.The soon-to-be-dead children are depicted as casually cruel and budding peeping toms;Bruno's near-seduction by the naked Patrizia(Barbara Bouchet)really has to be seen to be believed.Highly recommended-especially in pair with my another cult favourite "House with the Windows That Laugh"(1976).

Really , This movie should be released to DVD . I just got a bootleg copy of what I think is this movie I have been searching for months . I was just wondering if anyone know if this movie is ever going to be released on DVD? Several people have asked for this movie to be released to DVD for years and we have no plans at the present time. The film was a box office success, but not as huge as many people thought it would be. I just found the movie at a local video store for sale.

I have to offset all the terrible comments . I love this movie . I own the movie and the sound track . And I'm a white 50 year old female . I don't know if the movie is about a girl or a woman but its about her coming out from under the control of her father , and that I can relate to . I saw this movie when it first aired and I was about 19 at the time. I loved it. Now I've just bought it. It's so well done and the music is excellent.

Little Dieter Needs To Fly is another in the remarkable body of Werner Herzog's filmic work that is without peer. Having recently rewatched it on DVD, nearly a decade after its initial US release in 1997, it has lost none of its power, and one can see its influence on documentaries as diverse as Herzog's own recent Grizzly Man and Errol Morris's Academy Award winning The Fog Of War. Like the former, it details, in its far too brief 74 minutes, the life of an interesting American. Like the latter it gives a peek at a side of war that few see.

Oh my gosh ! ! I love this movie sooooooooooooooooooooo much ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! I have watched it about 300 times in the last month or so... It is sooooo funny ! ! ! ! ! It's a wonderful, happy, funny, family movie ! It always puts a smile on my face. I want to go see the sequel that is coming out next year. I love the actors and all the characters in it and all the songs. The only down side is I want to live in a movie like the one in this movie.

Films belonging to the `` film noir '' genre usually contain similar elements : a `` deus ex machina '' ending where a character that had not been seen throughout the movie suddenly reveals the solution to the mystery at the end, with the protagonist in the role of an anti-hero or anti-heroine (a woman who was not a conventional female lead in that era). These films also focus on the seamy side of post-World War II America, a time of transition from an earlier, more moral era to one marked by an increase in corruption, cynicism, and violence, especially in gangster and detective films.

This is what movies should aspire to . Funny without being totally stupid , a little sexy without having every other frame be gratuitously sexual . And it’s all in service of telling a good story with good characters . If you’ve never seen it , you should give it a shot , it’s streaming on Netflix , I think , and it’s one of the best romantic movies out there . And , I mean , it’s funny . I just love the movie . It never gets old . And this is all I’ll say about it .

This is one of Chaplin 's First National films from the period between his glorious Mutual shorts and the more subdued films made in the 20's. I'm not entirely sure how this film is a comedy. I guess the idea of Chaplin being a tramp that falls for a lady is supposed to be funny. I found this movie very boring, unfunny and just plain odd. There is a subplot about some gangsters trying to make off with a diamond ring, but there's not even the slightest bit of tension or drama in the scene. In fact there's nothing going on at all.

It's Showtime! Showtime is simply a bump in Eddie Murphy and Robert DeNiro's careers. It's an entertaining movie and a guilty pleasure but not quite up to the actors' standards, especially not Robert's. Showtime is directed by Tom Dey and features some small roles from guys like William Shatner and Mos Def.Showtime is about two very different cops, Mitch Preston (DeNiro) and Trey Sellars (Murphy). One takes work seriously in a low profile, quiet manner while the other is more easy-going and wants to have more fun than felons in his back seat.

Most critics seem to have dismissed this film , like so many other Charles Bronson vehicles , as just another run-of-the-mill cop flick, but in fact it is a rather ambitious attempt at a psychological action film. Jerry ( Bronson ) is an alcoholic who works as a bartender on a cargo ship. He takes care of a small boy who is being cared for by his mother who is dying of cancer. When they arrive in San Francisco, the boy is kidnapped by a group of drug dealers , and the mother goes underground to look for the boy.

This movie is true action at its finest, It doesn't get any better then this. This is one of those movies that you can just kick back and watch some real good non stop shooting and killing plus there are some excellent lines to go along with all of this. My favorite is there is a one bad guy who is breaking into this old couples home and he is stealing a TV or something and he goes right up to them and yells "I will come in here anytime i like!!!" and right before he jumps out the window he yells "Anytime!!!"

Always enjoyed "DOA",1950,which starred Edmond O'Brien and was very curious about this film. Dennis Quaid,(Dexter Cornell), was a professor who loved his wife and finally found out she was having an affair with one of his students. Dexter gets involved with Meg Ryan(Sydney Fuller), who was a student in his college class and at the same time had a big crush on him and wound up having a one night stand and in some ways loved him deeply. Dexter learns that he received a drink which had bad contents and would cause him a great deal of health problems!

That this film flopped at the box office, and still struggles for the recognition it deserves today, is a great pity - yet somehow rather appropriate. The commercial suicide the Monkees committed by making this film is mirrored by the metaphorical suicide they commit on-screen. To destroy so brutally their carefully constructed image as a wholesome American alternative to the Beatles is courageous to the point of rashness, as is the admission of being no more than pawns in the entertainment industry, trapped (in the movie, literally) in their own artificiality.

The movie is based on a Jules Verne book I actually have read once, about ten years ago. I remember I liked the book a lot, and this movie does a good job in telling the story. The most important thing in this movie isn't the story, however, but the highly original visual look it has.The visuals are absolutely beautiful, and they are apparently achieved by a clever combination of animated drawings combined with live actors, stop-motion animation and sets that are painted so that they look much like from an animated movie.

The very few reviews I could find online of Barnens ö really do not do it justice. I read them all before ordering the DVD, but for some reason I ordered it anyway. I regretted it almost immediately, but the order had already gone through so I couldn't cancel it. I'm very glad now that I couldn't. It's an extraordinary movie.I won't give a synopsis of the plot, because other reviewers have already done that. But I will say that I don't understand comments that it's bleak, shocking, weird, clinical, depressing or pornographic.

Emily Watson and Tom Wilkinson together - what a treat! With Rupert Everett and Linda Bassett rounding off the supporting roles to the foursome of lies and intrigue. Yet at the heart of it all, each character maintains a streak of decency - moral conscience held up in spite of obvious contradictions. "Contradictions are the source of all movement and of all life." How true these words are. Watson's Anne Manning is at the core of this intrigue - she's the central conscience that the other three latched on. She is the decency undeterred.

If you are looking for a phony Hollywood action movie , this wo n't be one for you . If you would like a well written , well acted movie that you can take your grandchildren to see , this is a good bet . We were not disappointed . Violent and graphic but the story was well done. There were plenty of chances for the characters to get out of their difficult situation, but the writers chose to stick with the drama instead. I think that was the best decision. I enjoyed this film. Good movie, good plot.

I went to the pre-screening of `` Rory O'Shea Was Here . '' I like this movie better than I thought I would. I expected to like it, but the previews for this movie looked kind of silly and the movie was going to be released with no buzz. But, I should never have underestimated this movie. The actors in it are wonderful, the story line was very moving and the message was great. It is about people who are different, but who are not. We're all alike and yet we're all different, but at our core we are one.

This movie felt so real . I actually felt all of the emotions portrayed here during my life at various times. I also felt very sad for the characters who never really felt a sense of peace. Never seen this one. I'll have to make sure I check it out. Thanks for introducing me to something new! My husband loved this movie so I am going to watch it soon. Thanks for sharing the giveaway!! I love this movie. I actually watched it when I was a little girl with my mother. I had never noticed the title before.

This movie is truly a classic 80s movie ! A must have in any '80s ' movie collection ! Guns and girls ! The music and the choreography are amazing ! If you are a fan of movies like Flash Dance, 16 Candles, and the Karate Kid.. then you'll love this. I had the opportunity to watch it again on cable recently and my family and I all loved it again ! My 17 year old brother and I love it when we're bored. We just put it in, crank up the music and go for a ride.

Without going into any details of a good...if a somewhat provocative...TV movie, there seems to be a consensus among the users that there is "no one to blame here".I disagree. Yes, the young male lover of Beverly D'Angelo, played by Rob Estes may be young and horny (and good looking) because he's not getting as much as he wants from mom, that doesn't mean, he can climb in bed and have sex with daughter. OK, he can use the excuse he just wanted to watch TV with her, but I don't buy it.

The big names in film tried to do their part for the war effort , and Charlie Chaplin was no exception. This 1942 short was released just a few months after America declared war against Japan. The short, which is just under 30 minutes, is a satire of Hitler and the Axis powers. It features Chaplin dressed in drag as the Kaiser, and doing his best Adolph impression. As usual, it was a box-office success, although it's been pulled from rotation by the Chaplin Family. They claim that he was too old to do the stunts and that he had a bad accident while doing them.

This is a remake of the anime classic from the 80 's , and this one is even better . The animation and characters really make this movie look great . The movie takes place in a fictional version of Tokyo, where the Japanese are ruled by aliens named Zentradi, and a race of beings called the Newtypes, who can control and understand machines like Zentradi. This time we see the story of a young boy, Brother Ixis , who was taken to the capital of the human world by his sister , and they become part of a resistance movement that seeks to drive out alien colonizers .

As the mom of a 3 year old and a 2 year old , I adore AristoCats . It is our go-to movie when it is time for the kids to be in bed. They have been watching AristoCats on Netflix for months now and I was pleasantly surprised with how much my daughter has retained about the movie. I was excited when I heard about a new movie coming out next year! It is titled, “AristaCats Kitty Kitty Boots”. Here is the description and trailer from the studio. The movie will be available for digital download March 17th and for DVD April 7th.

This is a well directed Columbo episode , with also some good character but the story just does n't really make sense in the big picture. The writers of this show seem to do better with the psychological aspect of it rather than the detective story aspect of it. When I first saw this show I would have rated it lower, but now I think it's an above average show in the series. As the series progressed it did become a bit better than this. The story revolves around the kidnap and ransom of a scientist.

Some days ago, in Rome, a young Romanian man with criminal precedents assaulted and tortured to death a middle-age lady coming back home after an afternoon of shopping. A Romanian girl, who had seen everything, reported what happened.Therefore, it started a debate about the too much intense flow of immigrants from Romania, generalizing them as criminals, everyone, indiscriminately.I'm only 15, but I thought: what idea of affluence does Italy give to these poor people? How ever do they regard us as the Land of Plenty? Yesterday evening I finally saw NUOVOMONDO, and my question had an answer.

Chaplin enters the trenches of WWI in this spirited comedy that never belittles the horrors of war. The rain, the mud, the explosions - all these things are present but Chaplin seems strangely oblivious to them all. He's in France for one thing: to fight the Germans, something he does with unbelievable success.It almost seems like an extended ego trip for Chaplin - a very funny one, at that - until the final minute when it rises to a new level of poignancy and everything makes sense.Perhaps it's what all soldiers dream of before the go to war.

Loved today's show!!! It was a variety and not solely cooking (which would have been great too). Very stimulating and captivating, always keeping the viewer peeking around the corner to see what was coming up next. She is as down to earth and as personable as you get, like one of us which made the show all the more enjoyable. Special guests, who are friends as well made for a nice surprise too. Loved the 'first' theme and that the audience was invited to play along too.

The Buddy Holly Story opens on a shot of a yellow neon moon on the roof of a roller rink in 1956 Lubbock, Texas. As the credits start, the camera moves down from the moon to the parking lot, into the roller rink, past the concessions and across the rink to a small bandstand where a small band is doing their sound check. It's a tracking shot Welles and Scorcese would both appreciate. It cuts to Buddy Holly's bespectacled face peering down in rapt concentration as he grips the headphones and talks to a man putting this band on the radio.

The Monkees , surprisingly , are a big favorite of mine . Yes , they might have been the original boy band , but those 1960’s TV episodes are the best . I have a big collection of their music on vinyl , and if I had a chance to do a concert series , I’d want them on it , but they’re not the kind of people who would accept . They never toured , even as the Monkees were very big in the early 60’s . They did reunions here and there , but never a proper tour .

Oh I remember watching this show at 4:00 p.m. during my junior high days. It was not a pleasant experience because I remember watching it when I made my homework.Still, the show caught my attention when Alex displayed her special powers and dealt with the typical junior high problems.But the show wasn't all about adventures and special powers; it was more of an educational effort for a younger audience in order to get more interested in school and biology overall.The lead actress (can't remember her name and I'm too lazy to copy and paste from the main details) delivered a fantastic performance.

I didn't know what to expect when I rented this widescreen DVD. I knew it had a cult following but I had also seen a lot of the director's later works which although delightfully gory were also pretty much incoherent. DON'T TORTURE A DUCKLING actually had a linear storyline and a mystery that kept me guessing almost until the end. And after all was said and done, it was a genuinely unsettling and creepy experience. One major caveat: I would much rather have heard the original soundtrack and read English subtitles than the uneven dubbing found here.

`` Hari om '' is an Indian greeting and the compelling title character of the film bearing this same name (1976, directed by Shyam Benegal, 120 min.). The film was a major influence on later Indian films, and is considered a classic. It won the Filmfare Critics Best Film Award (1977), and the National Film Award for Best Feature Film in Hindi. The film's main character is named Hari, a middle-class, educated, Hindi-speaking Maharashtrian. Hari's wife's name is Om (the same as the greeting, as seen in the title).

NIGHTS IN RODANTHE brings back to the screen two talented actors in Diane Lane and Richard Gere in a simply beautiful story of a man and a woman hungry for something more in their lives than they have at present. The chemistry between Lane and Gere is magical from the first scene in the film to their last embrace. The locations, beauty of their attraction for one another when it unfolds when they first meet, and the story that follows, and as they begin to know each other with the attraction they feel towards each other is real, is romance that is projected to an audience with tender care.

I believe that this is one of Elizabeth Montgomery 's best performances in a movie , and I have seen many ! She portrays Lizzie so perfectly, and I wish she could have been given a bit more to do , but the movie just didn't allow it , as it was so rushed . I don't agree with the movie's assessment of what kind of woman she was . Lizzie was a real person, and I have read about her life . The movie shows her as a ditz , which she certainly was not.

the first time I saw this movie, I just thought "what the hell?" a 10-year-old kid driving around bizarre places, meeting bizarre people, going after a game called MOTORAMA! Hell yeah! I enjoyed this movie a lot!Jordan Christopher-Michael is a brilliant young actor! It's a shame he stopped act. He interprets very well his character Gus on the movie.Gus loses an eye, got tattoos and go at the most weird cities acting with Flea, Drew Barrymore and Meat Loaf! Want more? OK, don't even try to understand the story, but why this movie needs one!?

Saw the film at the closing gala of the Ealing Film Festival in West London(England). Enjoyed it immensely. Although the Crow & the Chinese Policeman don't appear, and Dan Milligan becomes Dan Madigan (played by Sean Hughes (I)). The interaction between Dan and the Author (Writer/Director) voiced/played by Lord Richard Attenborough, works very well.The rumour is that Lord Attenborough and Elliott Gould (as Dr. Goldstein) appeared in the film for just a pint of beer.Spike was shown the film, on video before he died and by all accounts enjoyed it immensely.

I love this movie, though I don't like how they picture Egyptians, being an Egyptian citizen myself! that's why it earns an eight out of 10.The relationship between Augustin and the leopard is awkward, and of course because of loneliness and living in that cave for quite so long, he develops a kind of insanity and passion to that leopard.A very touching scene when the leopard dies, watch Augustin's reaction.. All in all I find it enjoyable, and I'm looking forward to reading the short story by Balzac.

The film is n't perfect by any means but despite this it is very fun and amusing to watch . The main thing in the film is its great cast of actors , which includes famous actors such as: Benicio Del Toro ,"Clive Owen" and also features the likes of: Carla Gugino, and Paul Walker . The story is very well written and is filled with some great twists and turns , some of which you may not expect. I don't want to spoil the plot of the movie but I will tell you it's a really good one.

I would say 'Bride of Chucky' is a "return to greatness" but the series was never really great. Very good #1 was, #2-3 were throwaways, and I think this 4th installment is equal to or even better than the first movie. And it contains the best subtitle/tagline: "Chucky Gets Lucky." So he does, in the role of Jennifer Tilly, who thoroughly rejuvenated this series as Jeri Ryan did for 'Star Trek: Voyager.' Tilly didn't just create a presence; she added much needed humor, back-story, drama, tension and a great little sidekick/play-thing for Chucky.

My impression , having seen this documentary , is that Nathaniel Kahn ended up with more questions than he had in the beginning. His Dad was a very private person . It is a little odd in some ways to have seen the film made by a son, a very well-regarded architect, and yet his Dad was very reluctant to be interviewed, and didn’t answer the questions that he was given. I am left with many questions myself. I was struck by the fact that there was very little in this film that dealt with modern art and its relation to Judaism.

I remember years ago BBC1 used to show this movie in a very cut form. I tracked it down on video a couple of years ago and viewed it again. The film although slow and slightly odd (the mountain men look very strange) the atmosphere was eerily effective. It's one of my favorite slasher films and I have no idea where an uncut version can be found. Currently deleted everywhere (except the USA where it was accidentally put on a horror compilation!). It's a shame you cannot get this movie as it was meant to be seen.

The Golden Door is the story of a Sicilian family 's journey from the Old World ( Italy ) to the New World ( America ) told in three acts and set against the background of an America that has been changed by immigration in ways that the immigrants themselves never imagined. The play is concerned with the dreams and ambitions of those who come to America in search of the "golden door" that opens the world for them. This is a beautiful production of a lovely classic that should not be missed. Please note: This play contains adult themes and subject matter.

I wonder why I have n't heard of this movie before . It 's truly a magnificent comedy ( I am so glad it 's on Netflix now ) and it 's so funny and I 've watched it with my parents and we all laughed at the end . I 'm 9 and I 'm on grade 4 and I think I should write a review on this comedy because it's so great that I should tell people to watch it . This comedy really shows you what is the real definition of family. What I liked about this movie was that it 's such a great comedy and you can relate to it.

As I have said before , I am NOT a fan of Tweety . He 's just so aggravating I can't even begin to explain . But hey, he 's got to get paid and I hope he is able to get his life back on track, whatever that is. http://news.sky.com/story/tweety-mack-found-wife-dead-with-two-guns-in-his-hands-10809325
It's not hard to make sense of it when you see it on the news, so why would one have to be a genius to find out? I have a friend that went through this and I am pretty sure he's a genius.

I 've been a fan of Rachael 's since the beginning of 30MM on the Food Network , so I was really looking forward to the new show. I watched the premier last Monday night. After a little bit I started to get a bit uncomfortable . Rachael was being so mean to the contestants. The show is still in the test run phase, so let's see what they do with it . I guess it was a bad night, but it was not good. I've seen Rachael's other shows, and this is not her.

Final Solution is a powerful christian film that shows the hate between the black and whites that was present in the 1940's in America. The film takes place in Memphis and shows how the blacks in the city were treated back in the early 40's, when it was still segregated. In the film there is a man name Mr. Turner who owns a grocery store. Mr. Turner is a very fair man who tries to please all of his customers and does everything he can to try and make things run as smoothly as possible for all of his customers.

`` Showtime '' is a funny film starring funnymen Robert DeNiro ( Meet the Parents , A Bronx Tale ) and Eddie Murphy ( Beverly Hills Cop , Vampire in Brooklyn ). When I was growing up, the two stars were always paired as comedy duos. Now they star together in a comedy. The premise of the film is that DeNiro plays a Broadway director of plays who wants to start a sitcom, so he decides to hire the most popular, famous comic on the scene to help him write the show and also be in it. Murphy fits the bill perfectly for that role.

A very suspenseful giallo from the director of "L'Anticristo"(1974),this one begins with a brilliantly-handled sequence involving a priest,a little girl,and a broken doll.However the main story is about maniac(David Warbeck)marrying a traumatized cripple to kill her for her money.The plot,whilst not original,is really suspenseful,the acting is good and there are several skillful and gory murders.The score by Francesco de Massi is quite effective,some of which can also be heard in Lucio Fulci's "The New York Ripper"(1982).Highly recommended for fans of Italian cinema!
