I think the writer did expect the audience that there is a season 3 coming.I just hope the next season will give light to more unclear/hanging events that were happened.Just can't wait further for season 3.

The Buddy Holly Story opens on a shot of a yellow neon moon on the roof of a roller rink. In the following scene in a recording studio Buddy sits with his producer and record company manager as he is told he’ll never amount to anything unless he starts to sing with a country influence, to which he replies, and I quote, “If I’m not doing rock ‘n’ roll I might as well just shoot myself” and there the whole story begins. The Buddy Holly Story tells the story of what Buddy’s life was like up to the point where his career ended.

LOL.The mere fact that I start off my review with 'lol' says it all. I used to watch this movie all the time as a kid; and even then I sensed the silliness of it all. The low budget, horrible acting and lame script was ever apparent back then. I watched it again yesterday and just couldn't stop laughing. It's so bad it's actually good lol. Like another reviewer said, it doesn't take itself seriously. There's no way one could look at this movie and say that the makers did so.

Certainly one of the most hilarious films of all time . Excellent original music , clever , heady ... it's a must for all to watch
Reviewed by james-jones 9 / 10
The Greatest of its kind. The Greatest Film EVER !!!! This is a film which should never have gone into the ground for so long before the world was able to witness this piece of pure comedic brilliance. This film is so good, it should be in the top 10 highest-rated films on IMDB, and should always be on any 'top ten' lists.

Little Gus is a ten year old delinquent . He runs away from his parents and decides to go on a journey . The story follows him as he encounters a host of strange characters and creatures along the way. During the journey, Little Gus encounters a few friends and also enemies. He meets an old woman who offers him food , drinks and clothes. Little Gus then meets a witch, an ogre and a giant. But the most important and interesting character of the story is a talking cat. They start talking to each other.

When the trailer for Accepted first came up, many people began to get excited about seeing it... really excited. Who could blame them, it looked like fun. But that's exactly the thing. People went into Accepted looking for a good movie, but if you think about it, Accepted isn't the type of film destined to be a good movie. It's meant to be a film that pleases its crowd without too much effort being given. That being said, for those of you who expected a great film, you need to think about what could be made of a comedy like this one.

Frank Langella steals my heart in everything he has ever been in ! I love watching him ! ! i just can't wait for this film to come out here in the uk ! so excited !! i loved him as the older batman in the nolan trilogy. he was good in goodnight, and good luck. He was awesome in "Good Night and Good Luck." I can't wait for "Robin Hood." He's one of those people that I always think "I'd like to know him, if I could".

When his elderly mother Emily (Jeanne Bates) is attacked by her lodger Nestor Duvalier (Brion James) and turns into a cannibalistic monster, TV news reporter Clay Dwyer (Mark Thomas Miller) struggles to keep dear old mom from satisfying her hunger.Although the above plot summary conjures up images of trashy, over-the-top, 80s horror titles such as Flesheating Mothers and Rabid Grannies, Mom actually turns out to be a refreshingly original take on the werewolf/vampire/zombie mythos (exactly what Emily becomes is never really clear, but it ain't nice!

I never thought I'd say this about a biopic, but there is a near over-abundance of characterization (especially concerning Kenji Miyazawa's emotions) and too little on the literal occurrences in his life--by the end, I'm not sure if he dies (he's supposed to), or if his sister finally dies (she's supposed to), or if the director spent a little too much time on the Galactic Railroad (that's an inside joke, in case you missed it--Miyazawa wrote a children's book called Night on the Galactic Railroad).

Lost has been one of the most mesmerizing and thrilling experience I've ever seen. Not only it's the mother of coincidence, but also every time that you think you can set up the whole puzzle in your head, the story takes a completely new direction.Take this casualty for example, The US marine, whom gives Sayid the way to become a Torturer, Is Clancy Brown, playing a character named Joe Inman. In the last episode, he is playing Kelvin Inman, the Desmond partner in the Hatch. Destiny, uh?

My friends and went through a period of time when we would rent movies that none of us had ever heard of. These were usually foreign films that you couldn’t find in the theater. The goal was to see as many as you could in the shortest amount of time, and they would have to be movies that none of us had any clue about. This was before the days of Google, so we had to do a lot of detective work, looking up film reviews and synopses, and then going to our local video store to rent these films.

Ever since they first came to the Outer Banks and filmed the movie ( I have lived here my whole life), they never seemed to leave, or maybe they did, and came back, but I don't remember that. I just know it's always summer out here for them. It's the best job ever. Now I'm not complaining ( I have a cranky 2.5 year-old son who is driving everyone around me insane today). I just find it hard to believe that this is the first time they've come to my town and filmed this particular movie.

I always liked this movie, I have seen it so many times but I always enjoyed it :) the story is interesting and special. But the only thing I have to disagree with is that I don't think Max lived in a Romanian monastery or what was that :P They don't look that way in Romania.. Anyway, back to the story, Ghita Muresan played pretty well but as someone said before me, his English needs to improve. And there were some funny moments and some tragical/sad parts too. It worths being seen, I thought it was sweet that the giant wanted to find his love.

Telling the story wouldn't be the point at all, would it? Barnens ö, spelled almost like "booné aww" is the title for that brilliant novel of the late seventies that shocked a lot of people, including myself.Children's Island is the title, and what an island. In the book, Raine, the main character has The Guiness World Record Book as his own Bible. And he's keen on breaking new records himself. In particular the youngest person under water for three minutes.The story is, as most Swedish films and books of the time, deep, consciously provocative and awe inspiring.

Documentaries in which sons and daughters seek to understand a parent and, by the process, their own lives are not that uncommon. Also not uncommon are results that reflect lack of talent, a failure of introspection, an abundance of narcissism and, perhaps, an unsubtle quest for publicly-splashed revenge for countless past hurts, real and fantasized. What is unusual is a brilliant, fair and engrossing portrait of a fascinating parent and "My Architect: A Son's Journey" is that rare achievement.Louis Kahn emigrated to this country as a child, his face irreparably and brutally scarred by an accident.

Really, This movie should be released to DVD. I just got a bootleg copy of what I think was a studio film and I was utterly pleased!!! It was on my list of films to own simply because of the cast. Three of my PEOPLE, Michael York, Olivia Hussey. Both having been in Romeo & Juliet, and also John Gielghud. sorry about the bad spelling, were in there so on that alone I thought that for the small amount I was spending it would be fine. Boy was I right.

Jack, Sawyer and Sayid swim to the boat and find a completely wasted Desmond. His traumatic past experience before sailing to the island is disclosed through flashbacks. Sayid plots a plan with Jack to surprise "The Others" in case Michael is double-crossing the group. John Locke convinces Desmond to invade the hatch, which is protected by Mr. Eko, and not press the button of the computer to see what will happen.This episode is one of the best of the Second Season. Unfortunately, we lovers of "Lost" can see the lack of respect the producers of this stunning series have with the fans.

Has the proliferation of relatively high quality shows on the proliferating TV networks made it possible for people to produce more and better television shows in the independent marketplace? If you think about the sheer number of cable networks that are in existence (and the number is increasing), and the fact that they are spending a lot more money to produce these shows (and pay for them as well), I’m guessing the answer may be yes. In my mind, this trend has been in the works for years, as the proliferation of channels has been the norm for a decade or so now.

Chucky's back...and it's about time! This time, with the help of Jennifer Tilly and a little spell from Voodoo For Dummies. Well, at least with this installment, the camp is back. This was the more gruesome of this series, so far. It has some good twists and some good action scenes. This one was by far, the most fun of the series, and successfully, if unintentionally, bridges the gap between pure horror to horror/comedy. I am looking forward to Seed of Chucky. It'll be a hoot!

The A-team is still repeating every day on Dutch television (RTL7, around 1800hrs) and I still watch it! I don't like the A-Team... I absolutely adore them!! It is just great to see Justin chasing the former members of A-Team. Brings back memories from the old days, when I was young an sweet. I would have given you a 10 for excellent, but Justin looks like he is chasing the former A-Team members all by himself. Of course, that is the only bad thing on this documentary.

Double Shock is one of the many good Columbo episodes which reaches the level of a good movie.It has all the elements of a good suspense story and Columbo makes the most of it. The first part of this 1 hour 20 minute episode is set in a high-end New York restaurant.The camera does not linger unnecessarily on luxurious settings, which makes the episode doubly more realistic. It has a good murder mystery in the second half to keep the audience hooked.But the first half is the real draw of the episode because it contains one of the most gripping opening scenes of the entire series.

Great movie. Post-apocalyptic films kick ass. This one is no exception. Kept up the pace and interest without a speck of dialogue (mainly through some good character development). The fight between Reno and the Hero was tight. I also liked the use of cave paintings and medieval-like weapons to show how primitive and savage mankind had become without their technology and guzzaline. The connection between the beginning and end was a little spacey, that is, I had a hard time understanding the distances between the hotel and the opening sequence.

I never heard of architect , Louis Kahn , until this documentary . In this almost two hour documentary which I highly recommend you watch on Netflix , you learn a great deal about a man who lived most of his life in obscurity . He died broke , he had very few students , and his buildings while they look beautiful today , they were not very well received by most people during his lifetime . However , Kahn had a passion and he poured his entire being , his entire life into architecture and his passion shows through the beauty of many of his buildings.

Remember that this came out before Gulf War I, which gave us Werner Herzog's "Lessons of Darkness".Le Dernier Combat is not "Sci Fi". It's more like Judgment. I've watched it at least a dozen times. It really is a fitting companion to Herzog's "Lessons of Darkness": "And in that time, men will seek death, but they will not find it, for death will flee from them. "That someday, alas, may be today, in Iraq.

Another great Tom Wilkinson performance punctuates `` Separate Lies , '' a 2005 film also starring Emily Watson , Linda Bassett and Simon Callow. The film is set in a London apartment, where a murder is committed in the early hours of an August morning. Based on a novel by Keith Ridgway , the movie is filled with intriguing twists and turns. But, more than that, it is an exploration of the way we perceive events. The movie's title refers to the difference between what we think we know about the events and what the facts reveal in the days and weeks that follow a traumatic occurrence.

probably the best horror movie in 5 years .. there 's been lame remakes , attempts to make you scared , but this movie was so much better . If you have not seen it . I really enjoyed the ending of this movie, it was very unexpected. I'm usually not a fan of horror movies but this is one of the better ones. I thought the characters were developed and I was really into it. It's a must see if you're not a sissy! Very good movie, not as good as the first but still enjoyable!

They Made Me a Criminal is a remake of an earlier Warner Brothers film , The Life of Jimmy Dolan , directed by J.P. McGowan and released in . This version is directed by Michael Curtiz (Casablanca ) from a script by Lenore Coffee and Ben Hecht (Scarface; The Front Page ). The film was the first collaboration between Humphrey Bogart (Casablanca; To Have And Have Not) and Edward G. Robinson (Key Largo; The Ten Commandments ). The film is set in 1919, a time of social upheaval and discontent.

Whoever plays the part of J. Douglas Williamson in the strip poker scene does a wonderful job . He apparently was an actor/singer/musician. I wish I knew what he was up to these days so I could check him out. There's a link to the full version of the show here. You have to pay $1.50 to get it but if that's all you're after, go for it. If you want to watch all of it, however, you will need to pay $15 for a month-long membership to "Blu-Jew".

Just about every commentator has mentioned the way that some of the interview footage is superposed over the concert footage in this movie. There are two basic reasons for this. Firstly, the interviews help the audience to understand and appreciate what the musicians are going through when they are on stage. And secondly it gives the audience a little more background to the band and what they have been through over the years. The interviews show the group as a family and it makes the viewers feel as though they are a part of it all.

Jack , Sawyer and Sayid swim to the boat and find a completely wasted Desmond . His traumatic past experience has returned and he hallucinates about his past with Penelope, but she is now dead and he does not even remember her anymore. Sawyer and Jack try to convince him that Penelope is not real and to wake up, but he is completely entranced and does not want to. Jack then goes to Hurley to find out if they've been monitoring the radio transmissions, but he has not. When asked why Jack says that the transmissions have become too strange and that he doesn't believe that they can be trusted.

I've seen the 1973 movie Lost Horizons and read many of the reviews for this movie. I agree the move had many opportunities for improvement but unlike all those who are looking for the perfect movie with the perfect songs and the best acting, I was looking for something a bit different and this movie gave it to me. I watched this movie not as a critic but as a person looking for a little hope, a little cheer, a bit of a release from my everyday life, and this is what I got.

Then again, I like Rachael Ray. She is fun, sweet, fresh, and such a joy to watch. I have to alter just about everything she makes as I am a vegetarian...but it's great to see her with a program that shows more of her personality. After all, she is a television personality. I think it's cool that she is so inviting with her fans and still appears to be down-to-earth. The studio audience appears to be rather small, but that just makes for a cozier environment. Some people have posted that the show sucks.

Right this may be the wine talking but this could be the best movie I 've seen in a very long time. The movie is a must see if you are not afraid to get a bit of laugh. This movie may not have been for the kiddies but they would love it also. If you don't have a sense of humor then you won't find this movie amusing. I have to say that the entire cast is outstanding. The movie will have you rolling in the aisles and the story will keep you interested till the last minute.

The `` old dark house '' sub-genre that dominated the early talkies rarely fails to disappoint when we re-view the films 60 or 70 years down the line, and The Hurricane is no exception. The idea of a movie featuring a hurricane that lasts for several days with no electricity or water was a novelty in 1937 and still looks like one to most modern viewers who are used to hurricanes appearing in the first few minutes of a disaster flick, usually with a major city in the path, and vanishing again just as quickly.

**1/2 Elisha Cuthbert, Chad Michael Murray, Brian Van Holt, Paris Hilton and Jon Abrahams. Directed by Jaume Collet-Serra.Yet another classic horror film remade with dunder-headed teenage acting despite grizzly and creative deaths. Based on the 1953 Vincent Price film House of Wax where a maniac kills unsuspecting teenage hooligans and turns them into priceless wax figures. Still with the fantastic set design to make the whole house into wax the movie is a typical classic horror remake like Tobe Hooper's 1974 classic Texas Chainsaw Massacre later remade, despite creativity and so-so acting the movie was still just a gore picture.

Lucio Fulci 's `` Do n't Torture a Duckling '' paints an exceptionally unflattering portrait of small-town Sicily plagued by both corruption and crime. The film centers around three murders of women, the victims of which all happen to have been found naked, strangled, and tortured. When local reporter Andrea (Andrea Allesandro) comes to investigate, he learns that there are those who might be interested in seeing justice served, but also others that might be more interested in silencing any potential scandal about their misdealings. This is the 10th film from the director, but the first to appear outside of the Italian horror genre.

Made at the height of the Black Power movement, this movie portrays African-American Putney Swope (Arnold Johnson) getting made CEO of a corporation after the white CEO dies (the white executives all hate each other and can't decide who should succeed the previous CEO). Once in power, he decides to turn it into a militant organization.I don't know how Robert Downey Sr did it, but he did it! "Putney Swope" is the ultimate jab at America's power structure. It's the sort of thing that seems like it would have come out of Richard Pryor's mind.

Despite of all the negative criticism I really enjoyed this movie . I am not saying this lightly . I loved how it was directed, the music was amazing ,the actors were excellent and the storyline was amazing. A lot of people are giving it bad reviews because of the plot, I think the plot was awesome, the characters are likeable and it really is one of the best action movies ever made. It was a really great movie, I love the way it was filmed and the actors were perfect for their roles. I really liked everything about it.

These critics need to find a new job!!! This movie is based on a TRUE STORY, which has made history. It illustrates beautifully how even in the mist of war and tragedy love can conquer all. The breathtaking Chephallonia of Greece has captured my heart and soul as if I too were there. The Blue eyed Cage & the delightful Cruz were amazing! Together they perfectly portrayed how a Mediterranean couple can only become closer in the time of war. This movie will touch your heart like it did mine you must go see it!!! !

It was Libby talking to Desmond in the flashback, and if anyone is confused about her past (like how did she end up in the same hospital Hurley was in) then you should know that despited Libby dying in season 2, the character will be explored more in season 3 and we will get answers to questions surrounding her.BTW, great episode. It had a really great cliffhanger and some interesting questions...like what happened to Eko and Lock and what about the four toe statue?I cannot wait till season 3, Lost just rules!!!

Ross Hunter's musical remake of the 1937 fantasy, based on James Hilton's enduring bestseller, was written off by critics and audiences almost immediately in 1973, sounding off a backlash against musicals in general that gave the genre a bad reputation in Hollywood for years. Group of disparate British and American individuals end up on an emergency flight out of a war-torn Asian country, but their plane is hijacked and crashes in a snowy mountain terrain; a rescue party arrives and leads the group to an isolated community called Shangri-La, where the sun is always shining and most of the residents are youthful and blissfully content.

William H. Macy always gives a good performance . He never looks lazy and never seems like he 'd rather be anywhere else. This is one of those movies where the actors really look the part they're playing and I believe that their personalities match those of their characters. It was also very funny, with great one liners. The ending is very sweet and I'm so glad that it worked out in the end. This is definitely worth a watch for anyone who is looking for a sweet movie. This is one of my favorite rom-coms of all time.

This is without a doubt the most stunning and amazing documentary I have ever seen ! The images that are captured by the camera are breathtaking ! I just can't stop looking at this ! A must watch for everyone ! I'll be watching this in a few hours.. I just hope this doesn't trigger a migraine I had this happen with a video last night. I just watched this in one sitting. It was amazing. It also made me very emotional. The imagery was beautiful, and this is one video I know I'll watch again.

The movie is incredible, it has a sound track which sets the tone for the movie. THe lines in the movie are great, such as "Nothings to good for out friends" and "Its collection time Charlie collection time." I can watch this movie over and over again and still laugh because the lines and action are one of a kind. I feel that when i watch this movie I want to go out and shoot down bad guys, If there is a movie that you don't want to miss its this one.

"Head" is a film that has held up well since its original release date in 1968. The movie is a complete contradiction of the Monkees image. It presents the Monkees in a way their fans never perceived them; men with real thoughts. Totally controlled by their producers, the Monkees were given the opportunity to tell their side of the story. The film pokes fun at their image, the entertainment industry, and corporate America. The soundtrack contains some of their best music. It's a movie well worth seeing over and over again.

This series has a lot going for it with beautiful footage of the some of the most impressive underwater environments on this planet. Being a staggering five years in the making, one would be hard-pressed to expect any less. I did get the impression that some scenes from the first episode where repeated in the latter ones, which is naturally only a minor gripe.David Attenborough is great as a narrator and comments are informative, leaving enough room for one's imagination, and well spaced out, so that viewers get plenty of time to reflect upon the breathtaking imagery.

"Back in the Day" is an interesting, but flawed effort. Ja Rule stars as Reggie Cooper, a honest but sad man trying to cope with the death of his father. He meets his old friend J-Bone (Ving Rhames) who tries to force Reggie into a life of crime. Reggie also falls in love with Alica (Tatyana Ali) who is the preacher's daughter. Now he has to choose: Love Or Crime.Ja Rule does a competent job as Reggie. At least he's trying to act. Ving Rhames is perfect as J-Bone.

The Snowqueen is one of the best love stories I have ever seen : much better and deeper than Luhrman´s Romeo&Juliet, for instance. And if you don’t like to see a sad story, well… just don’t watch it, simple as that. I´m sure it won’t ruin you as much as the last Harry Potter movie: it will just show you another face of love, as you’ve seen it before, only much worse. But you’ll like it, I am quite sure of that.

I know this movie isn't for everyone, and I won't push my opinions on you, but what I have to say is the truth about how many people feel about this movie...It was the best I have ever seen!!! It was soooooooooooooooooo funny, and even though it wasn't the scariest movie I had ever seen, it kept me on the edge of my seat, because I didn't know what was gonna happen next. If you like funny scary movies, you have got to see this one!

I viewed the original Outer Limits in real time , when first broadcast and have since viewed the entire original series many times on TV and video. I will never forget the opening music of that series. In 1964, I was a sophomore at the University of Wisconsin in Madison. It was the only TV station in town at the time which allowed students to buy time on the commercial-free educational channel. I got the time to do a weekly science-oriented program which was titled The Outer Limits. The show featured segments about space exploration, science news and science fiction films.

Whoever plays the part of J. Douglas Williamson in the strip poker scene does a wonderful job. He apparently received no credits. Too bad.All the Dead End Kids do their jobs beautifully in this 1939 entry. It is odd to watch them in a Western setting with their Brooklyn accents ( I guess that should be Bowery ). They even show some swimming abilities.I think there are many special scenes that can stay with the viewer of this boxing/love/crime story. My favorite right now is in the fight scene near the end of the film.

Remember that this came out before Gulf War I , which gave us Werner Herzog 's `` Lessons of Darkness '' and the inevitable reversion to the Iraqi-in-their-underpants theme of `` B-roll Iraq .'' One of these two films is an extraordinary documentary, and I have no idea which. If you think that you know the story of the Persian Gulf War , you are wrong . This film is not a documentary in the Michael Moore sense, and I can't really tell you how to react to it. That is, I think it's important and provocative, but not in any way I'd like.

OK, so this film may not have won any Oscars, but it is not a bad film. The original "D.O.A." is undoubtedly a better film, but that does not mean this film is bad.The film stars Dennis Quaid in one of his early roles, when he was first becoming really famous, after "The Right Stuff" made him a star, and a very lovely looking Meg Ryan, when she was still now quite famous.This is more of an "update" of the 1950 film, rather than a remake, since the setting is different and the characters too, are different.

I was about 14 years old as I saw the musical version of Lost Horizon. I loved the film so much as well as the songs that I went several times to the cinema to see it again and again. My mother bought the LP and I learnt the songs off by heart, just as I did with "The sound of Music" (which people hardly know in Austria). I think the problem with some of these self-appointed critics who's comments get published is that they don't have a romantic soul and didn't see the film through the eyes of a young teenager.

Belonging to the subgenre of post-apocalyptic future films , it is a stylistic and very very intimate installment . The story begins on a planet in which there was a nuclear war and now there are no other human beings living, but a small family . The story focuses on the relationship between the mother and her children , one of whom is an autistic little girl and the other is a very intelligent little boy . One day they discover that they are still surviving thanks to the technology of a spaceship that has come to them from an unknown planet .

Who ARE the people that star in this thing ? Never heard of them ! ! But this is one of the most funniest and hilarious movie I have seen in a long time . It had me laughing out loud the whole time, I can't say enough good things ! ! ! I'm not even gonna try. Great cast. Excellent script and directing. This movie has a special charm. The whole cast are so good. I recommend this movie. This is the kind of movie, which gains its popularity on word of mouth.

The revelation here is Lana Turner's dancing ability. Though she was known privately to be an excellent nightclub and ballroom dancer, Miss Turner rarely got the opportunity to demonstrate this ability on film.So, viewers take notice! Here, MGM were clearly still trying to determine in what direction they would develop the still young starlet, and were, therefore, consigning her to everything from Andy Hardy to Doctor Kildaire.In "Two Girls on Broadway," however, she is given an excellent opportunity to display her native rhythm and ability to shift tempo in the lavish production number, "My Wonderful One, Let's Dance."

Unconditional Love is one of the best movies I 've seen in a while . It 's an emotional roller-coaster ride that I would recommend to anyone! The best part about this film is that it is a true story. As you watch this movie all your emotions are stirred. Ryan O ' Neal and John Hurt are excellent actors and they portray their characters brilliantly. Whenever I watch John Hurt I always think of his great performance in the 1981 film Chariot's. In 1991 he also won an Emmy Award for this role! Unconditional Love is about an elderly woman who has dementia.

A beautifully photographed and paced short film. It evocatively captures the feeling of this family and much of the country during the period just prior to and after Pearl Harbor.I appreciated the visual look of the film -- naturalistic and simultaneously poetic. Great work by a great D.P., David Boyd.Though a family film, the story never becomes maudlin or saccharin. We understand and believe the motivation that propels the young boy on his odyssey. I understand the love of the younger brother for his older brother and do not question why he sets out to do what he does.

This Oscar-winning short film (40 minutes), based on a short story by William Faulkner, takes us back to small-town Tennessee in December 1941. Two brothers, one about 18 and one about 8 are looking for birds eggs (obviously a huge collectors item for boys in the South around this time). Well, the Japanese bomb Pearl Harbor and the older brother, Pete, decides to enlist. He gives his prize egg to his little brother, Willie and heads off wishing to show more emotion and tenderness to his little acolyte.

Another great Tom Wilkinson performance punctuates "Separate Lies," a 2005 film also starring Emily Watson, Linda Bassett and Rupert Everett. Directed by Julian Fellowes, it's the story of a married couple, James and Ann Manning where the husband (Wilkinson) believes he and his wife (Watson) are happy together. An accident near their house on the night they have a party brings the police around. It is a hit and run that killed their maid Maggie's Bassett) husband. James becomes suspicious of a neighbor, Bill Bule (Everett) when he sees some damage on his car.

Being American , I have not been exposed to this character before , which is good because some of you are aware of the disgustingly racist character called "Apu" from The Simpsons. In the movie "Ralph Breaks the Internet " this character was featured . A few weeks ago, I was asked if I wanted to attend a special screening of this movie, so I said yes! It was a great movie. I liked all of the references that were placed in this movie and I really enjoyed it. It was hilarious. If you are planning on watching this movie , I highly recommend it.

After spotting the boat at the end of the previous episode ( `` Three Minutes '' ) , the survivors prepare for the long-awaited rescue mission. But, as we've seen, that's no easy task, given that the survivors have no radio, there are no flares in the raft, nor is there a boat nearby. All this and more, as we continue with the survivor saga , and get a look at what's in store for the week to come, in ABC's drama series `` LOST ,'' on Thursday, April 26, 2007 at 9 pm., ET.

* May Contain Spoilers * The first time I saw this movie was when it was re-released on video when The Lion King came out. The second time was when Disney started to re-release some of their animated classics and put them on the same DVD as Lion King. The last time I watched it was when I purchased the 2-Disc Edition when it was released in September of this year. The reason why this is a 3 star movie and not 2 star is because it has a great story and an important message for today's youth.

All the characters in this cartoon were hilarious . Norman the Viking guardian had some memorable phrases and the skull face guy was so funny. The only downside is the limited amount of storyline and that it ends abruptly without any real conclusion. I'll be looking to watch this cartoon series again in the future. I have high hopes for it . If you enjoy adventure cartoons this cartoon was worth it for you. There are so many cartoon options nowadays, but I'm glad I chose to watch this one in particular. I would love to know what you guys thought of it.

Loved today 's show ! ! ! It was a variety and not solely cooking ( which would have been boring ! ! ! ) I'm sorry you didn't win but hey, life goes on . Wishing you and your husband the very best in 2014 ! ! ! Hugs and God bless ! Good Luck to you, your husband & your daughter in 2014. Hope it will be better than 2013. Thank you for your kind words on my last post. Hope you have a good weekend ahead. Aww sorry to hear it went that way!

Sacha Baron Cohen is a genius. And this movie is good! Although the film doesn't nearly reach the quality of the tv-show, it's still very funny and has some seriously wicked moments! I've liked Ali G since the first time I saw the material from the show. I think he's one of the best comedy characters of all time.. up there with say, Peter Dragon ("Action") and The Blues Brothers. Biggest surprise with this film was that they've actually got some serious actors to do it (Dance and Gambon).

The big names in film tried to do their part for the war effort, and Charlie Chaplin was no exception. This patriotic and propagandist picture is part of his contribution, although the war was nearly over by the time of its release. The tramp goes to war, humorously accomplishes acts of heroism and kicks the Kaiser in the bum. It's a very funny film, although I don't think it nearly one of his best. It's with 'A Dog's Life' as his better output for First National before he made his early masterpiece 'The Kid.'

Ali G earned his fame on the small screen - though the big screen has not lost him any kudos either. Ali G Indahouse is a hilarious laugh-a-second fun fest - just like on the small screen. He has lost none of his character or stupidity at all, and behind all that - none of the film is brainless fluff either. A human side to Ali is revealed during the film, the idea of Ali G running for PM is a brilliant, fresh and funny one - and the incessant stupidity of Staines' gangster man is mixed well with the stern, harsh world that is politics.

I saw this movie when it first came out in 1973 and loved it . Since then I 've searched the internet and the local bookstores to find that particular book but could not find it in either bookstores or the interent . Can some one tell me what the title might be please ? Re: Searching for the title of a 1950's black and white film with a woman as a nurse. There are no credits in the film you are looking for. The best you could do is contact IMDb and ask if anyone there knows.

I first saw `` Signs of Life '' on PBS as an American Playhouse presentation . It 's a wonderfully crafted production of a simple story told with a minimum of dialogue and a maximum of mime and body language, and is one of the most memorable plays I have ever seen. Both the writing and acting are superb. The story involves a family that returns to the house in which a young daughter died many years ago. Their return brings back old memories and painful reminder of the past. I think that every family should see this play.

by TyNesha Mells. In this drama, Ja Rule, who stars as Reggie, struggles with the loss of his father. His old friend J-Bone, who is a cold-blooded thug recently released from prison, helps Reggie find who murdered his father. A week after his dad died, a preacher, Reverend Packer, came up dead. Reggie was suppose to be the one to kill him, but did he? Did Reggie kill Reverend Packer or was it some type of a setup? Back in the Day also has a couple of romantic scenes.

In this era when almost everything makes it on to DVD ( I 'm expecting to see the My Mother the Merciless Mother series, which aired on HBO in the late 1970's, any day now), it may have seemed like an unusual move to make a film on vinyl record and tape. It is certainly not the first such film (see the work of Andy Warhol), but there have not been that many that I can think of that have actually come out on such formats. There are a few out there, however.

The thing with Ali G is that he takes the mick out of himself and his character . The humour is more of a self-deprecating slap in the face than what we get with most characters in this type of show. As a kid growing up in a house where there was little money and the parents had been brought up as working-class folk and as a result of the poverty and the struggle to pay bills they were quite tight and did not allow many luxuries (like a TV, which we got for my sisters wedding and which has been there ever since).

I agree that this is ONE of the very best episodes of the entire series--my only detraction would be the somewhat jarring appearance of Mark Lenard as the Romulan Commander. My reasoning is this--if you were not around for the first run of this episode, then you know Mr. Lenard as Sarek, Spock's father. And for the 2nd generation Trekkie (or Trekker--your preference) it takes you out of the scene at first. Yet he's an excellent commander as well as opposite for our captain and this episode is strongly written and well-acted by all.

Forget Easy Rider - Head is THE film about the 1960s.Almost laugh: as the Monkees reduce their entire career to a one-minute TV commercial about dandruff! See: the 50 foot Victor Mature try to figure out what the heck he's doing in this film! Hear: Frank Zappa (with his pet cow on leash) tell Davey Jones "Your music is awfully white"! Experience: the Monkees' only live performance as a real rock band play the honest-to-gosh first-ever real punk-rock song (Circle Sky)! Listen: as Davey Jones sings a Harry Nielsen song about having a transsexual father!

We loved this movie because it was so entertaining and off beat -- Not your usual Hollywood drivel.My husband had never seen it before, but we loved it so much he's bought two copies now! This is one of our all time favorite movies, it's one that we watch over and over again! The acting is superb, the story is great! You have to see it! I just loved this movie! My husband and I laughed so hard. I bought this one for my father for Christmas and we all enjoyed it. This was such a funny movie!

I am a long time fan of Luc Besson 's work , and for about as long as I 've been a film fan, there 's been talk about an English language version of "Leon " which is my all time favourite film of his. Unlike some of his other films "Leon " has never really had an American version made , it has been a constant source of discussion by film fans that Besson 's film should get an American remake , and I 'm sure there was one in the late 90 's that never saw the light of day .

Despite all the hoopla about THE TROUBLE WITH TRIBBLES episode , THE BALANCE OF TERROR might just be the best TOS episode. Kirk has the Enterprise in trouble. He has no way to communicate with any other Starship. He can't trust the local aliens at all because they may be a threat or spies. Scotty and his team are trapped on a planet and the away team that went to get them are gone. There is only 23 minutes of footage in the episode and it's a great tribute to the art of story telling in a science fiction show.

Let 's be fair : there are no RULES for scriptwriting , so I wo n't say the movie SHOULD HAVE BEEN like this or that . However , what I 'm doing is to make a commentary on how I feel about the movie . Now , if I were to say this movie is great , that means I 'm a big fan of it . And if I say it s a good movie , that means , it's worth to be seen . And if I say it 's a mediocre movie , it means I don 't think it 's worth the money to see it .

I believe that this is one of Elizabeth Montgomery's best performances in a movie, and I have seen most of her movies.I saw this for the first time on television when I was around fourteen, and I was so scared.I watch this movie every now and then, and I still enjoy it very much.I know that these days that this movie would probably not scare people too much.That just goes to show that the public movie and television audience has seen too much graphic violence in the last thirty years or so.I love movies that do not show the graphic details, you let your imagination do the work for you.

Another go round with the monkey king going west....sort of.Beginning in the middle of some action the movie just goes from the first frame onward.A monk and his three disciples go to a town to get the sacred suras that will bring peace to the world once they are translated and spoken to the world.But an evil force has intervened and kidnapped all of the children of the town. The evil force wants the monk because if you eat him you will live forever. The retainers battle the forces of darkness before forcibly sending the monk off for safety (The monk thinks he can win simply by reasoning with the bad guys).

We saw La Spettatrice at the Syracuse International Film & Video Festival & liked it.This film delved into the fear of change in our society as well as in ourselves. I liked the film, even though I didn’t like the main character at all. This is a film you’re likely to see again. A few months ago I read about a film festival and decided to look up some of the films on the website and see if any looked interesting. This is one of those films. It was nominated for the Short Film award at the festival.

This is one of my favorite films, ever. The story is just so fantastic and the characters are so good. Unlike the other Disney films of the age, this film never bores the audience. 101 Dalmations, Peter Pan, Robin Hood, they were all good, but lack what we have here. This is funny, creative, and always on target. This movie just has an extra something that you can't learn in books. However, this is not the best animated film ever made. That title belongs to the BRILLIANT Toy Story.

where do we go from here ? that is the overriding question of this film . And make no mistake about it : this is a question that the director wants you to think about seriously and deeply . This movie is not made to entertain you and give you the satisfaction of a happy ending. The film starts out by showing us that this guy , who is obviously one of the most powerful of the world , has lost everything . It makes no difference that he's still very rich and powerful , because his wife has left him .

Lucio Fulci, later known for his graphic horror films like The Beyond and Zombie, was years earlier a master of the Italian giallo (in the company of Argento and Bava) with films like A Lizard In A Woman's Skin and his masterpiece, Don't Torture A Duckling. This film has all the elements of the Italian mystery/thriller genre known as the giallo, but really pulls the viewers in by having each key character with a skeleton in his/her own closet. This keeps you doing as much detective work as the detectives in the film itself. Who is killing the young boys in town?

NIGHTS IN RODANTHE brings back to the screen two talented actors in Diane Lane and Richard Gere in a simply beautiful romantic story. It is the first film in which Diane and Richard Gere worked together in 20 years. The story unfolds along the North Carolina shore where Diane Lane plays Marianne, an unmarried 38 year woman, working as a waitress to pay her bills and support her young daughter. She takes a job at an inn that is owned by Paul (Richard Gere), and they discover they have a lot in common. As they grow to know each other better, their friendship turns into something deeper.

It amazes me that production companies will sue because of reproductions they will not supply. I've been looking for this movie on DVD for a while and VHS for years. One can get all sorts of movies on line...old movies, new movies... but it all targets a particular group. This movie is very nostalgic for many. I'm not sure why I can't get a copy. Maybe if enough people will write in, the copyright holder will get a clue. It's about time for this to happen. Yes, it's date, but so is The Wizard of OZ.
